author: Travis Brewer
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | My boarding pass said my flight was supposed to be boarding at Gate B5a. But the departure gate was changed to B15 without any notification. I was consequently unaware of this change and missed my flight. The only notification was the departure screen which is barely readable as it is constantly changing. There were no PA announcements, no text messages, no phone calls, apparently no alerts to App holders, but I don’t fly frequently enough to justify it. My friend who helped me book the flight does, but he didn’t give me any warning either so I was unawares. At least they got me another flight, 4 hours later than my scheduled flight.

header: "they were not going to be responsible"
author: M Guarnizo
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta Air Lines broke my luggage that was located in the hold of the plane while I was on an international flight with the airline in question. The value of the suitcase on the market is $180 dollars. When I arrived I immediately claimed at the counter, I showed them the suitcase and they only told me to do it online without receiving any help, they ignored me. Rest for 2 days after you arrive. and I returned to activities in the United States and tried to communicate again and it was impossible. Finally an advisor answered me and the damaged luggage claim page was not working either by cell phone or by a laptop computer. 7 days passed and when I was finally able to make the claim they told me that 7 days had already passed and that for that absurd reason and their platforms were not working they were not going to be responsible for my luggage. They gave me a 100 dollar voucher to travel with them. Who in their 5 senses would travel with that airline after they damage your luggage and then they don't want to pay you for the suitcase and you have to put your money to buy another one when they were the ones who damaged it? DELTA y su persona en una etapa del proceso rompió mi equipaje que iba ubicado en la bodega del avión mientras cursaba un vuelo Internacional con la aerolínea en mención. El valor de la maleta en el mercado es de $ 180 dólares. Cuándo llegué enseguida reclamé en el counter les mostré la maleta y sólo me indicaron que lo hiciera en línea sin recibir ayuda de ningún tipo, se desntendieron. Decanse los 2 dias luego de que llegue. y retorné actividades en Estados Unidos y volví a tratar de comunicarme y fue imposible. Finalmente me contsetó un Asesor y la página de reclamación de equipaje averiado no estaba funcioando ni por ceclular ni por un computador Laptop. pasaron 7 dias y cuando finalmente pude hacer la reclamación me cotestan que ya pasaron 7 días y que por ésa razón absurda y sus plataformas no funcionaban no iba a responder por mi equipaje. Me dieron un bono de 100 dolares para viajar con ellos. ¿Quién en sus 5 sentidos viajaría con ésa aerolinea despues de que estropean tu equipaje y luego no te quieren pagar por la maleta y debes tu poner de tu dinero para comprar otra cuando fueron ellos quién la dañaron?

author: Philip Rome
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Lost my baggage more than a week ago and no answer. Terrible service, employees don’t care and super frustrating that I will need to sue for such a small issue that they are unable to fix.

author: Teresa Vaghi
reviewBody: Not Verified | I honestly would give negative 5 stars if I could. On 30th June, Delta cancelled our flight and couldn’t get us on another flight for 3 days. I have emailed them multiple times trying to get my expenses refunded and it’s been 2.5 months and I’m not even close to getting a resolution. Our boarding was delayed and when we got on the plane it was discovered a passenger with the same name as somebody on our flight, but who was meant to be flying on another airline, had made their way onto our flight (don’t even get me started on how much of a security risk that is, that’s a whole other issue!). As the flight to Johannesburg is 16 hours, the extra delay meant a crew member would’ve been over their hours if the flight took off (again, don’t even get me started on how you can schedule so that small delay can cause this). We sat on the plane for 3 hours before being told the flight was cancelled and to go to customer service in the airport to rebook our flight. Imagine hundreds of passengers at 1am with 3 customer service agents trying to get onto other flights. We were also on the phone to customer service at the same time as queuing. There were flights available with partner airlines but they wouldn’t put us on any of those, I assume because it would’ve been very expensive last minute. Eventually after hours of queuing and being on hold on the phone they said the next flight would be 3 days later. So now we are stuck in Atlanta for 3 days. I live in Cayman Islands and my sister lives in NYC. Even though my sister and I are not booked on the same ticket they expected us to share a room. I said that I wanted my own room and I was eventually given my own voucher. We got to the hotel after nearly 24 hours of no sleep only to be told that the hotel was full and that delta daily sends delayed passengers with no regard that the hotels are fully booked. We then had to walk with all out luggage to another hotel. When we got to the second hotel they said my sister had a voucher for 3 nights but mine was only for 1 night. So I was forced to share with my sister. What if she wasn’t with me? I would’ve had to pay out of pocket for a hotel room (which I wouldn’t be refunded for because delta is doing everything possible not to refund me). The hotel was also really far away, there was only fast food in the area so we had to Uber everywhere. Of course the airline won’t refund us for any of that. Not to mention that we had to entertain ourselves for the 3 days and I was completely unprepared for 100 degree weather as I was traveling to South African winter. This meant I had to buy new clothes. The cost of the delay is hundreds of dollars but they would only refund my sister $125 and they are delaying processing mine. Two and a half months later and I still don’t know how, when and how much my refund will be. I feel like delta is using constant delay tactics so they don’t have to pay me the refund. Also, absolutely no mention of any compensation for a 3 day delay which resulted in us missing a family event and we didn’t get to see our aunt who had been unwell and passed away shortly after. In all this the Delta staff have been completely unhelpful. The person who has been dealing with my refund keeps asking me for a tax number which we haven’t got in the Cayman Islands as we don’t have tax. I have told them 3 times that we don’t have it and they just keep telling me to ask my bank.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Cayman Islands to Johannesburg via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "not one offer of a drink or snacks"
author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   Everything started well. Decent breakfast served immediately after take off by an efficient attendant. Following that there was no service at all. For over 4 hours there was not one offer of a drink or snacks. I guess if I had rung the call bell I could’ve got something but it was pretty surprising not to have a single walk through by the guy. When I went to the rest room he was snoozing on the jump seat. In addition no seat belt/ back check before landing. The guy in front of me had his seat reclined for touch down. So not just service, but safety issues. Not ok! Not an inexpensive ticket either.

author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   I had a wonderful experience on this short flight.A full meal was served by an efficient and friendly flight attendant. The entertainment, seat comfort, and service (including baggage delivery) were all excellent. Literally nothing to complain about. An unusual pleasant trip.

author: M Hayle
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   Flight from JAX to ATL on September 1, 2024, with a connecting flight in ATL to YUL, and a 38 minutes layover in ATL. JAX depart time was suppose to be 7:10 AM and arrive in ATL at 8:23 AM. Depart time in ATL was suppose to be at 9:01 AM and arrive in YUL at 11:39 AM. Due delays in JAX, we only arrived in ATL at 8:45 AM instead of 8:23 AM. With this being said, I missed my connecting flight from ATL to YUL because of delays in JAX and we also got stuck in ATL tarmac for another 10 minutes before the aircraft got connected to the aerobridge. While running through the aerobridge to catch my connecting flight, I was also preparing my boarding pass on my phone and there it says, "we are sorry you missed your flight" and the Delta was offering an alternative flight with a layover for 12 hours. It asked me to accept the proposal which I did not hoping that I'd find another earlier flight. To my disappointment, all the flights they had for ATL to YUL was from 9:00 PM with arrival time of 11:49 PM. After rechecking my phone again, Delta rebooked me for the 9:00 PM flight with arrival time of 11:49 in YUL. I didn't have a choice in this situation so I had to sit all day and long hours (12 hours in total) at the airport. Airport was so crowded and hot and humid and food was expensive. I will never fly Delta again and never take Atlanta airport for layover or connecting airport. This was my worst travel experience ever.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 757', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Jacksonville to Montreal via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'September 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: John Acree
reviewBody: Not Verified | I had to pay $70 to upgrade to an aisle seat, then ended up with an entertainment monitor that did not work. I was forced to endure a 12-hour flight with no entertainment at all. The airline’s response was to offer me a $50 credit towards a future flight. What a joke!

header: “tried to call Delta but was left on hold”
author: K Keenan
reviewBody: Not Verified | Our flight was delayed so we were late to arrive at LAX airport so our friends that flew United had to wait a couple of hours for us. When I picked up my carry-on that they forced me to check due to space, a wheel was completely missing. It was 3:30 AM my time and I could not find any Delta Reps for me to show it to in baggage claim. I had to struggle with the bag out of the airport, to the rental car, to the hotel and back again on the return trip. I had a busy schedule of college visits on only a few hours sleep. I tried to call Delta several times, but was left on hold for long periods. I was not able to get through to Delta until after 24 hours had passed, so they would not replace the luggage they broke. Delta asked me to fill out a baggage complaint with pictures and still denied to fix the baggage. It is not fair that they made it so difficult for me after they forced me to check my bag and then broke it. Who has time to sit on hold for at least 20 minutes, especially while traveling.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Boston to Los Angeles', 'Date Flown': 'August 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Lacey Barnes
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Having a service animal I have flown with a couple of airlines, I flew with delta for the first Time on 8/24/24 and after 2 weeks prior to my flight I submitted my service dog paperwork 4 different times and delta special assistance services never approved or got back to me regarding my paperwork. after calling delta regarding this issue the lady I spoke with was either not listening to me or didn't understand my situation. She kept telling me there was nothing on my account regarding a service animal, I know that, that is why I was calling because no one was reviewing my paperwork. instead she kept insisting my "comfort animal was not allowed on flights" only service animals. I have to repeat to multiple times, my service dog was not a EMA. Overall she was unhelpful and ignorant toward the end. I needed help with my service animal paperwork getting reviewed and instead she wanted to try to tell me the difference between an emotional support animal and service animal. Delta is the first airline I have had to deal with so much issues regarding my service dog. I have flown many domestic and international Arlines over the years and Delta has been by far the worst when it comes to dealing with service animals. I ended up having to go to the airport with my paperwork hoping they were able to add it to my reservation. After this experience I will not be flying Delta again as my service dog paperwork is still not on my account and I had to submit it again for my return flight.

author: Sarah Dillard
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   I haven’t even gone in my trip and I have had numerous issues, starting with a cancelled flight due to “inclement weather” when multiple other airlines were able to fly to my destination on the same day. Delta did nothing to get me on one of those flights. In addition, I have had to call the airline FIVE separate times to correct issues or make changes because their website wasn’t working. This has put me on hold for up to 2 hours trying to do something as simple as change a seat or ensure my pre-check number was added (an issues they never resolved). Choose any other airline and you will have a better experience.

header: "wont be flying with Delta ever again"
author: D Cassin
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   Hurricane/tropical storm Debby was in the projected flight path of our upcoming flight, so i went up to the desk to see what to expect; if our flight was still a go, take longer because they’re going to fly around, ext. Crew member sees me, rolls his eyes, and after i ask him for a flight update due to storm he says “do i look like a weather station?” Then at check in, i have my hands full, watching my child, and we have 3 tickets. He took & scanned the tickets of people before me, but tells me “lets be self sufficient” and makes me scan the tickets myself, then turns to spouse behind me and says “you got a problem?” I cannot express how purposively this crew member was trying to make us start an altercation. He also did that fake “i appreciate you” statement with the most condescending tone, i did an audible mmmmmm back, and he started saying things behind my back, not loud enough that i could hear it, but loud enough to know he was being rude. It was awful to have a person use their job authority to be maliciously hostile knowing they will have no repercussions. we wont be flying with Delta ever again.

author: James Rowley
reviewBody: Not Verified |  The good and the bad. First my customer representative at the Airport did everything they could to ensure my bag made it to my destination over the course of my 48 hour flight delay. This delay was so long that I missed an important meeting at my destination. The most disappointing part is you have very highly paid executives and a CEO making 32million in one year. All of this is on the backs of customers like us trying to get ahead with what opportunities we have once we get to where we are going. Which I didn't.

author: Dorothy Varney
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I have flown Delta many times and never had anyone as rude as the woman at the check in desk when we had a layover on August 17,2024. She was just rude, inconsiderate, cold and unhelpful. We had a party of 6 travelers and when I pushed my sisters wheelchair to the desk to see her if we could possibly be seated together or near each other, she very rudely said there’s was nothing she could do. She just finished assigning all of the seats and did the best she could. When we boarded the plane 2 hours later, there were several completely empty rows. Clearly Iris didn’t want to be bothered with helping us. She should not be in customer service.

author: Tahirah Sumbry
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta is the worst airline. They cancelled my flight which caused a major financial burden while stuck in expensive gloomy Seattle. I was told that my luggage was flown back to Atlanta. I get to Atlanta by way of a reputable airline and was referred to a small holding room where my luggage was told to be. The luggage holding room did not have my luggage and the employees are rude and unprofessional. No one can account for my luggage even though the airport is heavily surveillance?  I’ve written about 10 complaints dispersing them to Delta, DOT, Federal Aviation and Federal Department of Transportation. I am extremely angry, no follow-up or compensation along with no accountability for my luggage and valuables. I completed a claim and several complaints, with no follow-up.

author: W Mark
reviewBody: Not Verified | I am a long time Delta Sky Miles customer but very disappointed in their lack of customer service. First flying from Rochester NY why did Delta have me flying backwards to JFK when I was traveling to the West Coast? My flight was booked, then canceled, then rebooked then canceled, then rebooked, only to cancel again, thus making me three days late for my vacation. I spoke with one of the flight crews regarding traveling into JFK and they said what ever you do, don't get stuck in JFK. I was really looking forward to getting away on vacation and Delta acted like they just don't care. Terrible customer service and not sure I want to fly anywhere for a while.

author: E Lorssi
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   I had a departure from Syracuse NY to Laguardia 8/2/24. Approx 5 hours before take off, a text of cancellation due to weather. Although was to be my 1st flight, I'm not stupid. I did notice I was one of maybe 15 seats taken. They claim weather related. Ok. Fine. Weather was iffy at best. I booked a bus for as much money being last minute. Fast forward to Saturday eve ..... another text, we regret to inform you your flight from Lag-Syr is canceled. Definitely not worth their time to fly just a couple of people because the weather was fine. I was near Lag Saturday night and even during the rain, planes were taking off constantly. Another hit in the pocket for a last minute bus to Syr. I will stay grounded and forever stick with the bus (Flixbus) or Amtrak, both of whom got me to my destinations.

author: M Vanessa
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Disgusting. Cancelled our connecting flight while we are on the plane. Staff is absolutely no help and the compensation is not even good. Not only us, several flights cancelled with people sleeping outside their help desk for two days. An absolute disgusting and rude and unorganized airline don’t ever fly with them. Line for the help desk took 2 hours+.

reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Starting with check in at PBI, poor customer service provided by Anselm - no greeting, smile, thank you and no way was he making the smallest effort to accommodate my special requests. author: O Jones
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | I've flown on Delta many times and most flights are without too many issues and generally a good experience. The last time I flew on Delta was probably in May 2020, but this review thing would not let me choose that far back. I have an upcoming flight next week and need to change my return ticket to a different airport as there was a death in our family this week. I've been trying to get a hold of someone at Delta's customer service for many hours. I keep getting a wait time of over 2 1/2 hours to speak to a representative by phone. I can't remember my Delta.com password and attempted to change my password. It wasn't sending me the email to change the password and by the time it did, I was locked out of my account requiring me to provide verification of identity to get back in; however, it was suggested that I wait 24 hours to try again. That is absolutely ludicrous. Thankfully the funeral isn't for another two weeks; however, it is super frustrating that I have to wait that long to get back into my account and even then, it is not a guarantee. I'm super frustrated that I can't talk to a person on the phone for help. I tried via a chat and part way into the conversation with a real person, they weren't responding very quickly, even though I provided all the information they needed (confirmation number, flight information for what I want to change to, my name that is on the itinerary, etc.). I asked if they could call me instead, but then they told me to call them. I had been trying to do just that for a long time and it was getting me nowhere. I'm super overwhelmed and stressed out right now because of this situation and explained that it is due to a death in the family. They could have been way more helpful and caused a lot less stress and anxiety on my end in this delicate situation. This is the third family death for us this year. Why couldn't the CS representative just call me back? They have my number. Eventually that person set up the chat on a bot. At the time, I had no idea what that meant. The bot was not helpful at all as it kept saying it didn't understand what I was telling it, even though I gave it the same information as the live person on the chat. I generally don't have many issues with Delta, and it is my preferred airline to fly on. This is by far the worst experience with Delta that I've ever had. I'm now tempted to drive to the airport myself before my upcoming flight and talk to someone there in person. Why do airlines have to make their websites and logging into your account and/or password reset, etc. so difficult?

author: Sarah Chamieh
reviewBody: Not Verified |   I cannot begin to express my disgust with Delta, Microsoft & CrowdStrike. Who launches a faulty update at the peak of the summer travel season & then states that they bear no responsibility for the catastrophic repercussions of such? I spent a year & $40K planning the one & only large gesture birthday I will ever have the opportunity of giving my 85-year-old mother. Her dream was to experience an Alaskan Cruise with friends & family. I managed to put together a group of 11 people but could not have possibly anticipated that Delta would become not only the touchstone upon which this event depended but also the destroyer. This was my first & last cruise experience, and the entire travel experience was so deplorable I don’t ever want to leave my house again. I booked my mother and her 2 equally elderly sisters on a direct flight from Orlando to Seattle the evening before the cruise, just in case there were any delays, they should have had enough time to make the ship. On the morning of the 19th of July at 9am PST while walking my dog I learned of the issues with the “Global IT outage”. I ran home, checked the Delta flights & found them cancelled. There was NO notification of this change. I immediately tried calling, messaging & accessing Delta’s website. I sat at my kitchen table for 11 hours that day with 2 computers & 3 phones unable to reach anyone. I was on hold for 7 hours until the call dropped. Delta’s chat bot kept asking if I “was still there” and every time I responded “yes” it gave me a longer wait time for a representative than the previous estimate. I called my mother & her sisters and told them to get to the airport as quickly as possible, this was something they would have to solve in person at a Delta Counter. Technology was the problem; I could not help them from California via computer or phone. It was already afternoon in Florida. They arrived at the Orlando airport with their luggage at 3pm and stood in line for hours only to have the Delta agent turn them away with a flyer of useless information redirecting them to use Delta’s app or website. Neither functional, nor is it appropriate to expect 80 year old ladies to navigate a digital world. They returned to the Delta Counter but were told repeatedly that Delta could not rebook them on another flight and that they had to go to other counters and sort it themselves only to be told at both Southwest & Alaska that Delta had the responsibility of rebooking them. These ladies dragged their bags across the airport until 11pm that evening. In total they were turned away from the Delta counter 3 times & ultimately unable to arrive in Seattle in time to make the sailing. This is the most egregious failure to meet a Contract of Carriage I have ever experienced. When Frontier can go old school and pull out paper tickets in order to meet their contract of carriage but Delta chooses to strand & abandon ALL clients it is clear who is the better carrier. We arrived at the Seattle port Saturday morning to spend 2 hours waiting for Princess Cruise lines to agree to allow our ladies to board in Juneau as apparently this is a violation of some maritime law creating more fines & distress. If I haven’t been clear the entire point of this Holiday was to celebrate the person left stranded in Orlando, whom I disgracefully booked on Delta. My financial losses are such: Last minute one way flight to Juneau $ 2547.99 Unused Seattle Hotel $ 347.23 Last minute Juneau Hotel $
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Orlando to Seattle', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "intrusive check of my person and luggage"
author: Donald Meyer
reviewBody: Not Verified |   The flight took off almost two hours late. The entertainment system was not working the whole flight. But the flight attendant Michael was very personable. Before the flight I was subjected to a very intrusive check of my person and luggage. I have flown hundreds of times on many airlines to and from many destinations and only on this route with this airline have I been treated like a suspect. This time I was asked strange questions at check in, like what are my hobbies? Where did I stay? Who did I see? , etc. The time a few years ago they took me in a room and went though all my luggage with a fine-tooth comb then went through it again at the gate! Almost missed my flight. This time, they didn't go though my checked bags but I was subjected to a thorough inspection of my carry on and had to remove my shoes (none of the other passengers had to do this). I became quite irate but the attendant there at the gate  remained calm and did tell me that they had detected a suspicious substance on my hand when they did that swab thing. Later, researching the substance I found it frequently is mistakenly confused with a component in hand lotion (glycerin). But I wonder why this has not happened to me on any other airline and, frankly, on any other Delta flight, though most of my flights on Delta have been domestic.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Prague to New York JFK', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R McCanne
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Caught in the meltdown due to computer crashes, the delay wasn't the problem. The problem is the complete lack of support during and afterwards. Under EU rules, the delay means they owe me 1200 euros under EU261. There is literally no way to get a human to handle this request, and the computer system is a black hole that keeps throwing my complaint away. The flight was fine, but the organization, and dependence on a computer system black box, makes for a terrible experience.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Amsterdam to Boston', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Bill Green
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Prior to takeoff, our plane had some electrical issues. It was hot in the plane due to the issues. The issues were fixed. The legroom on the plane was terrible, I had to walk around on the plane so my legs could stretch out. Also, the turbulence was so strong, two food carts fell over. To top it off, a dog was walking down the aisle of the plane during the flight.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York to Los Angeles', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: N Wirten
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Smooth takeoff and landing, but when we hit turbulence, and the captain announced we would be landing, no flight attendants came to take any new trash or check if tray tables were down, so we’re were forced to keep two cups of water secure on a tray table as we landed. Additionally, our request light was on, and no flight attendant was seen at all. We left the flight without knowledge of the number of our baggage carousel.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to San Antonio', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Enid Freire Jebbia
reviewBody: Not Verified | I'll never fly Delta again. They have partners like Latam and I flew by Latam. THEY DON'T TELL YOU THIS TRICK or robbery but when you fly with the partner, they will steal your miles blaming the partner company in my case is LATAM. They said to me that miles are based in the price that you pay AND NOT THE DISTANCE THAT GOOGLE EARTH PRECISELY TELL US. I really flew 12,326.24 MILES and they deposited into my account ONLY 4,855. Is missing 7,471.24 lots of miles stolen from me. All the other airlines works with distances which is what makes sense. But Delta is different they said that is based in what you paid for which doesn't make any sense in distance, an YES they found another way to rob you.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to Sao Paulo', 'Date Flown': 'March 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jason Lasher
reviewBody: Not Verified |   My daughter came down to Florida to visit. When we dropped her off to go back home, she was told that she could not fly for the next two days. The agent was very rude. No one let us know that the flight was overbooked. It is a two-hour drive to the airport, and she missed two days of work. I will never fly Delta again.

author: C Li
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  DL2996 early morning flight was cancelled only 8 hours prior departure. I found out via email upon waking up a few hours before the airport. There were no alternatives from/by Delta to get me to the wedding I planned to attend that day at destination. Both chat and phone agents were practically unreachable. Ultimately, I had to pay up a very significant amount and much more for a very last minute flight on another carrier out of my personal pocket. Delta provided zero compensation for this last minute cancellation.

author: Kashif Khan
reviewBody: Not Verified | Worst airline so far I've traveled, cabin crew rude, ground staff don't care - they delay the flight the whole day and then cancel the flight when you have no choice left. A clear weather issue, some time they have no cabin crew or captains. They work like the really don't care what their passengers are going through. Simply don't have any words to express here. Good luck Delta - will see you guys filing bankruptcy soon if your service works like this.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Buffalo', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: P Heale
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Delayed flight twice before totally canceling it. I was bummed but understand it's related to the IT fiasco. What is not  related to the CrowdStrike problem is how Delta treated us! First, the gate agent announced the cancellation and then immediately left! Offered no help other than to say we should find a help desk to rebook. Stood in line for 3.5 hours only to have them tell me there are no fights for 4 days. When I asked to change my flight to 8/4, she told me no, they would only book within the week! I also couldn't get a hotel voucher because every hotel in the area is booked. Went to get my checked bag and after another hour in that line, we were all told that they would not be getting any more bags until 6:30am (this was now midnight) because they were too far behind with all the cancelled fights. After 5 more hours of waiting for them to get my bag, I was told they can't find it. They won't report it lost yet, they said they just can't find it and I need to wait longer! I can't believe they get away with treating customers like this. Delta used to be the only airline I trusted. I am shocked at their mishandling and complete lack of compassion. Oh wait, they did come through the line with water and animal crackers for us. Seriously Delta??? You should be ashamed!!!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Minneapolis to Albuquerque', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Anastasia Newberry
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Delta is the WORST airline I have ever had the experience of flying with and VERY unprofessional and unhelpful in fixing their own mistakes. I waited at my gate for 6 hours and they continuously delayed my flight and then cancelled it. I was then sent to the ticket desk where I was REFUSED a refund when I could not take the next flight out 2 days later. They were very rude and unhelpful and I have never in my 21 years of flying experienced anything of the sorts. I cannot believe the terrible customer service.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Salt Lake City to Cincinnati', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Garsan
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Total failure. Horrible customer service in the LAX airport. Stayed in the line for 6 hours. Supervisor Omar even scared me with calling police regardless that i was with little baby stand in all day in the line because they had delayed and nobody could tell me if my flight is changed to other or no i just wanted to know what to do And left the desk telling us to go to the line again (6 hour line). Worst experience ever. Under his supervision when there were 100 people waiting were working only 3-4 desks however there were more then 10. Not giving any concrete answer to any question what to do when to come. Stayed in separate 4 lanes no any support solved the issue. Only one guy helped us after all day staying in different lanes before even they didn't know where who should stand
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to Paris', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: E Haynes
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Cancelled my connecting flight due to the cyberstrike issues and made me wait in a 4 hour line just to tell me at the front that I needed to scan a QR code to be put in their virtual line, where they actually let people in from. So waiting 4 hours in line meant nothing because I didn't scan their QR code since they didn't have any staff making anyone aware in line that there was a QR code that needed to be scanned. Worst customer service, all the employees were unhelpful and unempathetic, out of hotel vouchers and employees telling mothers in front of me that their children will have to sleep on the ground of the airport.

author: Julie Slomczenski
reviewBody: Not Verified |   I will never fly Delta again. Never even took off. This is the 3rd time this year where there was no pilot. Flight got canceled and our bags were lost at the airport we never even left from. Delta is a joke and I’m cutting up my delta Amex card.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Detroit to Charleston', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Bowen
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Was noted on 2.5 hrs prior to flight departure that plane had been delayed 30 minutes without an explanation. Our connecting flight was only 1 hr reducing it 30 minutes. We later landed late for our connecting flight resulting in a missed connection by multiple passengers. Airline offered a flight 18 hours later without any accommodations, coverage of meals, etc. Deltas only solution was a $50 voucher for each passenger for a future flight. Why would I fly with a company that can’t get it right the first several times? After talking with other passengers who had missed their connection, we found out this is a daily occurrence on this particular route as they and us had experienced the exact same thing on our outbound flight just didn’t miss our connection as we were waiting on a pilot.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Kansas City to Escanaba via Minneapolis', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: A Thomas
reviewBody: Not Verified |   I was sitting in the third to last row in the plane with a sleeping child in my lap. We waited for everyone to leave the plane post landing to not hold up the line with getting our bags out with a sleeping toddler. The plane landed 10 mins early at 9:50am. After everything was clear, I started getting my 3 carryon bags ready while giving my sleeping toddler to my mother to hold. Immediately the flight attendant rolled her eyes and said, “are you done yet?” I paused after gathering my things and said “I had a sleeping child on my lap, I couldn’t move.” The flight attendant disrespectfully responded, “we have a time to follow.” I proceeded to take out all 3 carry on bags by myself as she stood there and watched. I felt greatly disrespected and unfortunately don’t feel safe flying Delta as they are not conducive to young families who are traveling. I’m disgusted and appalled, my toddler was upset and crying after all the commotion.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Tampa to New York JFK', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: T Mayne
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  It took 45 minutes to check our bags. We were late for our flight and left in Montreal. Then a representative threatened to not put me on a flight at all. No one from Delta was even around to ask for help after an hour. An airport rep had to find a Delta employee. Online and phone support was useless. It wasn't until I was back in the US did they even want want to help. Don't fly Delta! They ruined a great trip.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Montreal to San Antonio via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Layne
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I flew from Zurich to Nashville and return during June. The flight is over 10 hours. On the flight to Atlanta we were fed one very small meal at the start of the flight and then an inedible soggy, partially cooked pizza pocket towards the end of the flight. The flight left late and on arrival we spent an hour getting through security to transfer to our Nashville flight. We had one tiny bowl of pasta in over 13 hours. This was a day time flight and was sold as a full service flight, yet we were hardly fed. Delta should advise economy passengers to bring their own food.  The return flight was an overnight flight so the paucity of food did not affect us so much. But on this flight my husband's entertainment screen did not work, although one staff member did try to rectify this. The lady who checked us in in Nashville was slovenly and unkept. Her hair was all over the place and not brushed and her clothes were too small and not ironed. Generally, the flight staff were badly presented (sadly, the uniform does them no favours), rude and appeared to have no pride in their work. They just shoved the meals at passengers and gave the impression that we were an inconvenience. I have travelled on many airlines and have never seen such scruffy and grumpy flight attendants. In contrast, the gentleman who checked us in at Zurich Airport was professional, well presented, helpful and friendly.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Zurich to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: T Haneesh
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  This travel was a nightmare. Due to technical issues with flight, staff started deplaning people because at the time of boarding, Flight captain said that there was problem with tyre. 1 hour later, staff informed that we will switch to another plane. We took off at 10 when plan was supposed to leave at 7:21 PM. I lost my next connecting flight, so had to stay in Atlanta overnight. Airline gave option for meal and motel, so kind of them but they don't have wisdom to understand that many people travel for business or work. And for them, meal voucher, motel is not priority but Time is priority.  Next day flight again delayed from 9:16 am to 10 Am. Great. Then that Front desk staff asked me to get my Duffle bag tagged because there is no space in cabin. I explained to him, that this is not hand carry, a duffle bag, can fit under my seat as its soft and can fit in little space. First of all, he acted stubborn, yelled at me, closed the entry door and called security on me because I am not giving my bag to tag, even I explained that I am scared that I will get my bag damaged. As 2 months ago, They mishandled my hand carry , broke wheels and damaged my stuff inside. I had to literally drag that heavy hand carry.  Flight attendants never had problem with me to put that bag under seat. What was the point of all this fuss.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Jackson to Daytona Beach via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "disrespect of an employee of your company"
author: Martha Pineda
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  June 30/24, second flight Bogota-Atlanta, Delta 983. The plane landed in Atlanta early, but it took them about an hour to open the door. I was very worried because I didn't want to miss my connecting flight to Greenville, SC. ​​I saw a couple with a baby pass by my seat looking for the exit and I went after them. At that moment, one of the flight attendants arrives and yells at me loudly and in a disrespectful tone, "Ma'am! Where do you think you're going?" He took my suitcase from me, I explained the situation to him, but he continued to be furious and yelled at me to go to your seat and something else that I don't remember. I was in row 28, in row 26 there was a lady, who I believe works for the airline, because 80% of the time during the flight she was standing and talking and laughing with the flight attendants. When I passed my seat, the lady also in a contemptuous tone yelled at me "where do you think you're going, mommy!" and I replied, "I think you look prettier when you're quiet," and I continued to my seat. The lady in seat 26 and those in row 27 began to make fun of me for the situation. I didn't say anything. I'm not a person who fights, and I'm also a person over 67 years old. You can't imagine how bad I felt as a person, being the laughing stock of so many people, because of the disrespect of an employee of your company. I never want to fly again with your company, I can't understand what training your employees have, what's going on with human resources?
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Cali to Greenville via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Marden
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  We were almost at the airport for an international trip when I got a text from Delta saying they had canceled our flight and that they could not rebook us. They offered a credit on a future flight (!?!). This has never happened to me in 30+ years of international travel. We had to get to our destination that day. In the taxi, I was able to book tickets on another airline, leaving from another airport. Needless to say it was expensive to do so. Plus, getting from the first airport to the second meant a taxi fare of almost $200 USD. We phoned and insisted on a refund rather than the credit. The agent we spoke to did provide the refund. Nevertheless, I will not book with Delta again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York to Montreal', 'Date Flown': 'July 2024', 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Kerry Lavender
reviewBody: Not Verified | Linda was our flight attendant and I must say she made my flying experience a great one! She was extremely courteous, helpful and professional at all times. We had some laughs and she gave us some great snacks. Airlines need good people like Linda. We were on flight 4991.

author: C Vale
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  My flight got delayed up to 8 hours until 11:35pm and they're still not confirmed with the time. This was due to the absence of a pilot and an assistance team. They were unable to help or do anything about it but offer us a hotel to sleep in until tomorrow if they bump us on another flight. This is the worse airline ever.

author: K Robson
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Good movies and service throughout the flight. However The seats are awful, my bottom is bruised and still numb - got off the plane 8 hours ago.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A350', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Auckland to Los Angeles', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Mary Kara
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | PROS: Not even a minute of delay. Cabin crew was very friendly. Clean nice trip. Excellent service and food. Worth the money! Arrived earlier than we scheduled. Cons: The endless walking to the gates. Old movies. The airport Delta staff in Boston’s check in on the 27th of March 2024. Checking in for JFK -> Greece. This male replying to our questions with “I don’t know” or pretending not to hear us (didn’t even respond to my hello). Although one of our luggages was underweight by 5 pounds, he wouldn’t give it back to us so we could put things from the 2nd suitcase which was 2 pounds overweight. It was standing right there next to him! I can’t he replied because I would have to weigh it again! I didn’t say a word. I regret it. I had to carry the suitcase away from the counter to stuff a jacket from it, in my back pack (to reduce those 2 pounds) cause I was blocking the line when no one was behind me waiting. I have never been spoken/treated to so rudely in my life and did not answer any of my questions on how to make my 100$ bill in change since he would not accept a 100$ bill. I hope more people make complaint’s about this fellow.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Athens to New York JFK via Boston', 'Date Flown': 'March 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: E Gan
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Before I reached the airport, I checked in through Delta’s website. The online check-in was successful and I got a digital boarding pass. Upon arrival at the airport, I checked with a Delta staff at the counter and was told that my digital boarding pass was good enough and no additional check-in was needed. I went through security check and all gates successfully. However, when I lined up to board the plane, I was told that my boarding pass didn’t work and asked me to wait. I waited for a long time until the very end, because no staff was paying attention to passengers who needed to be cleared up. Finally, they checked their system and said I didn’t check in. I told them I have checked in online, otherwise I would not have a boarding pass. They showed a very impatient attitude and kept repeating that I didn’t check in. I didn’t want to argue and asked if they could check me in. They kept giving that bizarre attitude and a look that I didn’t know what I was doing. Shouldn’t they feel sorry for what their customers experienced? I was annoyed by their attitude and frustrated how messy Delta’s systems were. The staff was impatient and their arrogant attitude was unacceptable. I finally scanned my boarding pass and complained “stupid airline system”. Then they pulled me back and threatened me that if I didn’t apologize then they would take me off that plane and had me wait longer for the next flight. I was very angry but I did want to get back home. So, I apologized to them. Then they threatened me further that if take my attitude to the plane or they would take me off the plane. Wow, I don’t even have the right to be angry, given the way I was treated? Delta, your system is completely messed up. As a customer, I didn’t do anything wrong by checking in online but I was accused by the staff of not being responsible for checking in. Your messy system is not your customers’ fault. If your system is not capable of doing online check-ins, then don’t even ask your customers to do that. The staff abused their authority to threaten customers, forced customers to apologize and even took away customers’ right to be angry.  After I boarded the flight, the gentleman who sat next to me also complained how their seats were messed up and the horrible attitude their family received from Delta’s staff because they had a child who needed special care. I was not given a single smile but were treated with disrespect, impatience and arrogance. I cannot believe this is the level of service Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York to Toronto', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Malhem
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  The flight attendant took my carryon suitcase because they didn’t have enough space in the aircraft. It fit all of the size requirements. They didn’t explain what was going on and that I wouldn’t see my luggage again until my destination. (I had one layover.) They stuck a tag on it without my knowledge and took my suitcase without my permission.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New Orleans to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Lisa Oren
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Delta is the best airline period. But the food has gotten terrible. I sat in coach on the way to London, and business class on the way back. The food was the worst food I’ve ever eaten on a plane.

header: "long time before I fly Delta again"
author: Michelle Ragin
reviewBody: Not Verified |   They boarded us then 5 minutes before take off the pilot tells us there's a light out on the wing which would need to be changed. We waited 2 hours for this.  Most connecting passengers missed there connections. It will be a long time before I fly Delta again. Not the first time I've been screwed by Delta. I'll fly American!

author: R Robbins
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  In an effort to be fair to all of Deltas' customers (and potential customers ), I believe that they need to know how they treat their customers and how we were stranded by them. Our luggage was lost and severely damaged when it was eventually recovered and now they are refusing to make it right. I was given the runaround and eventually just blown off.

author: Jay Wickline
reviewBody: Not Verified |   After a 50 minute delay leaving Phoenix caused by Delta Airlines, we were cutting it close to catch our connecting flight back home to Bismarck. We actually made it to the gate after running through the airport with our 3 kids, one of which is a 7 week old infant and were told that they were closing the gate and that we could not get on. We were then stranded at Minneapolis Airport and subject to a $600 per day rental car rate with SIXT because of "supply and demand issues" with rental cars. There was not one single other available rental option in the airport. It was around 2am before we were able to find a decent hotel again due to "supply and demand issues". For the amount of money we paid with Delta for these flights and all of the travel that we've done in the past it is absolutely outrageous that we received the treatment that we did. Delta Airlines is not for the customers and their main focus is not to achieve customer satisfaction. I'd like to emphasize on the fact that they were un willing to offer us 5 minutes extra to board and that they left me and my family stranded with a 7 weeks old infant.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Pheonix to Bismarck', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Keane
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  After struggling to get information out of this deceitful company for almost 2 years, being lied to, losing over $2000, being stranded for 2 days with no accommodation or food they have the audacity to offer $100 in travel vouchers to use them again as compensation? Like that’s going to happen. After having an awesome US trip with my son we were looking forward to getting home to Scotland. We arrived in SAN in plenty of time and boarded just 20 min later than scheduled but then sat in the plane on a taxi way for almost an hour with no explanation. Not a great start but then it got worse. On arrival in New York we then sat on the runway for another 2 hours which meant our flight back to the UK had gone. This is where the fun starts. It took over 2 hours to get through on the customer support line where they managed to arrange another flight (2 days later) but were unable to allocate a hotel room due to the late hour (now almost 2AM). The representative advised us to arrange our own accommodation and then claim the costs back by providing the receipts. (This turned out to be a bare faced lie). We finally found a Hotel and arrived at 5am. Unfortunately we now had another 2 days in the US but with our bags stuck in the airport , only the clothes we were wearing and no toiletries we had no option but to get out later that day (after some sleep) to buy essentials (keeping the receipts as advised by Delta of course). Come the day of travel we get to JFK and discover our bags are in Atlanta, 700 miles in the wrong direction on a different plane so when we eventually arrive in London at 2200 we still have no luggage so another overnight stay needed and another hotel bill. Thanks to Delta our internal UK transfer had also gone so we lost another £200 and then had to arrange a new route home by way of train, yet another £270. Finally home 3 days late, over $2000 down and no luggage I contacted Delta to get the address of where the receipts should be sent. (here starts 2 years of BS and fob off emails). First reply stated there is no compensation. Fortunately my claim was not for compensation simply a refund of expenses incurred at the request of Delta so I replied stating such, only to be met by a further reply mentioning compensation again. This ‘compensation/requesting an address it’s not compensation’ see saw went on for months with my patience finally breaking and contacting the DoT for help. It appears that KLM cannot differentiate between a customer query simply asking for an address and a claim for compensation, must be a Delta requirement that they hire incompetents. As soon as I contacted the DoT I was contacted by DELTA themselves. Their reply was similar to KLM with them completely denying liability and ignoring the fact that I was told to keep receipts and claim costs back with a derisory $100 travel voucher to compensate for over $2000 lost, 4 days lo luggage delays, not to mentions the stress. Who in their right mind would use vouchers to travel with a company that acted in such a disgusting manner, lie to their customers and treated them this badly.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'San Diego to London via New York', 'Date Flown': 'June 2022', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Sara Sherman
reviewBody: Not Verified |   I was flying out on the evening of 6/10/24. The kept getting delayed for take off. As SLC was my final destination, I wasn’t worried. I finally boarded. Due to Deltas inability to maintain their planes, one of the cargo bay doors wouldn’t open. The plane was unbalanced and couldn’t take off. I sat there for three freaking hours waiting. Half the plane got off. They has us move forward. Finally finally we took off and landed at freaking 1:30 am when the plane was supposed to land at 10 pm. Delta was giving vouchers for people that missed their connecting flight. As it was so late, I didn’t get anyone to pick me up. I had to get a Lyft ride home. I put in a request for reimbursement. Guess what! Delta wouldn’t accommodate the request. They were willing to give hotel vouchers and rides to others, but my request was denied. Im done. You guys suck. You really don’t offer any great. United is way more accommodating.

author: Carolyn Rangel
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I want to highlight the good things because the good ones are more. I was flying back home to Washington, D.C., from Austin, TX. Due to some issues, the first flight was delayed. There was no way that I would make my connection in Detroit. I was devastated as I needed to get home as soon as possible. I kept looking for other flights, but my missed connection was the night's last flight to IAD. I would have to wait until the morning for the next flight. Unexpectedly, a kind flight attendant approached me on the plane and said, “Hey, I noticed that you missed your connection to Dulles Airport, but I found this delayed flight heading to Reagan Airport. If you don’t mind changing airports, you can be in DC tonight instead of tomorrow morning. Is this something you would like to do?” I immediately said YES! I needed to get home right away, so arriving home 40 minutes after my original flight was much better than waiting until the morning. Upon arrival at Reagan National, I checked with Delta about my luggage. As expected, they were delayed. However, they assured me that my suitcases would be delivered the next day to my house, and they kept their word! What a relief! With everything going on, the last thing I needed was to go to the airport to retrieve my things. And I am so thankful for that. What this flight attendant doesn’t know (because I didn’t ask for a flight change or even mention my situation to anyone. This was just amazing customer service is that she helped me get home on time to be there the last night with my very special recently adopted cat. See, he was special because he was the sweetest cat I’ve ever met; he only wanted to be on my lap all the time and to be petted nonstop. He was blind, and he was my friend’s cat, who unexpectedly passed away in April this year, and I took in my sweet baby. He got very sick and was getting worse by the hour. He was waiting for me to get home. I got home at midnight, and he crossed the bridge Thursday afternoon. Thanks to this kind soul and her outstanding customer service, I was there for him, keeping him company during his last night. And for that, I will thank Delta Airlines forever. From the bottom of my broken heart.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Austin to Detroit', 'Date Flown': 'June 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Beverly Stockton
reviewBody: Not Verified | Tried to return home to HSV from MBS 6/10 #3915 at 11:50 am via DTW & ATL. Cancelled for crew/mechanical. Delta desk clerk rebooked me #4167 at 5:50 pm 6/11. "No other accomodating flights". #4167 was then rescheduled 3x again-mechanical-before I called 1-800 Delta. United finally got me enroute 6/12 via ORD after staying 2 nights with a cousin. Delta let me down.

author: Mark Bylsma
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Flight was delayed due to maintenance on a plane. Our flight was scheduled to board around 8:40 PM when I arrived at the terminal late I expected the plane to already be boarding. As I stood there about 10 to 20 minutes with all the other passengers waiting to get on the plane finally had an announcement for the agent stating that the client was having maintenance and they would be delayed boarding until 1020 and the flight will takeoff at 11. Once we finally started boarding the plane the 11 o’clock takeoff time came up past. Around 1110 captain came on the intercom and stated that they were working on the plane and they were waiting on the maintenance guy to get back so that Atlanta could work with him to verify the flight was ready to takeoff. About 20 minutes later came back on the intercom stating that maintenance was on the plane and they were going to be working with Atlanta. The pilots were gonna be stepping off because there was going to be a lot of noise in the cockpit would be to takeoff. A little after 12 o’clock, the captain came back on the intercom stating that we were going to have to board this plane. We should’ve never boarded this plane that we should’ve been put on another plane and he was very disgusted with the situation. Continue to say once he had more information, he would let us know what gate we were going to so that we could board a different plane to continue our destination in Buffalo. Around 12:30 AM we finally boarded a different plane and we left a little after 1 AM. When I arrived in Buffalo, the rental car centers were all closed and had to sit in the airport for 3 1/2 hours until they reopened. Due to this delay, my hotel stay for the night that I was billed for didn’t sleep in the bed because I had to continue on to work with my customer that day which now put me being up over 36 hours. I spoke with the Delta agent who told me I need to file a complaint stating what it happened and then I would be compensated to what went on. So I Submitted my complaint to Delta where an agent with an email address from Delta that states wecare.com. Which obviously they do not Delta gave me a 3000 point to my SkyMiles for compensation for what happened that day. So I’m out over $200 for my hotel stay. Lack of sleep because of having to continue to my Customer site without being able to sleep and work 36 hours straight cause of this. Was not able to get a rental car had to sit in the airport for 3 1/2 hours waiting on the rental car center to open because of this. And the supervisor from Delta stated that the best they could do is give me 3000 bones points for this mishap. That shows me the Delta should change their email to say we don’t care what happens to you. I can understand if it’s an act of God due to the weather. But this was an active Delta decided to do a maintenance on a plane that was scheduled for a flight. Confidence of Delta and their response to their customers because of this is ridiculous. I was told by the Delta agent joy that they do not Refund hotel stays that were previously booked. I don’t know most people who don’t previously book travel with the hotel and travel with a car rental center. To be told that the best they can compensate me was 3000 points was ridiculous and that there would be no more further contact with me because that was all they were going to do. I’m a Gold member without Delta. And also have their American Express reserve card and I’m going to be treated this way.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Detroit to Buffalo', 'Date Flown': 'May 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Thomas
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Mishandling of luggage cost me ££ to replace. I made a claim for a refund due to the broken lock which I could not open and they refused it due to ‘wear and tear’ but it most definitely was not. My other luggage perhaps did have some wear and tear but my main luggage was broken and deemed unusable for international trips. A few things inside my bag were also broken somehow even though they were in a solid heavy duty suitcase so tell me again how it was normal wear and tear. This was at the start of May, and they only just got back to me.

I was transferred to LATAM worse airline, they don't speak English very well and they lost my luggage. Delta nor LATAM will compensate me for this

reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Terrible experience with Delta flights. Flight at BUF delayed for an hour and connecting flight at Atlanta missed. I was so upset and will never fly with Delta in my life.

Save money go else where. There literal app delays with no update, no updated boarding. You can get updates from AI or wait 15 mins to chat with someone.

author: H Xin
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I just had most unpleasant experience with Delta. I took Delta 847 from JFK to Austin. After I passed the gate with my carryon luggage, my husband and son had been asked to check in their carryon luggage. I waited for them a bit. Later when I waited to get on the plane, a man came to me and asked if I took off the tag from the luggage. I insisted I was not asked to check in luggage, he still kept questioning me. He asked for my seat number and I thought at least he could verify I was telling the truth. The man just went ahead and generated a luggage tag and forced me to check in the carryon. Delta could keep testing customer sentiment like this, as for myself, I will never ever book another flight with Delta.

author: Nilanjana Ghoshal
reviewBody: Not Verified |   The services and flights have been excellent so far. However, I had a horrible experience on my flight from Boston to Raleigh on May 26th around 5 pm. When my husband was trying to put my heavy bag in the overhead bin, a male staff member was extremely rude to him. Despite my husband’s efforts to stay calm, the staff member repeatedly made hurtful comments and urged him to hurry without offering any help. While the staff member was kind to other passengers, he singled us out, making us feel discriminated against and hurt. We have been loyal Delta customers for years, and this is the first time we have experienced such discrimination. Other passengers witnessed this incident, and a kind lady even offered to help us. The male staff member’s behavior should be questioned, especially towards long-time loyal customers like us.

author: Ses Brunton
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding an incident that occurred on my recent Delta flight. The issue involves the behavior of a flight attendant as well as the conduct of the Minnesota ground staff and Delta supervisors. I was a passenger on flight 2987 from Philadelphia to Minnesota, with a connecting flight to Los Angeles (flight 748). Shortly after takeoff on flight 2987, my three-year-old daughter urgently needed to use the restroom. The nearest restroom was in the first-class section, so I began walking her there during mid flight about 20 mins after take off. However, a flight attendant stopped me and informed me that I could not take my daughter to that restroom. I explained that my daughter might have an accident in her seat, but the attendant insisted that we return to our seats, even when I asked if it would be acceptable for my daughter to have an accident. The attendant's response was affirmative, indicating it was acceptable. Reluctantly, I returned to my seat with my distressed and crying daughter. A few minutes later, I observed a man from first class get up and use the restroom without issue. At this point, I decided to return to the restroom with my daughter. I informed the flight attendant that her behavior was unacceptable and hypocritical. I then proceeded to use the restroom with my daughter. During this incident, I asked for the flight attendant's information, and her name which was denied. Upon landing, I sought the flight attendant's information and saw her speaking to the flight supervisor outside the door as we exited the aircraft. I stopped and asked the flight supervisor if we could discuss the situation away from the terminal to avoid blocking customers. He initially told me to wait and talk there, but I suggested we move to the front to avoid obstructing other passengers. The supervisor then insisted I go to the top and wait for him. Once I identified that the supervisor was not handling the situation professionally, I asked to speak to his superior. As I headed up, the flight attendant and I exchanged words during the situation. However, as I was leaving, the flight attendant continued her uncontrolled unprofessional comments and proceeded to clap her hands four times in a confrontational manner, as if she wanted to fight, in front of other flight attendants and supervisors. This behavior went unaddressed. This experience was incredibly frustrating and distressing for both my daughter and me. I believe the treatment we received was unreasonable and lacked basic empathy, especially considering the needs of a small child. As I waited, the day shift manager arrived and, in a rude manner, ignored me to speak with the flight attendant and her supervisor down below at the plane.  After waiting for about 10 minutes, the manager returned, and I tried explained the entire situation to her but of course she interrupted me the whole time. Without listening to my story or understanding what happened, she informed me that I was banned from Delta flights for my conduct and could not reschedule a flight with Delta and use another airline. Her decision was based solely on the accounts of the flight attendant and the unprofessional in flight supervisor. I requested to speak to her supervisor, but she claimed in a disrespectful tone that she was the only supervisor and that no one was higher than her.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Philadelphia to Los Angeles via Minneapolis', 'Date Flown': 'May 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Corri Schroeder
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I will never fly with Delta again! They have zero customer service and will not help you in any way even though they are at fault. Every employee we talked to was completely rude and would not help us with our situation. First, they made us check our carry ons because there was no over head space even though they was plenty when we boarded the plane, then our flight was delayed from landing causing us to miss our connecting flight, our connection had at least 15 people that missed that flight just like us and they ended up leaving early which to me makes no sense. Every employee at the help desk was either rude or didn’t want to help us making us run around the airport to get any type of help. They wouldn’t give us a hotel and we couldn’t get a flight to our final destination till the next night causing us to miss a whole day from our trip. Then on top of everything they lost our luggage, one ended up in Tampa while the other stayed in Atlanta so not only were we stranded in a city with no place to sleep but we also had no clothes or really anything. It seems like every Delta employee goes through the same training of how to screw their customers over and be an extremely rude and disrespectful person. I have never been so upset with how an airline handled a situation before and Delta has lost my business for good.

author: Nicole Haney
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  This is the 6th time where this airline hasn't given out no water, no food,.no nothing. Now we are sitting on this hot air plane waiting on the runway with no head phones to even watch a movie. This is the last time I'm flying Delta.

reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Pretty much impossible to get service after the first hour on a 6hr flight! When I walked to the back to request a beverage I was told they'd be coming around, which they never did.

author: Carl Tackett
reviewBody: Not Verified | Our flight was late to take us to Salt lake so we missed our connection in Salt Lake so we had to spend the night in Salt Lake, the next day we found out we had been put on standby, my gripe is we should have been a priority not a standby, it wasn’t our fault but we had to spend two days in the airport going through TSA twice. My wife is unable to walk very far with a a pace maker and I had a stroke effecting my balance and my left side. The mental stress about being on standby not knowing when you might get a flight was almost unbearable. I bought a ticket it wasn’t a standby ticket.You need to treat people better if you all screw up on a flight, if you miss a connection flight you should make the ones you put in a bad situation a priority not a stand if it’s the airlines fault. If I miss a flight it’s on me but if the airline makes me miss its should be on them put me on a regular flight, the next flight not on standby!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Seattle to Oklahoma City via Salt Lake City', 'Date Flown': 'May 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jay Cruz
reviewBody: Not Verified |   I arrived a few hours before my scheduled flight at Buffalo Airport flying back to La Guardia New York. No personnel at the Delta Airline counter 3 hours before the flight. (To check my luggage) I went to a Delta Airlines office - baggage claim office with the most horrific experience with this personnel.  He claims he only handles the baggage claims area and has no idea what the guidelines are in terms of personnel managing the ticket counter.  I asked him to call someone to check what time they are scheduled to “open” - he told me to Google Delta Airlines customer service myself and check.  I asked him for his name, he declined.  I told him I will take his photo and he say he will call the police if I take his photo I do not understand HOW an employee of Delta Airlines could be so rude, grossly unfriendly to assist a passenger asking questions about this issue? Normally, my experience with in-flight personnel are positive, ground personnel included but this is the first time, perhaps because of the airport location in Buffalo?
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Buffalo to La Guardia', 'Date Flown': 'May 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: E Meares
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  My luggage was lost during my trip from NY to Atlanta. The wrong label was attached when I had to book my luggage at departures due to the plane being too full to accommodate my hand luggage. The bag was found being sent to Nebraska but on its way back to Atlanta Delta once again lost my bag. I had to spend my whole vacation in USA without all of my personal belongings. Not impressed.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York JFK to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'May 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Eunice Cater
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   I’m writing this review for my 90 year old mother. She took a first class flight from Lisbon to Norfolk Va. her flight was diverted back to JFK. When she arrived she along with 3 other senior citizens waited for wheelchairs that never came. All of Deltas staff adandonded them leaving them. She was forced to walk through JFK and sleep on the floor. At 5am when someone finally got to the desk. My mother asked again for a wheelchair and to be taken to the lounge. Again no wheelchair appeared. She then had to sleep on the floor until the flight which she had to walk again. Two one hour calls to delta later. Still no answers. This is elder abuse. And they should be prosecuted. It has now been 12 days and no response from delta. Absolutely unacceptable and disgusting. I only hope their mothers never have to endure such horrible abuse.

author: Charlotte Pollinger
reviewBody: Not Verified |   The flight over to Rome was the worse service I have ever had. The food was terrible. No wine was offered after dinner or during dinner. Staff was rude. And no water was offered. I am a sky miles member.
