author: Z Khizer
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Montreal to LaGuardia, the flight was on time, really small aircraft. As I entered the plane, by default I spoke in French (Montrealer) and the crew member very aggressively told me "No French, English Only", I realized my mistake and apologies and asked a question in English. Crew served only water upon request. LaGuardia to Miami, the flight was full, cabin crew was extraordinarily nice and smiley. IFE was available. Entire flight, the turbulence was pretty bad so crew wasn't able to run drinks and snack service and they were constantly very sorry about the situation. Overall decent experience, better than Air Canada, at least Delta serves something. Though It would have been nice to have bilingual crew on-board on flights to/from Montreal.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Montreal to Miami via LaGuardia', 'Date Flown': 'April 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Christian Kurasek
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Delta used to be the best airline by far. I'd go out of my way to fly them and recommend to anybody who would listen. I even went so far as to buy a significant amount of stock in the company. In the last year or so, they seem to have gone from wanting to be the best to actively working to be the worst. From their tech systems failing and not talking to each other, surreptitiously deleting eCredits, outsourcing customer service to poorly trained non-English speakers, gate agents no longer caring, destroying their loyalty and lounge programs, actively throwing up roadblocks to simple conveniences like being able to book family reservations together to avoid upgrading long-time formerly loyal customers, to customer service agents providing wildly incorrect information and going so far as to straight up lying to customers, Delta has achieved the impossible and become a worse airline than United or Spirit. Avoid at all costs.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'San Francisco to Palm Springs', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: N Bardel
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flight from Munich to Atlanta in a retrofitted 767. a bit of a narrow seat for business class but good enough for an afternoon nap. Service was outstandingly friendly on the first flight, with good food and drinks options. Purser was always present with a personal word, informing each business class passenger about details such as arrival and departure gate for connecting, which is a great thing, knowing how huge Atlanta‘s airport is. Onward flight on a pretty old 757, which definitely did see better days. Though flight was 3+ hour, with no need whatsoever dinner was rushed. Limited choice of food, actually only one option was available when I was asked (was seated on 1B). And be careful, if you switch sort of drink, you get the different drink in a plastic cup, as they load (purser told me) one real glass per passenger on such „short flights“ (3,5 hr was the flight). So, yes intercontinental Delta was absolutely worth it, but on the medium range part of the journey I was really disappointed.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767/757', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Munich to San Jose via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'May 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Paul Waldron
reviewBody: Not Verified |   As a frequent traveler, I've encountered my fair share of airline policies, but none have been as frustrating and disappointing as Delta Airlines' ticket cancellation policy. Let me start by saying that the 24-hour cancellation window is ridiculously short and unforgiving. Life happens, plans change, and sometimes circumstances force you to alter your travel arrangements beyond this restrictive timeframe. However, Delta seems to lack any empathy or flexibility in this regard. Recently, I had to cancel a ticket I had purchased due to unforeseen circumstances. Imagine my dismay when I realized that I had to cancel within 24 hours of booking to be eligible for any refund whatsoever. This policy is not only inconvenient but also entirely unreasonable. It essentially forces travelers into a rushed decision-making process, leaving no room for any change of plans or emergencies that may arise shortly after booking. But the disappointment didn't end there. Upon canceling my ticket, I was shocked to discover that Delta imposed a hefty $99 cancellation fee. To add insult to injury, they offered me a measly $91 refund for a ticket that originally cost $200. It's simply outrageous that Delta sees fit to penalize their customers to such an extent for exercising their right to cancel within the designated timeframe. The $99 cancellation fee policy feels like a slap in the face to loyal customers who have already invested a significant amount of money in their travel plans. It's a clear case of Delta prioritizing profit over customer satisfaction and goodwill. Such predatory practices not only tarnish the airline's reputation but also erode trust and loyalty among passengers.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Rochester to New Orleans', 'Date Flown': 'May 2024', 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Olga Stosic
reviewBody: Not Verified | In January 2020 my husband and I did a mercy dash to be with our youngest son while he underwent chemotherapy for cancer. We booked tickets at an excellent price for a 1 month trip. When the month was drawing to a close it became obvious that we would need to extend our stay. Our travel agent advised us that the change meant a substantial increase to the cost of the journey home. However, when the reason for the change was explained to Delta Airlines they matched the original ticket price and only charged a small fee for the change. This consideration at a very taxing and vulnerable time of our lives was so appreciated that Delta has become our “go to” airline whenever we fly to America, which will now be on a regular basis as our son married one of his treating nurses and our first grandchild is on the way! Thank you Delta for being part of our family.

author: Kim Hamilton
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Planned our dream vacation months in advance. Paying for our tickets with a live agent. Making sure all set even calling before departure to and home. Delta sold our flight home, without notice. Arriving at airport. Totally upset. Ruined our trip. They put us on a flight we did not want to fly and book in the beginning, flying to an airport we did not want to go to.  Sat for 5 hours in Chicago. Before flying back to south bend. United. Not who we booked. Not who we paid for our flight.

reviewBody: Not Verified |   Thank you Delta, all was perfect. Cabin crew very professional and friendly. Seat comfort excellent. Entertainment system one of the best for the class. We'll be back!

author: Drew Ridgley
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  The service was good and not what I have an issue with. The reason I would give them zero stars if I could is that I paid about $2,000 for a ticket (not a basic economy ticket) that was booked directly with Delta and the airline has not awarded me SkyMiles for this flight. I have contacted customer service several times and get no answer as to why the SkyMiles have not posted. Customer service then gives me the run around and the issue does not get resolved. As a result I will be canceling my Delta Amex and will be choosing to fly a more competent airline in the future after draining my SkyMiles account.

author: Edward Dowers
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flight and gate attendants do not know their job. One of the flight attendants raised her voice at me completely unprofessional. Another attendant was useless, unwilling to help. After missing a flight earlier because a pilot didn't show up. Now the pilot is waiting for a late employee for 20 minutes.

author: Madhu Sudan
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  We had an awful experience in our Delta flight (Flight No DL1502 from Atlanta to DTW - 8.55 PM on 3.8.24), the flight service was rotten, throughout the flight, the hostesses were not paying attention to the passengers, and to the cleanliness of the aircraft. My wife, put her stuff on the seat we noticed the seat was wet and her jacket and purse got wet, after talking to the hostess, the hostess ignored and moved away like nothing happened. In the entire flight, there were no beverages, not even water was served. I pressed the button for airhostess call, surprisingly no body showed up, it was very much annoying. When the luggage came out of the belt, it was not only wet from outside, but also some of the cloths were wet inside of the suitcase. It was a complete frustration and an intolerable experience in the whole duration of the flight. When I called the customer service, instead of realizing and reassuring me that this will not happen again, they threw 5000 FF points on me. Delta cares only for money not for customer service as they claim.

author: S Keane
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   I booked flights with my credit card points and only had enough points for economy class. The flight was full so I could not upgrade my seats or even select seats in advance. I was assigned a seat when I arrived in the exit row next to the door. I am somewhat over weight but not morbidly obese. My hips are not abnormally big. This seat was fully metal with no holes below the arms. I could barely squeeze into the seat. It was painful to sit in it. I told the flight attendant that I couldn’t fit and she said the flight was full so there were no other seats. I could not buckle the seat belt so I asked for an extender. She said that an extender could not be used for that seat. So she had to go around and ask the entire plane if someone would switch with me. Thankfully a nice couple in the back agreed to switch and my boyfriend and I had to make the walk of shame to the back while the flight attendant had to loudly notify the pilot to delay take off until we could be reseated. People were glaring at us as we walked back. I was mortified and spent half of the flight crying tears of humiliation. Normally the exit row seats afford passengers more room and larger people book them for that reason. I had no trouble fitting into the regular economy class seat and the seatbelt fit fine. Anyone over a size 12 would have struggled to fit in that seat and we all paid to sit in that section. It is not fair to any paying passenger to have less space than the other passengers in that section. Delta is the only airline that makes regular passengers wait until they arrive to receive seating assignments. I will not be purchasing tickets from this airline again.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A321-200', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Las Vegas, NV to Detroit, MI', 'Date Flown': 'April 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Ryan A Warren
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Will be leaving more reviews once I can get ticket information from the military. But for this trip, I had 5 bags I needed to take 3 of which I intended on checking. I am active duty Air Force. Because I was unable to furnish orders, despite being in official uniform and having an active duty military ID, the rep at check-in told me I would have to pay for each of my checked bags. This cost me $300 more than what I paid for the ticket. No other airline has ever asked for my orders even when I am not in official uniform. Additionally, the customer service rep was rude. I can handle a simple "our hands are tied" answer, but it was almost as if she was happy to tell me about the extra charge and that no military ID nor uniform made any difference to her. Upon reaching my gate, when in line to board with military personnel, the rep chastised me because one of my checked bags was "too big and too heavy" without touching it. Again, not a big deal if it were as simple as "sorry sir, that bag needs to be checked" but I was treated as though I were a child and should have known better. I saw several bags larger than mine after boarding the plane and checking my second carry-on. The flight itself was fine. But the customer service was so bad I will pay any amount extra to avoid the treatment I received when I flew with Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Oklahoma City, OK to Montgomery, Al', 'Date Flown': 'March 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: E Carter
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I am writing this review on our return flight back to NC from Arizona. We are in first class, seats 5A and 5B. Same seats we had on the initial flight to Tucson…but different airbus. We have experienced a broken tray, cold temperatures, horrible food, and on this flight, very mediocre flight attendant service. On both flights, by the time they got back to our row (5 - which is the last row in first class) there was no choice for “dinner”. We were stuck (both flights) with the fruit & Cheese box. It was supposed to have grapes - but did not…on either flight. The three tiny slices of apple were old and not cold nor crisp, some dehydrated apricots, a very few almonds that had lost most of their crunch, half of a small hard boiled egg, some rubbery cheese, and four crackers. If that is their idea of dinner, they are sadly lacking. Delta Airlines is cheap! Pathetic, yet expensive, experience! We chose Delta this time just to compare them with American, since those are the only two airlines that fly out of our small city. We will not fly Delta again. It is back to American Airlines for us!

author: Emma Briggs
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta has gone downhill with the way they treat their customers. Our flight was cancelled from Florence to the USA and they were not able to rebook us to get in the day we were supposed to. We paid for economy comfort and they put us in economy all the way on the back of the plane. They didn’t pay for our hotel room. It cost us 3 times the amount to use Delta. Save yourself some trouble and use another airline. Delta is not what they used to be nor do they care about their long time customers. We have been Delta customers for over 20 years. I will from now on be using other airlines that I have had better experiences with and better customer service. Absolutely terrible.

reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   To be the first time flying with Delta I can say that I loved it! I had a layover of 4.5 hrs and asked to David Watson if it was possible to fly on the next flight at 12:30pm (it was 11am) and he made it possible! Me and my daughter landed in SJ Puerto Rico 2 hrs prior our plans. Thank you David and Delta for being that awesome with us. Love all the perks that come with flying with you too. We had an amazing first experience and are planing to have more!

reviewBody: Not Verified |  I have been on hundreds of flights in the last 30 years always economy class and never did feel so cramped and uncomfortable as my last Delta flight. The plane was dirty, the seats are horrible, narrow and no leg room I will never fly Delta again.

reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Flew NYC to Lisbon and back. author: D Malden
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  This is the first time I have flown Delta. This flight was scheduled to leave at 1 PM from JFK to Buffalo. It pulled back from the gate. It headed toward the runway, but was turned around and returned to the gate. After waiting 50 minutes with no explanation whatsoever, passengers started getting antsy and asking questions. we were told that there was a piece of equipment mandated by the FAA, that had to be obtained before the plane could leave. We waited an additional 30 minutes. Ultimately, they received a small item that was inconspicuously delivered to a passenger. As it turns out, it was a seatbelt extender. When originally pulling away from the gate, they only had one on board. This particular passenger required a second one. That is what we waited an hour and a half for. It is understood that every person deserves dignity, it is ridiculous to have delayed 90 people a total of two hours, awaiting a seatbelt extender. The passenger requiring this should have been deboarded and placed on the next flight with the appropriate equipment. Additionally, what was most upsetting about this was the deceit. The seatbelt extender was. delivered to the passenger very secretly. The minute it was delivered, we were backed out of the jetway and in a queue of 12 planes to takeoff. Altogether, the delay was 2 to 2 1/2 hours. The flight was a 50 minute flight.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York JFK to Buffalo', 'Date Flown': 'March 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Yemeserach Tadesse
reviewBody: Not Verified | I have booked this flight about a week ahead to Austin Texas to attend a family funeral, and I paid $533 for the round trip assuming to get assigned seat. For the departure flight I was given a seat from Ontario to SLC and to Austin Texas. However in my return flight there is no seat assigned either to SLC from Austin or SLC to Ontario. Then I have noticed the available seats have to be sold to passengers who wanted to upgrade, then the left overs will be assigned to a passenger like myself who got the last seat. What is going on in this airline just to profit is not fair. I have noticed there is no respect nor acknowledgement to the passengers booked for economy class. If you charge $533 for economy class Delta airlines should accommodate accordingly. You cannot just toss us to the last row because you have to make more money. Very disappointing. The person who is checking in to the aircraft whose name is Eve didn’t even want to assign me a seat. She kept giving me the run around telling me my name is in the board which wasn’t the whole time. I’m disgusted with this airline and will never book a flight with.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Ontario to Austin', 'Date Flown': 'March 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "impression is of a poorly run airline"
author: G Lanson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I would recommend avoiding Delta if at all possible. We had booked to fly from Atlanta to Dublin but ended up having our flight delayed 2+ hours. During the delay, the Delta desk agents would not answer any questions about the cause of the delay or how long the delay would be. The staff overall seemed to not know what was going on and even later stated that they "needed to go see what was going on" before they would be able to provide a departure time. Overall, the impression is of a poorly run airline, with staff that were unable or unwilling to answer any questions.

author: Brian Goldsmith
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | This airline is terrible. They refused to turn on the air conditioning while they made us wait for 40 minutes in the miserable cabin. Not only did they not turn on the air one of the flight attendants went onto the overhead speaker and yelled at us for asking. They have not offered water either. They also sold me a ticket in which it said I would be able to have a carry on. They ended up making me check it, they are making me go to the baggage claim to get it, and there was no compensation. This is a miserable airline and I would not recommend this to anyone.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Tampa Bay to Boston', 'Date Flown': 'March 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "yet to receive a snack or beverage"
author: Schel Leed
reviewBody: Not Verified |  It’s 1 hour plus now after takeoff and sitting in 26B, have yet to receive a snack or beverage. It was turbulent for 10 minutes after taking off, so the snack n beverage service was delayed and I understand. However, they started and got from first class to row 24 and stopped, no turbulence Then when they began again they started in first class again and stopped at front of main cabin. Now it’s 1:20 later and they are only at row 15! Not only slow on uptake, but very rude to serve some rows 2 or 3 times, while the rest of us are within anything Dinner hour and free is choice of 4 snacks or $12 or $10 purchase offerings. I get that weather delayed inbound
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York JFK to Boise via Salt Lake City', 'Date Flown': 'March 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 5, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Considering my review below, this was surprising. Mediocre at best. Seat etc was fine but so much was not. To start, some( not all) of the crew was grouchy or impersonal. A few were great. Second, at the gate free fast Wi-Fi was announced, neither was true. Once we crossed the coast line wi fi shut off for the rest of the trip.The crew insisted that was normal but considering on the same flight(reverse direction) same type aircraft we had full service, that just wasn’t true. One crew member quie2tly agreed and didn’t understand. In any case at least half the fee should be refunded (good luck to me.) The food was mediocre at best.In between the meal and snack only chips and cookies were available (10 1/2 hour trip) IFE was fine. I guess real complaint was a majority of crew who wanted to be anywhere else.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A330-300', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Honolulu', 'Date Flown': 'February 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  A really good experience. Because these are the old LATAM jets with 2-2-2 seating I was expecting a second rate trip. I was wrong. Seat was more comfortable than Delta Suites for sleeping. Crew was great. Warm and proactive service from start to finish. Skipped dinner 1130pm departure) so I  could sleep but breakfast 1 1/2 before landing was quite good. Didn’t watch anything but wi fi was great. Arrived early, everything was perfect.

header: "first class was good except the crew"
author: R Logan
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I do not know if I will fly Delta again. Their first class was good except the crew, never said hi or anything nice. They just grunted a lot to us. I know it is a hard job for them.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Sacramento to New York JFK via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'March 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Declan Letourneau
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta Airlines is the best airline I’ve ever flown. Our flight was not delayed, I got free access to the Delta Sky Club and I didn’t even have a membership. The economy seat was super comfortable, and we got seatback entertainment. They offered earplugs, and headphones to listen to the back entertainment. It works super well. There were so many options to choose from. They were passing out dinner. But I just got a cranberry cocktail And some cookies. We had the smoothest landing I have ever seen. If you haven’t flown Delta before, I recommend it on your next trip. The staff are super kind, on time, departure, and arrival, and it really feels like your first class in economy. The only thing that I recommend out for is the prices. For example, I flew around Christmas time, which is pretty expensive for Delta airlines. So if you want to fly, Delta, fly around February. That’s the best prices to fly with Delta but other than that, I highly recommen, was very satisfied.

author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Excellent experience except for the dinner which was fine no wow. Overnight flight, lie flat seat. Extremely comfortable flight made better by an attentive, friendly cabin crew. On time departure and early arrival. Entertainment was great. Literally nothing to complain about. Solid experience.

header: “Delta is refusing to engage with me”
author: L Shaw
reviewBody: Not Verified | I booked a long haul flight from Chicago to Tokyo with a layover in Detroit. The flight from Chicago to Detroit got delayed 3 hours, rendering my connecting flight impossible to catch. The only choice they gave me was to take a different flight at a different airport with a different airline. I recognised this new flight from when I was booking flights and it was significantly cheaper than my original. It was, after all, a much worse airline. So I wanted to be compensated for the price difference and the taxi fare to the different airport ($86). Delta is categorically refusing to engage with me on this because it was a "weather delay" and therefore "out of their control." Well it was not in my control either. I paid for a service, I did not receive it. Why should I pay for a service I did not receive? If I go to a steakhouse and order a $500 wagyu steak, but they tell me they're out of the wagyu and instead give me a cheap rubbery $10 steak, then insist on charging me the $500 of the wagyu, that would be grounds for a lawsuit. Why should this be any different?
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Chicago to Tokyo via Detroit', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "Questioning if I will fly Delta again"
author: Edwin Donis
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Questioning myself if I will fly Delta again! My flight schedule was to depart from Guatemala at 8:15AM as we were already in the waiting room one hour before the scheduled time, changed the departure to 1:00 PM that is almost 5 hours delayed, and 4 hours later the again changed the schedule to 2:00 PM. That is now 6 hours delayed and still with a question mark as the luggage is outside the plane. I complained to them over messages and they lied to me that it was for bad weather and an hour later another airline departed to LA with no delays. Later I convinced the to tell me the “truth” that it was for maintenance issues. Regardless I believe Delta has serious problems with their existing management as last week my niece had the same problem. Their agents or people responding are very polite trying to compensate for the bad experience but the root of this problem is coming from their managers.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Guatemala to Los Angeles', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: K Koskinen
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Flight was fine. Food (roast beef salad) was quite good. Good service in first class. We unfortunately missed our return flight. We arrived at the counter 43 minutes before takeoff, 7 minutes before boarding and were told we were too late and couldn’t check in. The airport was empty. We are TSA pre-checked and priority with purchased first class tickets. There was absolutely no effort  by the counter agent to try to help us on to the flight. Just a shrug. She did try to help us book other flights, which would have been a red eye, losing first class seats and flying coach for a leg for one of us, and cost an extra $2000 per ticket on top of our already purchased first class seats. Thankfully we were able to see on our phone that we could fly first class on American to our destination with a far better schedule for only $1223 each first class. I have never experienced such an utter lack of effort on the part of an airline to get a customer on their flight. Super disappointed in Delta
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'San Antonio to Las Vegas', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Mahmud Noormohamed
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Flew roundtrip from DFW-BOS. Both inbound and outbound legs were on A220-100. This is an awesome aircraft very similar to the A220-300. The engines are very quiet and the seats wider than bigger single aisle planes and very comfortable. Overhead bins large enough to accommodate carry on bags. Bathrooms are very spacious more so than on larger B737 or A320s. No delay inbound to BOS; however the outbound flight to DFW was delayed by 2h 30m because of the winter storms. Delta through its mobile app and messaging kept us informed of each and every flight delay update. Although delayed we were glad to be home rather than being stranded in BOS. WiFi worked flawlessly on both flights. Cabin crews were very friendly offering snacks and water periodically throughout the flight. The DFW-BOS nonstop is a new route for Delta and I would definitely fly Delta again.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Airbus A220-100', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Dallas Ft Worth to Boston', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Jason Ferguson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Platinum Medallion member. Wallet was stolen on a trip, and presented ticket and official ID. Was allowed in every airport lounge except Atlanta. Total lack of customer service, inconsistent practices and the workers looked as though they couldn’t care less. RUN. BAD AIRLINE
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Phoenix to Columbus', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: D Hayes
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  If you like having your flights delayed, being lied to, incompetent employees and terrible customer service then Delta is for you. We arrived at 0530 for a flight to LAX for a cruise. They were so unequipped, the didn’t check the maintenance of their aircraft, chemicals used to de ice the wings and will not give you a refund. We boarded and de-boarded three different planes. The first one didn’t have de-icing for the wings, the second one sat on the tarmac for two hours and was taken to the hanger for maintenance and the final one didn’t have fuel and needed over 10000 gallons to be filled. My family tried to get off and they refused because they had shut the door. We missed our paid for cruise due to their lies, negligence, incompetent management and delay after delay after delay. Delta employees, including the pilot, told us we would make it in time for the cruise. We sat for over 9 hours, our cruise left at 3:30 and we touched down at 3:30. They gave us half of our ticket price, a hotel that was completely booked because of all the delays and the only reason they gave us the vouchers was because it was maintenance problems. If it is the weather causing delay they don't give you anything. We had to pay 400 dollars to fly out, rent a van for 130 for two days of use, buy our own hotel rooms because the one they gave us didn’t have any extra rooms. Today we fly out, scheduled to depart at 7 o'clock and the expected departure is 2300.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to Boise', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Tyson
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Our flight to Kona was in economy, and we paid extra for "premium economy" seating on the return. Delta's boarding process is chaotic, resembling a free-for-all for the last groups to board. Economy passengers were allowed to board after everyone else. The frustration arises when individuals unrelated to Business or First class board ahead of families. Consequently, families end up sitting apart from each other. I strongly discourage choosing their "Premium Economy," as it doesn't provide the promised better seating. Despite paying extra, we experienced no improvement during our two layovers on the return flight. Business class, First class, and other groups board first, rendering the premium upgrade ineffective. I will never use this airline again. The only positive aspect was the seats themselves. Including TVs would be beneficial as well, especially considering the chaotic situation they have created.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Salt Lake City to Kona', 'Date Flown': 'October 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Shelly Smitten
reviewBody: Not Verified | Delta used to be good, but now it has gone downhill. We couldn't take our flight and they emailed and said will issue a full credit back to my bank. But they lied and no refund ever happened. When we asked they ended up giving us an ecredit $400 short of our original payment! Be aware this company will not do what it promises.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to London', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Carre
reviewBody: Not Verified | This airline unnecessarily harassed me repeatedly for no reason. I have a physical disability and was offered zero assistance with my bags while other passengers in the exact same position during pre boarding were all offered this help. Before I could ask for help the attendants literally turned their back on me. I was told I couldn’t have my small 3inch by 2 inch bag was too big to keep on my person and/or the seat in front of me and instead the attendant took it from me to place in a “safe place” of her own choosing. I feel this is entirely unprofessional and unnecessary. I fly constantly and have never had any of this happen before. I’ll be surprised if they actually have a wheelchair waiting for me as requested over 48 hours ago after this flight. I will never fly Delta ever again. The attendants are on a weird power trip that has absolutely zero to do with safety or protocol.

author: M Janavic
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Terrible experience! The flight was late 2 hours and 20 minutes. In Atlanta we were running to catch their flight to Amsterdam. Worst company ever.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Montego Bay to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Abbasi
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta Air Lines is worse than the worst! I can’t believe how they treat their customers. I got tickets from San Diego to Shanghai and it turned to be worst experience ever. I wish I got economy of United or something. In two flights that I had with them they delayed them more than 5 times, that’s a record, not a good one though. My flight from San Diego to Seattle was delayed more than hour and so I got to the gate at Seattle for my Shanghai trip, 10 mins before flight and they didn’t let me in cause the gate was closed. They closed them 15 mins before flight so if they waited 5 mins for me and another travelers, we would’ve made it. They could see the first flight was delayed, the first flight was also delta but they didn’t wait even 5mins. The story gets better: They rescheduled my flight for tomorrow, they offered a 3 star hotel and only one voucher for a meal for 15$. I paid 8k on my ticket and that’s how they treated once I missed my flight due to their technical issues. The day after, I was at the airport for my second flight 3 hours before departure at 11:37am. Guess what? It got delayed! Once to 2pm, once gain to 3:16, and again to 4:20pm!!! All due to maintenance!! Right before boarding for 4:20, they delayed it again to 5:20pm because they didn’t have enough crew! To make it right, they sent out a 15$ meal voucher, how generous! Never fly with Delta! They don’t care about their customers at all.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'San Diego to Shanghai via Seattle', 'Date Flown': 'January 2024', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Tarah Blum
reviewBody: Not Verified | It’s such a shame, because remember growing up hearing about Delta and the wonderful high-class experience, it used to be and my husband and I even use them for our honeymoon and we qualified for the Sky club for platinum members and it was such a wonderful experience and now they’ve taken away all of the wonderful things that used to make Delta so special. Now they’re just some regular poor airline like every other poor airline and there’s nothing for platinum members anymore. It’s like they don’t care about anyone anymore only money just like everybody else.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Santa Ana', 'Date Flown': 'July 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "a lack of respect for the customers"
author: F Carroll
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I had meticulously planned, reserved, and paid for my ticket months in advance. However, I encountered an unexpected time change that resulted in the loss of a day of work and pay. Moreover, my daughter, who was scheduled to pick me up from LAX, also had to call out of work on short notice to accommodate my arrival. This inconvenience not only impacted our schedules but also resulted in a full day of lost wages for both of us. While I understand that unforeseen circumstances can arise, what concerns me is the lack of explanation or communication regarding this time change. As a conscientious traveler, I believe it is essential to be informed of any alterations to the scheduled itinerary, especially when such changes can have a significant impact on personal and professional commitments. Just because the airline may have included it in fine print somewhere does not give them the right to change things without reason or explanation. The unexpected adjustment not only disrupted my carefully planned schedule but also led to an unplanned day off from work, incurring additional costs and inconveniences. Despite my attempts to call, I was put on hold for hours, and every time someone picked up, they transferred me to someone else without offering any explanation for deciding to switch my flight. This lack of communication not only created other inconveniences but also resulted in additional expenses. I believe this shows a lack of respect for the customers.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Boston to Los Angeles', 'Date Flown': 'September 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Isabel Domingues
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I am flying alone with 2 children, and on the way back my first leg of the trip was canceled. Delta didn’t give me any options just offered to refund me. Not even able to reach an actual person to talk to, only AI available. I am currently still stranded and Delta just send me a message saying that they had no alternative. I bought my ticket at delta website

author: C Flanagan
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Unreliable. Stuck in Seattle for hours. Reliability is key when traveling. I will avoid Delta Airlines and Seattle Airport in the future. Overall lame.

author: Jay Zimmerman
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Talked to 4 different agents about bringing a 20lb dog home with me. Every single one said it was ok. Ticket counter refused to take the dog and told me sorry while smiling in my face. They couldn't care less that I now need to cancel my ticket, find a hotel room during Christmas weekend, rent a car and find a shipper for a dog. Thanks Delta for all the Christmas joy.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Denver to Honolulu via Seattle', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "take some class on how to treat passengers"
author: H Edytka
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I fly Delta often the flight usually quick and smooth crew always nice polite and discreet. Today however DL5219 departing LGA 11:49am to Indianapolis for the first time in forever I had gotten up to use the bathroom. I'm at seat 18 can't see if the doors are closed or not so I figured last call to run to use the bathroom it was only 3 rows back. I get the attendant walk over after I get in my seat giving me a speech about how I can't be up when the door is closed. I was humiliated that the whole back of the plane had to know I had to use the bathroom so bad after 2 large ice teas. She kept going about I should have pressed some button blah blah. She could have leaned in and be bit more polite. Her manners do not belong anywhere near ppl.I hope nobody else has to encounter her as she should probably take some class on how to treat passengers. This was the first time I encountered something like that. Hopefully they can correct this.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'LaGuardia to Indianapolis', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Michael Strollo
reviewBody: Not Verified |  To be fair, we had a 2 hour weather delay in Rochester but got to LaGuardia on time to transfer to our next plane. The next plane left 10 minutes early, and we watched it leave the terminal. When we rebooked, the agent wrote the wrong gate on our tickets. Luckily, we double checked the gate which was a ten minute walk. Thoroughly disgusted with Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Keane
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  My family and I flew Delta Air Lines where both of my luggage I checked in, I paid for. My 15 year old son who plays sports, is an A & B student, works Friday nights as a busboy, came to me asking where the gift box from Bath & Bodywork’s went being that he bought this as a gift for his girlfriend. Several of our items went missing (that could not be carried on) and when I filed a complaint with Delta, they stated they cannot do anything about it or investigate as this would be providing me preferential treatment. In the event you are traveling, do not check anything that might be attractive for one to steal. Delta had my luggage delivered within 12 hrs of the flight at 5:38AM where they left personal items on my front porch without a signature. They have to do better on protecting one’s personal items you pay to have delivered - at minimum, offer insurance if they’re going to allow for their associates to remove and steal items from your luggage. Super disappointed. A huge reminder on how not to treat customers…
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to New York', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Kemp
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Our flight from PDX to SEA was delayed by 30 minutes because of a faulty chair, a mechanic came on the plane and fiddled with it for that amount of time seemly not knowing what he was doing. This was a connecting flight to a flight headed towards PHX with 15 people now running late for a flight. The staff aboard the plane we were on assured us that the other plane knew we were coming and not to worry, and then took a leisurely time taking off making us even later. When we got to SEA we were instructed to run halfway through the airport to our gate, which we did, only to be told that the plane to PHX was departing early without us even when they knew that all 15 of us were on our way. Delta cares more about their punctual reputation than their actual passengers that THEY made late. Now my boyfriend is missing his grandfathers memorial because the next flight to Phoenix is not for another 12 hours and we are stuck in Seattle.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Seattle to Phoenix', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Santiago LLera
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I would like to express my sincere gratitude to Nadia and Manuel who work at ticketing in San Antonio, TX airport. On Saturday, December 2, 2023, I arrived at the airport with only 30 minutes left before my flight was scheduled to depart. I express my most sincere apologies for my late check in and ask them if there is anything they could do to help me out. They were very attentive and instead of telling me you are late; they were fast to ask me and listen to my needs and the personal problem I was going through. They immediately started making phone calls to the point to receive the authorization to allow me to check in and make it to my flight. I want to share my gratitude and appreciation to Nadia and Manuel for going above and beyond their duties to help a customer. Employees like this should be rewarded for their actions. I am eternally grateful due to their actions; I was able to reach my destination on time and spent time with my family in a moment of need. -
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'San Antonio to San Juan', 'Date Flown': 'December 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: E Vortel
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was denied my pre-booked window seat and forced to sit in the middle seat between 2 obese men. The man assigned to the middle seat was moved to my seat. I had no room to move. After a couple hours I became dangerously overheated, began sweating profusely and nauseated. I got up to use the restroom and ended up fainting, falling backwards, injuring my head and neck. I couldn’t safely get up for 20 minutes or more. I was placed back in the same seat for the remaining 7 hours, unable to safely use the restroom. Delta denied responsibility. Stated initially I want on the flight despite hundreds of witnesses. Even the captain was informed. They then stated they had the the right to deny passengers their seats for any reason, even if it results in bodily injury. They also stated they checked the seating logs and determined there were other women on the flight seated in window seats, therefore it was not discriminatory. I was of similar size of the man that was given my seat. My injury required medical attention and therapy. Delta offered me a $100 flight coupon for my “inconvenience “. I was flying alone internationally, I am 60 years old. I am fearful to ever fly alone again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Amsterdam', 'Date Flown': 'September 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "went over and beyond to help us"
author: Erika Romero
reviewBody: Not Verified | Customer Service went over and beyond to help us to make sure are flight linked. Including everything else to make things go smoothly. Beyond Grateful, God bless you all that do customer service in and out each day! HAPPY HOLIDAYS AND a HAPPY NEW YEAR !

author: R Sheedy
reviewBody: Not Verified | Delta Air Lines 12 hours from Sydney - LAX and 229,000k SkyMiles to upgrade: - power does not work - recline does not work - Wifi does not work - Audio does not work - Allergic to all 3 of the meals and no alternatives My recompense? 30,000k miles. Never, ever again!

header: “my screen was not working at all”
author: Valerie Schnaufer
reviewBody: Not Verified | We flew Delta from NYC to Rome and paid to be seated in Comfort Plus as it was an 8 hour flight and thought it would be worth it. Upon settling in, I noticed my screen was not working at all. My husband tried his and there was no sound as the headphone jack was damaged. We alerted the flight attendant and nothing happened. After 3 attempts one finally tried to reset mine, unsuccessfully. The flight was full so we had no option but to sit in our seats and be the only people on the flight that had no way to watch a movie or follow our route for 8 hours. So much for “Comfort Plus” and the high price we paid for the services we didn’t get. After our trip I tried to reach out to Delta Customer Service. It took 2 hours to reach a human only to be informed they no longer have a live person to talk with and the only route was online which got me nowhere with their “Chat”. I tried several times to file a complaint but my responses were not in the field of answers. I finally was able to file a complaint by not answering questions on the form and got an email from a human that I could now email back and try to describe our experience. Why would they think we’d ever fly with them again as there is the chance that the seats we are assigned could have non working monitors and electronics? What other equipment isn’t working on their aircraft?
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'New York JFK to Rome', 'Date Flown': 'October 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Cindy Wymer
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Our plane left Spokane late, and we missed our connecting flight. We were told to go to the Delta help desk. There has been no one here for forty-five minutes. It is very frustrating! There is a line of people and not one worker trying to help, or get help. Come on Delta! Can’t you do better?
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Spokane to Seattle', 'Date Flown': 'November 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Lori Levit
reviewBody: Not Verified |  On an international flight with Delta, I was refused my pre-booked window seat and placed in a middle seat between 2 obese males. My seat was given to a man to fly comfortably and I was made to fly in his seat, without leg or armroom. A few hours into the flight I became severely overheated, began sweating profusely, and felt nauseated. I got up to use the restroom and ended up passing out cold in the middle aisle. I was only able to get safely up after 20 minutes. I was placed in the same seat without assistance to the restroom. I am a 60 year old women, it was a 9-hour flight, and I myself am not small. In the subsequent fall, I injured myself, requiring nearly 3 months to recover. Delta refused any responsibility or compensation. They would not even refund the cost of the flight. Their representatives first denied I was even on the plane despite a boarding pass and over 300 witnesses. They have also stated they did not discriminate because they had checked and other women were not denied their window seats on that flight. They stated they are able to move you from your seat for any reason, even if it results in injury to the passenger. They stated if I had purchased a first-class ticket perhaps this would not have occurred. Trying to deal with the second-largest airline in the world is impossible. They do not follow international regulations designed to protect passengers and they set up an impossible system when seeking compensation. shifting blame to their partnering airlines, despite being on a Delta flight, with Delta employees. I have had to speak with over 12 employees, supervisors, and others and received only stonewalling, the denial of responsibility, and a lack of any respect, follow-up or concern.

author: Amanda McCurdy
reviewBody: Not Verified |  We had a great experience on Delta. We had a flight diversion due to low visibility. I felt that the pilot made the right call to not land the plane on a dark foggy runway.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Jacksonville to Spokane', 'Date Flown': 'November 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Robert Grzesik
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   I simply requested a glass of wine during the in-flight service, and to my astonishment, I was flatly denied, with the crew member condescendingly explaining that wine was a privilege reserved for first-class passengers only. This bewildering policy was apparently due to the 'short-haul flight' rule. This sparked a heated debate, during which I felt an unprecedented level of disrespect as a paying customer. Every other airline I've flown with has offered this basic courtesy, often complimentary.  I am  disappointed and disheartened by Delta's disregard for passenger satisfaction. Their staff's dismissive attitude left me feeling belittled. Fly with Delta, and prepare to be overlooked and undervalued. I certainly won't be making that mistake again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York to Toronto', 'Date Flown': 'November 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "I paid for that flight and felt attacked"
author: W Norden
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  We had landed in BOS heading for the gate. Plane stops, pilots comes on the intercom sorry for the delay, waiting for another plane to leave the gate. No worries. A young woman and her child get up to use the bathroom, they were seated right in front of me. They were allowed to, no problem. I figured, ok I guess that's acceptable. Get up to use the bathroom myself. The flight attendant aggressively demands I return to my seat immediately. This was not a polite nor friendly tone of voice I was greeted with. Where I take issue, is that even though I was standing two feet away from him, he announced this into the intercom to the whole plane. I asked him if he knew he was scolding me over the intercom and he said yes. I returned to my seat through the humiliating stares and laughs of the full plane. I returned after we were at the gate to use the restroom, and extended him the opportunity to apologize which he did not take. I feel that I have the right to privacy in the event a flight attendant needs to give me instructions, especially when Im standing two feet away from them. I had zero interaction with this young man until that moment and provoked him in no way, but felt he punitively used the intercom against me in that moment for no justifiable reason. I filed a formal complaint with Delta and their very tepid response was essentially "oh sorry about that." I paid for that flight and felt attacked
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Charleston to Boston', 'Date Flown': 'November 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Will Lynch-Slocum
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta used to be great, but have really cut back their service offering. Multiple times I've been booted from a window seat in coach and "upgraded" to a middle seat in economy+ for a 5 hour red-eye booked flight where they were unable to reverse it. Ive had =baggage handlers go through my bags, lose my bags, break my luggage, and am currently sitting on the line with customer service for 2 hours still giving them my flight information after being routed to 4 different representatives. I could have spent less time driving across the country. Not much difference between Delta and Southwest these days, so might as well save a few bucks with another airline. Two hours sitting on hold and I decided to use this time to write my first ever review of a business. Side note: the level of DIY "self service" has also become ridiculous.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to Orlando', 'Date Flown': 'November 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  A really nice trip. As always, the flight attendants can really make the difference. For this five hour trip, the seats were ok, the entertainment offerings were excellent, the food was decent ( especially using today’s lower standards) but the highlight was truly excellent attentive service by Bonnie, the lead flight attendant serving first class (16 seats) pretty much on her own. I’ve taken this flight often and sometimes see a rushed dinner service followed by a disappearing act until hours later. This wonderfully friendly and extremely efficient flight attendant was amazing and made a so so experience quite wonderful. She constantly checked on us leaving us wanting or needing nothing.

Why would you separate a family with 2 kids? We fly out twice a year for vacations. No longer flying Frontier and Spirit. Adding Delta to that list.

reviewBody: Not Verified | I purchased a ticket for a flight on May 23rd. They gave me a ticket for May 24th. reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was charged $1486.20 on the Nov.3rd 2023 when I bought the tickets, then was charged again for $1486.20 on the 5th. author: E Keares
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I'm handicapped and specifically booked 1st class to be sure I have some comfort from LAX to OGG. However, this was the worst experience in over 35 years of flying. For 839$ (one way!) I got less space and comfort than on Hawaiian Airlines economy. The cabin was ice cold, no seat extension or anything, max 10°reclining possible. I took several pictures, some attaching. I expected an apology or refund, nada. Do not fly Delta.

author: C Miller
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | I am writing to express my profound disappointment with the service I received on Delta Flight 800. I have always chosen Delta for its reputation for superior service and reliability, but my recent experience has made me reconsider that choice. To begin with, I was taken aback when, after upgrading to Comfort Class, I was relocated from an aisle seat to a middle seat without any prior notification or choice. Such a switch considerably reduced the comfort level I had anticipated with the upgrade. This was the first sign of my forthcoming ordeal. Upon addressing my concern at the airport, I was given a sheer run-around, being referred from one agent to another, with each passing the responsibility onto someone else. It felt as though my comfort and satisfaction as a customer were not valued in the slightest. My in-flight experience was no better. The flight attendants seemed disinterested and distant, making me feel more like a burden than a valued passenger. My simple request for an apple juice was met with confusion as I was handed a diet coke instead. This may seem like a trivial mistake, but it's indicative of the lack of attention to passenger needs. Moreover, after requesting headsets to perhaps distract myself from the accumulating frustrations, I had to repeat my request. Waiting an hour for such a basic amenity is unacceptable, especially when I could see other passengers receiving prompt service. I had hoped that my upgrade to Comfort Class would ensure a pleasant journey, but I found myself facing a series of disappointments and inconveniences. The lack of coordination, attention to detail, and basic courtesy have left a lasting negative impression. I urge Delta to look into these matters seriously. No passenger should feel as undervalued and disregarded as I did on Flight 800.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Fort Lauderdale to Los Angeles', 'Date Flown': 'October 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jody Brokaw
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  The flight attendants on my flight were absolutely the greatest ever. Kennedy, Brigit, Robin & Goldie made me feel comfortable and relaxed during my emergency flight to Idaho to see my dying sister. They checked on my well being throughout the flight and stopped by my seat to give me hugs. I'm so grateful for the crew.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Sacramento to Boise', 'Date Flown': 'October 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Mahmud Noormohamed
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Inbound flight from PVD to DFW via LGA was on a CRJ900. This aircraft is comfortable with plenty of legroom; however, the overhead cabins are too small to hold a carry on bag with outside pocket. No delay and smooth flight to LGA. Connecting flight to DFW was on a A220-300. This is an awesome aircraft. If I could fly the A220-300 all the time I would do it. The engines are very quiet. The seats are wider than bigger single aisle planes and very comfortable. The overhead cabins are large enough to accommodate carryon bags. The bathrooms are spacious more so than on larger single aisle planes e.g. B737 and/or A320s. No delay on either leg and the cabin crews were very friendly offering snacks periodically. In flight WiFi worked flawlessly on A220 but was spotty on CRJ 900. I haven't flown DL in quite come time, but I definitely would fly this airline again.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'CRJ-900/A220-300', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Providence to Dallas Fort-Worth via LaGuardia', 'Date Flown': 'October 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "It was their system that was bad"
author: L Tran
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I hold a business class ticket from Air France. Air France cancelled my flight and rebooked me with Delta. Things seemed to be smooth as I could select my seat, 1D, and checked on Delta's website that the seat was reserved,  until Delta required me to check-in at the airport. I went to the Delta One section, the check-in agent was very nice and found my reservation, provided to me a boarding pass, only without a seat number. She made several attempts to request for one, but the system only allowed my seat to be assigned at the gate. Not only that, my boarding pass neither showed the class of service nor Sky Priority status, though she ensured me several times that I would be travelling in Delta One. The inconvenience began from there, with the security agent refused to allow me to use the Sky Priority line; not an issue as I was early. I did not get access to the Sky Club; not an issue either as I still could do it with my Amex Platinum card but chose to skip as the Sky Club was packed with a long waiting line. The gate agent finally assigned me a seat, exactly my seat 1D, but only until an hour before boarding. With US carriers having a reputation of dumping passengers for no reason, being through that process is not fun. It got a lot better on board, though not necessarily excellent. Cabin staff were very nice and accommodating. Food was just average in taste, and the whole meal was served on a single tray. I flew Delta One from JFK to Frankfurt a year earlier, and the meal was delicious and was properly served course after course. Not sure why there is such disparity on 2 very comparable routes. The semi-Delta One Suite was more spacious and comfortable than I thought, but it still lagged behind many leading products out there. Why do I still recommend the airline? Because I could see efforts from staff to help me. It was their system that was bad.
stats: {'Aircraft': '767-400', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'New York to Paris CDG', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: G Salam
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Bad attitude and customer service. I was flying from San Diego to Detroit on Delta. The Delta representative in the boarding was very rude. She made sure to stop me as she said I have three items (backpack, carry-on and small 6x4” crossbody). I had to step out of the lane put my crossbody inside the backpack. I had to lose my flower bouquets (the one my daughter gave me for my birthday) because of my 6x4” crossbody. I’m not sure what was her problem with me, but it was obvious she is not treating everyone equal as three people in front of me, including my husband, had three items with them and she let them go to the plain without saying anything to them. I am very disappointed with Delta staff. Delta was my first stop to shop for flight it will not be anymore for sure. I am using my mileage on the Delta Amex then I will not care about it anymore. You lost a good customer Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'San Diego to Detroit', 'Date Flown': 'October 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: E Gan
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   This review pertains to the SkyMiles program. During the months of January and February in 2023, I embarked on a series of flights with Delta's partner airlines, which included LATAM, Aerolineas Argentinas, and Saudia. Regrettably, I failed to input my SkyMiles number when booking these flights. Consequently, I had to request mileage credit post-flight, a process that is typically straightforward. However, my experience with Delta proved to be far from hassle-free. Securing mileage credit from Delta proved to be an ordeal that required multiple requests and calls to customer service before any credit was recorded. It was not until September, a full seven months after my initial application, that I finally received mileage credit for the Saudia flights. Astonishingly, during a call with an agent in March, I was told my requests had been “archieved” and thus not acted upon. Then, when I called again in October, the agent advised that they had no record whatsoever that I had put in any request – this despite the fact that the agent in March had advised that my requests were safely in and I need not put them in again. It wasn't until October, following yet another customer service call, that I was granted the deserved credit for the Aerolineas Argentinas flights. However, the same agent informed me that she was unable to credit me for the LATAM flights, citing allegedly missing information in the documents I provided (boarding passes and receipts). In response, I diligently explained via email that all the requisite information was indeed included in the documents, but received no response. When I acquired a letter from LATAM confirming the presence of all necessary details and forwarded it to the agent with a request for confirmation of receipt, I was met with silence once more. Upon reaching out to Delta customer service to follow up, I was met with an abrupt response, being told that I "could not keep calling them," despite this being only my initial follow-up call, and that further contact would supposedly further delay the process. The agent then refused to provide me with any case number or confirmation number for my call – which goes against most customer service protocols. The culmination of these experiences has led me to the unfortunate realization that Delta's customer service falls far short of the expected standards, characterized by contradictory instructions, leading customers on wild goose chases to obtain information already provided, and gaslighting of customers. It appears that this deliberate "intentional friction" is designed with the expectation that customers will eventually abandon their pursuit of rightful mileage credit. Such service is incredibly disappointing for an airline that is purportedly renowned for its high level of customer service in the United States.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Date Flown': 'May 2023', 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Keale
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   This business class was horrible. The beds were so small and tight that I nor my 2 friends got any sleep. We were so disappointed and really felt ripped off for spending 5 grand on this through princess ezair. You’re so busy trying to saved a buck that you cram in too many seats. It’s a joke to call this business class. Have to fly home November 3. Not looking forward to being up again all night.

author: Shloime Minzer
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I purchased a flight from Tel Aviv to JFK, they made an Emergency Landing in Dublin Ireland, their system was down so they couldn't provide any new flights, I paid $1300 for a new flight for me and my wife. And now after applying for reimbursements and being with them on Hold I got this email from Delta saying "I understand you received a $200 travel voucher (they didn't) from our Proactive Service Recovery team, as we understand this trip was not as pleasant as it should have been. The compensation provided is not meant to place a value on your experience; rather it is an attempt to make amends for your disappointment with our service. You mentioned you had to book a ticket on another airline. While we share your disappointment, we hope you understand we are unable to consider reimbursement for other airline tickets, unused hotels, car rentals, recreational tickets, lost wages/income, child/pet care, or loss of time in these instances. Accordingly, we are unable to honor your request. We realize this is a disappointment, and trust you understand our position".

author: E Gaisen
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   I've never missed a connecting flight before. Our Delta plane landed on time but had to wait for a gate. I missed my flight by 5 mins. A group of us watched from inside the airport while the plane just sat there. I thought they would wait to close the gate especially since we were going from one delta flight to another. I will avoid booking with Delta from now on and avoid layovers at Atlanta International.

author: Ranny Westby
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |   Delta is terrible. I had a flight scheduled to depart at 4pm and arrive in Atlanta at 6:45 where I needed to connect to another flight that left at 7:10. That main flight delayed 3x and I had to change my connecting flight twice until finally for the 3rd time there were no more connecting flights. They offered me another flight the next day that would arrive too late for my purpose of travel. Thanks to delta I missed my cousins funeral.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to West Palm beach', 'Date Flown': 'October 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Hanson
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Spent a lot of money for a Delta one ticket. 1 hour into a 11 hour flight, my inflight entertainment stopped working. Despite the flight attendant attempting to restart it, it still didnt work. I was stuck there for close to 10 hours without any in flight entertainment. I filed a complaint, and only received a measly 10,000 points (monetary value of $100). I replied advising that this felt inadequate, and the response I received was that this was the maximum they offered for this kind of issue. Extremely disappointed, spent $2000 for terrible experience, and all they offer is $100 in return. Will never fly Delta again if I can avoid it.

header: "never fly with Delta Air Lines again"
author: Elizabeth Wakefield
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Twenty minutes into the flight one of the two toilets on board for main cabin and economy class passengers stopped working. The only functioning toilet door was very difficult to open and the toilet was cleaned only once during the entire 5hr flight. The reason why I know that is because I was sitting in an exit row close to the toilets. Secondly, one of the flight attendants was rather rude she has no customer service skills and it was evident that she really did not want to do her job. We will never fly with Delta Air Lines again.

author: Matt Hampton
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | 1st Delta changed all 4 of our family's seats and double booked our 13 year old child and he was forced to stand for part of the flight. Then we landed in Atlanta and our connecting flight was cancelled to Huntsville, AL. They of course blamed weather so they wouldn't have to be held accountable although a flight (DL1726) flew out of Atlanta to Huntsville an hour later. We were told at the ticket counter our next available flight would be 3 days later and if that wasn't "good enough" we would have to choose ground transportation and we would be reimbursed for the flight not taken and a rental car. We were given the runaround for over 8 weeks now and over 5 hours of our time for Delta to offer us $25 credit towards our cancelled flight (not money back) and now they won't even reimburse us our $275 rental car to drive through the night to get our child to NASA Space camp on a Sunday. Very Disappointed!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Portland to Huntsville via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Amaraja Kanitkar
reviewBody: Not Verified |  The ticketing agent cancelled my leg of the flight to Orlando from Detroit for today when rebooking my second leg despite telling us otherwise on the phone. The agent today that we spoke to from the airport was not helpful and just told us to buy a new ticket which would be over $500. I have been forced to fly another airline separately from my family with great inconvenience. The agent who messed up my reservation on August 22nd should be reprimanded for her incompetence and negligence causing emotional and financial stress. Such agents shouldn't be allowed to work for Delta. Extremely poor service experience both then and today. Pity, I used to think Delta was one of the better airlines .

author: Sam Cherry
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Absolute trash company. We bought flights months ago with miles and the company overbooked the flight. The flight was originally for 10:30 am and they decided to put us on the 7:30 am flight. When I called to fix the problem I was told their rates had gone up and they offered me the original flight but in the main cabin rather than comfort +. I was told I'll have to take the flight and ask for a refund. I was told the refund department will decide if we get a refund or not. I've never had this many problems with American Airlines.
