header: "Delta has lost my business for good"
author: A Colman
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I've unfortunately already booked a couple more flights with this airline, but that will be the last time. I thought that Delta's standards had improved over the years, but I had the worst airline experience on September 29th at LAX's terminal 3. I got to the airport early and I had my dog in his carrier. I got stopped by a female employee who told me that my dog was too big for his carrier. This is not the case, he is a chihuahua mix, and I have flown with my dog many times with no issues on much longer flights. She did not offer any solutions, just told me I could not fly with the carrier I had. I got in line to talk to customer service to figure out what my options were, and she then ushered me over again with a manager. The manager told me I could only fly with my dog if I purchased a different carrier from Delta. While the manager went to get the carrier, I waited for 45-50 minutes and almost ran out of time to check my bag. When the manager came back, she had a carrier the same size if not smaller than the one I walked in with. I was flustered and just wanted to get on my flight since I was running out of time, and they charged me $75 for a cramped Delta-branded carrier. I was stressed, my dog was stressed, and I had to literally run through the airport, jostling my poor dog, to make my flight in time (5 minutes later and I would have missed it.) It felt like a weird, gross scam and it was the most stressed out I've ever been dealing with an airline before. I fly extremely frequently (6-12 roundtrip flights a year via various airlines) but Delta has lost my business for good.

author: Manav Parmar
reviewBody: Not Verified |  This airline truly marked the beginning of my vacation. I was travelling with my family to Jamaica and we already had bad experience at JFK Airport. Thankfully, this airline was a polar opposite of the airport. The staff was very kind and the food was good. Thank you Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York JFK to Montego Bay', 'Date Flown': 'November 2022', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "A horror of a night in an airplane"
author: Roland Jegge
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | One of my worst journeys ever! Our experience started with the inability to check in online on Delta.com and paying for a 3rd additional suitcase, which forced us to get up early and to stand in line at terminal 2 at SFO airport, with the aggressive handling of a red suited male supervisor, making is repack our suitcases. After this stress we made it to near our departing gate for DL 916 to ATL right in time. We wanted to buy a sandwich and the departure screen showed on time for our flight. No sign of boarding, so we took our time. Suddenly the panel changed to last call, a practice I had seen in no other airport in the world. When notifying the harsh eyed lady at the Delta boarding gate, she only shrugged her shoulders and said this was the airport not the airline responsible for this wording. Guest feedback obviously is valued at Delta Airlines. Being a Skyteam frequent flyer with Air France Flying Blue, I wanted to connect to the wifi, but this was only allowed to Delta Skymiles members - or if I wanted to register with Delta Skymiles - an aberration if I am already a member with Flying Blue. Changing flight in Atlanta, we found ourselves in a packed plane and our seats being 50F and E, we could not even place our travelling backpacks in the overhead department, because two of these overheads were filled with the return flight staff equipment, so we had to squeeze these bags between our legs during 9 hours. On top of this Delta has one of the smallest leg space for its economy customers, as seen to this date. A horror of a night in an airplane and hardly will Delta see us ever book them again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'San Francisco to Santiago de Chile via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'September 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Rich Weiner
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Ah, Delta. I have been loyal for over 40 years. In that time, I cannot count the number of times I said "I love my Delta Airlines". But lately, Delta has gone downhill. My latest flight international to Nice, FR, I took a chance on "Premium Select" class. A complete and utter waste of money. For the same price, I could have flown true business class with half a dozen other airlines - and gotten a full recline sleeper vs the garbage extra 1/2" seat. I'm talking $1800 more (one way) to fly on Delta. Never again will I fly Delta internationally. Domestically, Delta is a second rate airline - another half dozen budget airlines have better pricing and a better experience. I consider Delta now a "cattle car" carrier. And the latest snub on sky miles, I will do everything I can to not fly Delta anymore and promote those airlines who care. Sadly, the Delta employees continue to be the most courteous and professional. But Delta, the writing is on the wall, you will become a "has been" airline.

author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Mostly a very decent experience, by the lower standards we have become used to. On time departure, early arrival. Comfortable seat for a 5 hour flight. Dinner was weird, A fairly robust main dish portion ( veggie lasagna) but that’s it. No app, no sales, no side veggie. Served on a tray with a pre wrapped cookie. Wow. Highlights were the entertainment system and exemplary service by the lone flight attendant brilliantly and tirelessly serving 20 people on his own. Talk about rising to the occasion! This guy deserves a raise!
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A321neo', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to Kona', 'Date Flown': 'September 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Donald Martone
reviewBody: Not Verified |  We will never fly Delta again. Flight DL 1689 out of Seattle to Phoenix our connection was very short and had to literally run through the Seattle Airport, which is a nightmare in it self. I had asked a ticket for help in notifying the gate of this dilemma and received no help at all. I am 84 years old and had to run to the gate and when I got there my wife was trying to hold the gate and was told they couldn't do that, very unhelpful. I was last to board and the plane was packed like sardines and our seat was second to last row. To compound the situation, the person behind me was sick and kept sneezing on me between the seats. I could go on but from what I see from Delta, it will fall on deaf ears.

author: Anne Johannesen
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I was booked on a flight Aug 24 to Edinburgh through Atlanta. I paid extra for a comfort seat (about $100) after I'd made the initial booking. I made the booking through Orbitz. The ticket was for a Virgin Atlantic flight operated by Delta. Delta called me at 8:57 am, Aug 24, about 10 minutes before I was to leave for the airport. They asked if I would be willing to be re-routed through Boston because MCI-ATL was over-sold. I was offered $300 which was accepted. Comfort seats were not available on the MCI-Boston flight so I was put into the main cabin. I called Delta when I got to the airport to say I also wanted a refund on the comfort seat which was a separate charge on my CC. I was told my CC had already been credited. I called my CC company when I returned and they have no record of impending credits. As of 9/22, it's still not credited. When I got home, I called Delta again and was told they couldn't help me unless I had the MCI-BOS ticket number which I didn't keep and can't find. They said to call Orbitz. Orbit said they couldn't help because Delta called me directly and they didn't have the info. They emailed the flight info they had (MCI-ATL-BOS) which is attached. Orbitz said to contact Virgin Atlantic. Virgin Atlantic also said they couldn't help for the same reason although they forwarded the information I gave them to Delta. I still haven't received a response. Had I been in business class and agreed to be put in the main cabin, I would have credited the difference so why not the $100 I paid for a comfort seat which I'm sure Delta either sold to another passenger or upgraded someone. Everyone else already booked in the main cabin who agreed to switch would have been paid $300. I'm out an extra $100. I have no complaints about the flights themselves or any Delta staff.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Kansas City to Edinburgh via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Keisha Gregory
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  On Sunday September 10, my friend and I were returning back to Toronto from LaGuardia airport. We arrive at the airport and are waiting in the bag check line only to see on the screen that our flight was cancelled due to poor weather conditions. This was a surprise to us because we were not notified of this sudden cancellation until we got to the airport. Why not say something earlier or within the day so that we can plan accordingly? Our flights automatically got moved to Tuesday in the evening and we could stay here another day. We finally get to the front of the bag check line and we speak to the lady about the cancellation. Out of the 11 workers we spoke with during our time at the airport, she was one of the nice ones. We asked her if we could get any other flights tonight and she said there were none. She suggested we go to JFK and try but would not compensate us for travel to get there. Our flight was moved to Tuesday and it was Sunday evening. Where were we supposed to stay? They couldn't give us any hotel accommodations or nothing. They couldn't supply us with any solutions or offer to help or service us in any way which is poor customer service. We couldn't afford another night at a hotel so we actually ended up sleeping in the airport. They couldn't even supply blankets or nothing. We were just cold and freezing in the airport while we looked and googled for earlier flights, which are now double and triple the price. I'm talking $1,000 - $1,500 one way for a flight that was originally 300 or so. They couldnt even give us a refund for the flight. They just told us to call customer service. I had to wait 1-2 hours just to get a refund for that flight. So at this point we had to consider taking a bus until we finally found a flight with Delta the following day in the evening around 300. Fast forward to Monday September 11. We check in our bags go through everything and watching netflix by our gate until it was time to board. I think an hour or so before boarding I get an email saying that this flight is now cancelled. My friend and I check the screen and it still says the flight is on time. We went to the people at the gate who had to confirm whether or not the flight was cancelled. At this point we were getting even more frustrated because the same thing happened again. The customer service couldn't do anything for us. They moved our flight to Wednesday September 13. Again, no accommodation, no refund, nothing. The man acted like he did us a favor by giving us a food voucher for $32. What can $32 buy at an airport for 2 people? It was really frustrating because again we weren't notified until last minute of this cancellation. We decided to call and get another refund on the flight all while finding a bus that we could take to get home. We found 1 that was leaving at 10 pm and not too far from the airport. We purchased non refundable tickets, desperate to get home and thinking we would get there in time. We decided to get our bags that we checked and just take this bus. We headed to baggage claim and this was what really got me frustrated. We got there and our bags were not there! We had to wait 4 hours for our suitcases to come out. I asked countless workers where our bags were and we were either dismissed, ignored or not given a direct answer. Because baggage check took too long we missed the bus we were supposed to take and had to spend another night at the airport. We ended up taking a 6 am bus to finally get back home

author: Kristen Hess
reviewBody: Not Verified |  The gate agent Victoria in Dayton Ohio was so kind and helped me so much. I approached her when she first started her shift before she even logged on. She was so courteous and relieved my stress.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Dayton to Harrisburg', 'Date Flown': 'September 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Amos Ashurst
reviewBody: Not Verified | Horrible! Tried to cancel my ticket. Agents were rude, they couldn't speak English properly, they were impatient and ultimately tried to rip me off by having me pay $99 in order to get a $242 credit (that would only have been good for 1 yr.) When I said that I wouldn't pay the $99 the guy said 'ok have a good day' and hung up. He also tried to string me along by saying 'we might be able to get your money back if you pay the $99' but he could not explain what missing information was needed in order to determine whether or not I'd get my money back. What a scam! Will never fly Delta again!!

header: "we should have booked with a better company"
author: Richard Privé
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Maintenance was not done to the airplane so they cancelled the flight and booked another one for us. We had to wait 8 hours at the airport. In Canada a credit or compensation must be made as stated by law. At the Delta counter they told the passengers to call Delta for the compensation. Numerous e-mails and calls were made to their customer service. Delta does not intend to conform with the law, which makes them a delinquent company. Now we have to deal with the Canadian transportation agency to get our compensation, which takes time. I don't recommend this airline to anyone and won't travel with them or any of their partners. I did not mind to book with a cheaper airline for a short flight, but we lost our time and energy in the process so we should have booked with a better company in the first place. Lesson learned! (Flight was in April 2022).
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Montreal to Nashville via Toronto', 'Date Flown': 'October 2022', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Carole Warner
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta told clients that SkyMiles never expire. Now Delta says they will be reset to 0 every year! This is unacceptable, they are breaking their own promise. This is the 2nd time Delta has cheated me. In 2023 I was offered an Amex card and 40k miles. I spent the required $4,000 in three months, got the card, used it and instead of the 40k miles promised, I was given only 35k miles which now are going to be converted to annually reset MSD dollars! I protested, I sent them a screen shot of the offer, but I only got a run-around. This is in addition to the much higher requirements for redeeming miles than most all other airlines.

author: N Baker
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Delta is getting unprofessional by the day! Push my time back 4 times in one day. Then putting me on a connection flight to NYC. Once I get to NYC they then cancel it, making me get a hotel without a voucher! Spending extra money after I just came from vacation. Then the next day for the flight Delta employees want to come to work late (flight attendants) pushing our flight time further back. What happened professionalism in Delta. So frustrating!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Florida to Raleigh', 'Date Flown': 'September 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Payea
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta Air Lines subcontracted with KLM for the first part of our trip from Prague to Amsterdam. My minor son and I (traveling alone) had to be up at 3am to airport on time. The flight Delta scheduled was not even flying that day. I had to be on the phone for over 30 minutes (while standing in the Prague airport with my child) desperately trying to get someone to change the flight to the correct one so we could make our way home to Boston. We ended up managing to sprint through the airport (mind you, this child also has a serious heart condition!) after having just 15 minutes to get to our gate. Since this trip, I have reached out to Delta to provide feedback, only to have them refuse to take responsibility for their mistake. Instead, they have blamed everyone else and straight out denied this even happened. I have phone records to prove my call took place. But they simply refuse to accept the blame. We will not be using Delta for our next European trip.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Prague to Boston', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Hanedatos
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  As I was boarding my flight from Athens to Boston, a women working at the Delta gate told me the airline staff are over heading my name. A few minutes later, I was boarding and had a comfort plus seat along with my husband. As I gave my boarding pass to get on, a huge siren went off and they told me to step back they needed to speak to me. I moved to the location they requested when a man working for Delta said in a pressured, loud and aggressive tone “There is a problem with your seat, the TV doesn’t work but we can move you to another seat with a working TV.” I hesitated because this all caught me off guard and said ok but show me the seat and it was a middle seat without the extra leg room. I said no and he said “Are you sure?” and I said I was traveling with my husband and if we can’t sit together we will just keep the seat with the broken tv in comfort plus. As it turns out that TV worked and Delta had been trying to give my seat to someone else for more money! About 15 years ago, I flew Delta and again coming back to the US from Athens, Greece I connected in Paris and they did a similar thing and asked me while I was seated in my seat to get up and they gave my seat that I had a ticket for and was already seated in to a man with the explanation that it was really his seat despite me having a paid ticket and boarding pass with that seat number. I had to stay in the airport for 5 hours waiting for another Delta plane. I never forgot that and it took 15 years for me to fly overseas with Delta again and now they did this. I never write reviews but want others to know as well as Delta that I will never fly with them again and will let everyone know about the scam they do, especially overseas to young women to take their seats for other passengers.

header: "Delta cannot be trusted for award travel"
author: S Jackson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Delta issued an award ticket in March, 2023 for first class using 340,000 miles including a business class connection on Korean Air. Delta than cancelled and changed routings 3 times, resulting in loss of Korean Air Business Class ticket which both Delta and Korean Air refused to reissue, resulting in cancellation of my Korean Air Business Class trip and severe disruption to my annual vacation plans. Delta cannot be trusted for award travel - 1) Excess point requirements, 2) Very hard to get award travel, 3) When awarded, they will cancel and not reissue!

author: Angela Boone
reviewBody: Not Verified | I just wanted to acknowledge the professional experience we received from one of their customer service representatives. My husband and I had just landed in Paris on 16 August 2023 around 1000 and noticed that his bag did not make the flight. I spoke with Delta Customer Representative. She did an exceptional job walking us through the process and in return decreasing our anxiety. We appreciate her caring and professional attitude which ensured we received the best experience possible. on a scale of 1-10, she is a 20!

author: Effie McGee
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta is not active duty military friendly. They did not help in any way when my sons orders got changed. I was absolutely appalled and am so glad there are many other airlines we can use found forward because no one in my family will ever fly with them again. I have 2 boys in the military and no airline has treated active duty military like Delta. Even Spirit Airlines was hassle free with last minute flight changes due to my son's orders being changed in the past. American Airlines, Southwest, Allegiant have all been super accommodating in making exceptions for active duty military. Shame on Delta for not supporting the military.

author: Leonid Lunin
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | It's one of the best companies I've ever flown. The staff is very polite and communicable. There were no delays, I even came to the destination in advance. Was glad to fly with them, strongly recommend!

author: B Kelly
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Delta is an incompetent airline through and through. From rude staff to airplanes constantly breaking, to the most disgusting terminal in every airport, Delta isn’t worth it. Don’t fly Delta unless you can burn 8+ hours on delays and enjoy being laughed at by the customer service personnel who are supposed to help you.

author: S Wilson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Plane was old and the small outdated screens were right in your face. 2 seats had sticky or broken seat back buttons. Very cramped seating. Worst of all, they were only serving snacks water and coffee from Florida to Atlanta to St. Louis. Nothing carbonated at all. This was the first flight of my life with no coke. Will never fly Delta again! Flight attendants were too casual. I did not belt at all and it went unnoticed until I belted in flight. Airplane mode not on also went unnoticed. Expected so much more from Delta.

author: Elizabeth Beatty
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | My DELTA flight to London was delayed 4 TIMES because they couldn't find pilots. Then we boarded the plane at 12:45am and the pilots could not reach their INTERNAL Delta ground control to take off - the pilot announced this on the airplane as we waited on the plane. At 2am Delta CANCELED the flight and we all had to find hotels and didn't get a flight to late the next day. I didn't even have time to cancel one of my excursions with a 24 hour notice. Getting any sort of refund is a NIGHTMARE.

header: "Don't trust the airline to update you"
author: Charlaine Baeckel
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Don't trust the airline to update you fast enough if your flight is delayed and causes you to miss the next flight. My flight from Portland OR to Washington DC Dulles Airport originally had a layover in Seattle WA. Due to the first flight having a delay due to a light blinking for something that turned out to not be happening and them needing more fuel in order to be able to make the trip safely, I missed my connecting flight in Seattle WA. The flight arrived 5 minutes before the connecting flight was due to depart. I was unable to reach the gate in time, so I got in line for the customer service. I checked my texts, email and the delta app, but nothing showed up as having an alternate route. It took a while to get through the customer service line. When I reached the counter, I was informed that they had automatically booked me on a new flight even though I hadn't received any notification of this change. They printed my new ticket and said the new flight was due to depart in 15 minutes and was at the gate next to them. I walked over to the gate to find out that they had already closed the gate and weren't boarding the plane anymore. Therefore the tickets that customer service had given me were for a flight that had already finished boarding. So, I had to get back in line again. When I talked to the customer service representative, they told me that it was my fault for missing the second flight and because I had a basic ticket they couldn't help me with another flight option. That they could put me on a waiting list for an open seat going in the general direction. They said that I would just have to wait in the airport until a seat became available and they couldn't tell me when that might happen. I couldn't handle this news that I was stranded at the airport and had no idea when I might be getting another flight. I found a place to break down and cry and just before 11am my delta app notified me the info for the alternative flight that I had missed. This made me mad because this was two hours after I had needed it. So I collected myself and went back to customer service counter. The person who helped me didn't treat me like it was my fault for missing both flights and got me new boarding passes. This whole thing could have been avoided if I had gotten my notification about the reroute a lot sooner or if the customer service person had given me a ticket for a flight that hadn't closed there gates then say it wasn't their responsibility for the missed flight. Then on my last flight, the overhead space was a bit harder to reach then other planes and I am 4'11". When I had asked a flight attendant for help because I could reach they attendant told me she wasn't allowed to help me, which didn't bother me. But while I was struggling to pick up my bag high enough, the attendant told me that I was holding people up. A passenger ended up catching my bag as I was about to drop it and helping me the rest of the way.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Portland to Washington', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Norman A Freniere
reviewBody: Not Verified |  My daughter and I flew from Savannah to Atlanta on flight 2516 on 8/28. Our flight was delayed by a 2 hour ground stop in Atlanta that caused us to miss our connection to Hartford on flight 1011. Despite a difficult situation beyond anyone's control, every Delta employee in the Savannah Airport, in the Atlanta airport, and in the air was courteous and professional in helping us and several hundred other stranded travelers get flights rebooked. We were able to get rebooked to flight 2069 for 7:05am the next morning and the airline gave us a complimentary hotel reservation and meal vouchers. I am sure that the airline did the same for several hundred people on this day and their commitment to customer service was refreshing and appreciated. thank you.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Savannah to Hartford via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: R Nazenko
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  What is the worst US airline? I vote for Delta Air Lines! I took 3 domestic flights with them in the space of 2 weeks in July and they were all problematic. The first was over an hour late, the second 4 hours late, and the third landed in the wrong airport at midnight! I complained to Delta, of course. It took them a month to reply and offer me a laughable $25 voucher for future travel because it was due to factors outside of their control. I can believe that for one flight, but 3 out of 3 indicates a pattern of incompetence. Avoid Delta at all costs!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Denver to New York', 'Date Flown': 'July 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jared Green
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I will never use Delta again. Our flight was delayed an hour.  We sat on the plane for one hour. They came on the intercom and said "we do not have pilots to fly and you must deplane. Once in the terminal again they came on the speaker and said that the flight was canceled due to bad weather (even though we all heard inside the plane that they didn't have pilots. They told us that they would not pay for lodging for us. All passengers including myself saw several planes land and let passengers off ... so if it was weather related planes could land but not take off?

author: Jonathan Glasper
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Trash airline, said we had a 5 minute delay to fix something turned into an hour. Then told to deplane after sitting an hour to have to wait for another half hour til a new plane comes. If you have a chance to fly anywhere else other than Delta, I would suggest it.

author: Sirenia Herrera
reviewBody: Not Verified | The first horrible experience with Delta was on our departure day of Thursday, 08/17/2023 departing from San Antonio, TX. My twin boys and I boarded at 3:41 Delta Flight 1043, which had us wait inside the plane in 80+ degrees (inside the aircraft) for over a 1 hour while the crew tried to fix the AC and mechanical issues the plane was experiencing. This caused a delay in our arrival, and our plans changed due to the fact that we missed our car rental and hotel arrival time. After we departed San Antonio, it was hard to relax and watch a movie as the aircraft was having issues with the monitors, and they kept turning on and off three to four more times until they rebooted the system. On our return flight scheduled for Monday, August 21, 2023, our flight was delayed four times before arriving at the airport at 1 PM. While we sat at the airport waiting from 1 PM to 6 PM our flight was delayed two to three more times. Finally, after waiting all afternoon/evening at the airport, at around 9-10 PM we received a message from Delta saying our flight was delayed until 9 AM the next morning August 22, 2023. The Delta attendant informed us that the delay was due to the fact that Delta could not find a Pilot and the replacement pilot they found earlier, had declined as well, so they were left with no pilot and no choice but to push the flight until the next day. The customer service representative helped us book a hotel and offered us an embarrassing and very offensive $15 voucher per person. We arrived at the hotel with no clothes to change into, no toothbrush, no toothpaste, no hairbrush, no pajamas, and no deodorant, with absolutely nothing but dirty clothes we had on from waiting all day at the airport. It was almost 11 PM at night and every store was closed at this time to try and purchase anything. My kids (two 11-year-old boys) were tired, bored, and very impatient. Also, because it was past 11 PM we were extremely tired, and due to most restaurants and stores being closed we were unable to use the food vouchers. We had to wait an additional 20 to 30 minutes for the hotel shuttle to finally pick us up from the airport and drop us off at the Sheraton Hotel. The next day our flight finally departed LAX and we were extremely disappointed to be placed in an old and dirty aircraft with smaller TVs than the normal ones (We booked 6 first-class seats), please see the attached pictures for reference. We also left our vehicle at the San Antonio, TX airport for when we arrived and we had to pay two extra days of car storage at the airport due to our delay, which we do not think is fair. As if that wasn't disappointing enough for Delta, we received an email on 08/22/2023 from Customer Care offering us a $100 Voucher for the horrible experience. Due to the fact that our flight was delayed over 4 hours and per the trip delayed coverage in Delta's guidelines, we are entitled to up to a $700 travel voucher per ticket (4 tickets) and reimbursement for items we paid for during this delay. Delta refuses to take accountability for their actions and only offer us $20 vouchers.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to San Antonio', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Emily Gowers
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I'm moved to write this review by Delta's extraordinary incompetence and unresponsiveness after a journey that should have taken 15 hours took 50 hours over the weekend of 12/13 August. Our plane from Mexico City was diverted by a storm 20 minutes from Atlanta and landed in Savannah (presumably because of lack of fuel – this was not a great choice of airport, as it has no customs for an international arrival). As a result of this, we sat on the tarmac for 5.5 hours (beyond the legal limit of 4 hours), given nothing to eat but a small bag of chips and two glasses of water. It turns out there were three such planes stranded on the tarmac that afternoon, one with no food or water and no functioning bathroom. The incident made the local online news and TV and was described as "unprecedented". Eventually night fell, the pilots left and we were deplaned and processed through a makeshift customs office, then told to find our own accommodation as Delta had no vouchers, but were explicitly told to keep all receipts. Airport staff booked a hotel for me and three fellow passengers. If I had known I wouldn't be refunded I might have slept in the airport. The next morning we showed up at Savannah Airport at 9 for our 11:30 40-minute flight back to Atlanta. I was rebooked onto my Virgin ATL-LHR flight at 6:40 pm. But we didn't leave Savannah till 5:30 pm! First, we were told the plane needed cleaning, then, as time passed, that Delta were now obliged to rebook every single passenger, including their onward flights, by hand, using a defective printer, and they would call them each by name. Chaos ensued, and the flight kept being delayed by another hour. Half the passengers left and hired cars out of frustration. Of course I missed my Atlanta-London connection for the second time in 24 hours. I was luckily rebooked onto a 10 pm Delta flight to London (not in Premium, which I had booked on my original Virgin flight). We were emailed $400 in Delta vouchers, not as a measure of our inconvenience but as a token gesture of apology. I would simply have liked a clean measure of my inconvenience. When I submitted $250 of receipts to Delta for reimbursement, I spoke to a representative about how I would receive the payment and was told a cheque would be emailed to my UK address. Subsequently, Delta informed me that none of my expenses were eligible for reimbursement as bad weather had caused the disruption. This, however, takes no account of a) their duty of care to stranded passengers and b) the sheer incompetence of Delta staff the following day at Savannah airport which caused many people to miss their onward connections. I have tried texting and calling and have repeatedly been fobbed off and held in lines. Delta, I should say, issued a useful food voucher of $30 at Atlanta airport (this was around 8 or 9 pm, though, the first food we had been given all day) and I was then emailed a transport voucher of $35 (for what?) which wasn't actually in the email. On the phone to Delta this week, I was offered 5000 miles as a token to shut me up, which I refused. And in an email I was sent a conciliatory $90 voucher, again not actually accessible from the email. I won't let this drop. Virgin, by contrast, have been charming and helpful, and promised me some refund on my non-flown Premium leg.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Mexico City to London via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Brad Reints
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta’s slogan is “The world’s most trusted airline”? What an absolute crock! I can’t believe how this company operates is even legal, their airline customer service is by far the worst that I have ever experienced. I am absolutely disgusted with Delta Air Lines, they absolutely ruined the first day of vacation for my family and myself. They delayed our 5:30am flight 7 HOURS due to a mechanical issue. It ruined our entire first day of our vacation and we ended up having to book with a different airline last minute because Delta had nearly no other same day flight options except a red eye late night flight. We spent 5 hours in line trying to find other options, and probably over 10 hours by now on hold waiting to get customer service agents to pick up and help. We have spoken to 4 agents at least, and none have been willing to help or hold Delta accountable for the major inconvenience we had in our vacation due to their own doing. They cost us another 500 dollars each for the last minute flight change and only refunded us for the first half of the original trip. They are now refusing to cover the other flights we had to book even though the first customer service representative we talked with while at the airport during this mess told us they would, and have refused to provide any sort of voucher either. While we stood in line at our gate waiting to talk to the Delta attendant for help during all of this, they were giving out 1800 dollar vouchers for an overbooked flight and letting the volunteer passengers cut the line in front of us even though we had already been standing for an hour to rebook their flights. We didn't have a choice to be delayed due to Delta's maintenance issue and yet they are refusing to compensate us at all for any of our experience. It is totally negligent. The customer service reps told us they will do nothing for us and have refused to help any further.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Denver to Knoxville via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'July 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: H Keare
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  We had horrendous flights especially on the way to Jackson Hole and delays returning BOTH due to maintenance issues. On the way we had to overnight in St. Paul because we missed our connection, then took at 7am flight to Salt lake where we paid $770 to rent a car and drive 5 hours to get to Jackson. After multiple calls to CS and turn downs, I sent a FEDEX to the CEO requesting reimbursement for the additional car cost with receipts, nothing more, they didn't pay us the courtesy to respond. What kind of a CEO and airlines disses their clients like that - it's so disturbing.

author: Teresa Adams
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  My husband and I have always placed Delta as the best of the best airlines ever! We do not believe that anymore. Our travel agent booked our trip in February 2023 for our upcoming thirty eighth anniversary in August 2023. We arrived early at Atlanta on August 14, 2023. We did everything we were suppose to do, then went to our gate and sat waiting an hour and 15 minutes to board (Gate E15) When they called for Comfort Plus we excitedly got in line to board our flight D1970. When the agent scanned my passport and ticket it would not go through, the agent, who had a horrible attitude asked, where are you flying to?! I stated St. Lucia, she said they changed the flight to boarding gate E10 and the plane has already left. My husband and I were furious because nothing was announced, nor was our name called to let us know of the last minute change. My husband attempted to ask the Delta Rep when did the flight change? She rudely stated, I don't know sir. All I know is the flight gate was changed to E10, they were to depart at 9:45 am, but they departed earlier. My husband asked, what time did they depart? She stated at 9:43 sir. Please move out of the line. We missed our flight. We went to the Delta desk and the agent was no better. We advised her of what had happened and she said, I don't see that your flight was changed to another gate? She then kept looking and said, oh yeah, at the last minute they changed it, and you and your wife are listed as a no show. By this time we are heartbroken. We asked if there was another flight going out? She responded not today. We called our travel agent and she got a Delta Rep on the line for Delta Vacations and she was very unsympathetic. Our travel agent kept asking what could we do to fix this? The agent stated for us to go back to the Delta desk and see if they could book us on an other flight. We again advised we were told there were no more flights going out. We went back to the Delta help desk and the agent had the nerve to say: I don't know why they sent you back to me. They can see the same thing I can. She repeated that statement six times before saying there was nothing she could do. We called for a shuttle to return us back to our hotel, having to pay another $167 plus tax. Our travel agent was able to get us booked on the next day flight August 15, 2023 (this is our anniversary day). She got a Delta Rep on the line to see what compensation could be done and every agent we spoke to was adamant nothing could be done because it was our fault we missed the plane. We ended up losing a whole day (August 14,2023) at the resort, and had to spend more money for a hotel stay. To say the very least we are extremely disappointed in the way things were handled with Delta and will be using American Airlines or another airline moving forward.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to St.Lucia', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Brad Vorhees
reviewBody: Not Verified |  All luggage and car seats for two adults and 5 children aged 6 mos. to 8 years put on plane, but we weren’t allowed to board because the gate door was just being shut when we finally got through security. The door was still open, but the woman gate attendant wouldn’t let us board. Now we’re stuck in the Seattle airport with 5 little children, no luggage, no car seats. It boggles the mind that the woman at the gate would actually do this. We have no idea what we’re going to do now. Sleep in the airport, I guess, with no bedding or change of clothes.  I will never fly Delta again, and I will discourage everyone I know not to, as well.

header: "the last time I book with Delta"
author: G Robinson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | I traveled round trip to Canada and had to purchase a lay over flight because there was no flexibility for direct flights with decent arrival times. I had delays on BOTH trips (on 8/3 and 8/13). On my first round I traveled a red eye so I slept for most of the flight, did not eat or drink anything. When I woke up I asked the flight attendant if I could have water as she was making her trash pick up rounds. It was approximately 25-30 minutes before our landing time so I told her 'no rush' since I knew she was making her rounds. She looked at me and said, 'we're about to land'. I am a frequent flyer and I have NEVER been made to feel uncomfortable for a cup of water. I responded with, 'you know what, it's fine. I don't need it.' Another flight attendant brought me a cup once she was done with her rounds. Seriously, that's all she needed to do. I made her job easy through the entire flight by knocking out and staying out of her way until I needed ONE cup of water 30 MINUTES before landing. This is the last time I book with Delta. I gave them an extra star because the other flight attendants were cool but if you're going to delay my flight AND treat me like I'm bothering you when I ask for water you won't see me in those planes again. Also, they promote on flight entertainment yet have no bluetooth option for people with earbuds and you don't offer earphones in order to use the entertainment option you claim to offer. It makes zero sense. I had to resort to playing games since I had no old school earphones that plug into YOUR device. I'm glad I wore comfortable shoes b/c they changed gates AT LEAST 5 times when I waited in Atlanta and twice when I waited in Minneapolis. Like come on guys, we're paying tons of money for a service and I flew the lowest level. I would have been PO'd if I paid for First or Business class! Lastly, the on flight WiFi was so bad that I didn't use it after all. I contacted customer service to get into the online account before my flight on 8/3 and have not heard back from anyone. At this point I think they ignored my request for assistance.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Los Angeles to Toronto via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Baker
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Absolutely the worst flight experience ever! We do not recommend Delta. We booked our flight to fly my bf to GA to haul my RV with my truck to TN (job change) while I drove the car and had limited time to get it moved and get him back in time to make his flight for offshore work. So we opted for flying rather than driving to save time. That is not what happened. What was supposed to be 4.5 hours of travel time, including layover, turned into 19+ hours of travel due to Delta’s over 15 hours of delays. You read this right (we could have drove from LA to GA then to our final destination TN in less time than it took Delta to fly him). They had multiple delays (starting with staffing deficiencies). They left him stranded multiple times, literally, both at the airport with shuttle buses down for the night then left him stranded on a plane for over 6 more hours in delays, a detour to Savannah, more delays, refuelling more than once, before finally arriving 15 hours past his booked arrival time. This put us in terrible position and struggling with time constraints, put us in daytime traffic jams, and eventually having to rebook his return flight when we ran out of time due to Deltas unacceptable 15+ hours in delays. It cost us $135 more (taxi cost when stranded at the airport unable to get to the hotel and $100 in fees to rebook the return flight when we ran out of time due to Delta’s multiple extended delays) an enormous amount of stress, aggravation, and lost time. Delta’s offer to resolve this, a pathetic $40 flight voucher! This is not acceptable. We were not able to speak to a person and instead was forced to text, which added to the stress and aggravation. Worst customer service program we have had the displeasure to have to work through. We understand delays can happen but over 15 hours of multiple delays for such a short flight and leaving people stranded multiple times is unreasonable and unacceptable. If you actually want to make it to your destination and have any reasonable customer service, take your business elsewhere. Delta used to be a good airline, sadly that has changed to one of the worst.

author: Thomas Stovall
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  In the past month and a half I have taken 3 delta flights. Like clockwork they provide outstanding customer service and lost all my bags every time! I flew from ATL to Boston Logan and they failed to load my bag on my flight. Like the professionals Delta are, it was loaded on the next flight an hour behind.  I was disappointed to hear I would be receiving my bag relatively quickly since it was on the next flight. However, my hopes were lifted when Delta told me it would take three days for them to deliver the bag a whopping 2 hour drive from Boston Logan to Hanover, NH. Thank goodness for Delta’s initiative or else I would’ve had to do a presentation in different clothes from those I’d worn the past two days! And I loved how unbelieving they were in my testimony when I tried to get them to compensate me for the clothes I had to buy because of their failure, absolutely beautiful. I was inspired by Deltas commitment to faithful customers, hard work, and service when I was flying from Atlanta to Boston and then to Lisbon for a vacation. Even when a storm came through ATL and they couldn’t seemingly find a crew to fly the plane they delayed my flight and made me wait for 3 extra hours. Lo and behold this delay would cause me to miss my connection in Boston, but no worries the Delta receptionist were available and attentive to my plight. They helped me reschedule my flight to Amsterdam. And they even remembered to forget that my bags had to be moved onto the new plane. I know when I fly Delta they have and deserve my utmost confidence in losing my bags. I wouldn’t receive these bags for the next two days and honestly it ruined the first half of my vacation. Obviously Delta will bear no shame in destroying my vacation. After I thought all was good they do something really great. I mean this just goes to show you the dedication they have to being a top tier airline. After they lose all 7 of my bags flying to Lisbon they actually don’t lose my bags coming back to New York. I was disappointed to hear my bags had landed in JFK. But upon waiting through my two hour layover I soon began to realize the baggage carousel wasn’t going to move.  I wait there for two hours waiting for my bags to come through the claim so that I could recheck them for my flight home. Guess what, they never came. So as I sit here on board a Delta flight back home, without my bags, I have come to be truly amazed by Deltas intelligence, dedication, and service. Guess I’ll go home and wait 2-3 more days before I have any of my bags. It’s okay though I don’t have anything to do. Delta should just take my bags and give the clothes and items to their staff. Open em up like secret Santa gifts at the office. I don’t care anymore.

header: "after this trip I will be avoiding them"
author: M Kayre
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  I really only fly Delta because the airlines options are limited and they have free wifi, but after this trip I will be avoiding them and Tallahassee airport all together. Not even considering the issues I had to Seattle, on the way back from my overnight flight they put my luggage on a completely different flight that doesn’t arrive at my destination till 2 hrs afterwards.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Seattle to Tallahassee', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Sam Smith
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Booked a simple 45 minute flight from Atlanta, GA to Augusta, GA. Take-off was delayed an hour or so due to weather. My plane eventually got in line to take-off from Atlanta. Waited in the take-off line for 45 minutes until the captain announced that the plane needed more fuel to take a detour? Spent another hour going back to the gate and “getting more fuel”. Another hour passes by and the plane finally takes off. We make it over Augusta around 12:00PM, the pilot announced they were circling around to see if it was safe to land. Next thing I know, we’re headed to Savannah, GA. Land in Savannah at 12.36pm, meanwhile the plane that left after us from Atlanta, landed in Augusta at 12.46pm. At 1.00pm my pilot tells everyone that they are going to wait for the storm to pass over Augusta before going back. My ride at the Augusta airport sent me photos of a clear skies at the Augusta airport. Pilot kept saying “they found a way around the storm and we will be leaving soon” - As if they were doing us a favor. It is now 1.50pm and the passengers are agitated and the flight attendants are arguing with each other. With no word on when we will be leaving to go to the destination we all paid for. No refunds, no apologies, typical.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Augusta', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Sam Freid
reviewBody: Not Verified | My mother flew from Prague to Amsterdam and into Atlanta with no issue, but for some reason, Delta had a full meltdown in the hub city. After nearly being up for 24 hours of travel, her flight was delayed because of staffing issues, then three hours later, they boarded the plane, only to then return to the gate after taxiing and told the flight was canceled. My mom was then in the chaos of the line for flight/hotel accommodation for 3 hours. The call time for support is over a 2-hour wait. After filing a complaint with Delta about my mother not having access to her luggage I received a canned email blaming the cancellation on the weather. This is a lie. Other Delta flights took off after the cancellation (one that another family member was on).
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Sarasota', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Reye
reviewBody:
✅ Trip Verified |  
I booked a flight for unaccompanied minors through a delta agent on the phone (credit card rewards had to be done this way). The agent completely ruined our experience. It was not until I arrived at the airport for check in that I was told there was a $300 fee ($150 each way) for the unaccompanied minors. I have sent them on other airlines without this charge. In addition to that, the return flight was booked as the last flight out. It’s Delta policy that they cannot take the last flight in case something happened and the minors were stranded. Makes complete sense, but again we were not informed of this issue when the DELTA agent booked it for us. This caused us to reschedule to another day, waste trips and parking fees to the airport, and take another day off work. So a rundown of surprise expenses due to the inept booking agent: Minor fee- $300 Airport parking- $30 Gas and taking time off work- $$ The airport agents were extremely understanding but limited with what they could offer. After submitting a claim explaining all of this with receipts, customer service granted me a $25 voucher for future flights. Use another airline that actually cares if things go wrong, especially when responsible.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Nashville to Spokane', 'Date Flown': 'July 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: David Monroe
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  We arrived in Detroit from Orlando and was expecting an approximate 1 hour lay over before heading to Buffalo International. Upon arrival in Detroit I received a notification that our flight would be delayed until 02:30. It was subsequently delayed two more times I believe, and then as we were preparing to board at nearly 03:00 the flight was canceled due to the pilot calling off or something to do with the pilot. Several Delta flights that night were delayed or canceled and I heard staffing mentioned by personnel for at two other gates. There were not other flights going out due to it being 3am and no other flights to Buffalo until approximately 36 hours later. I think there were only 3-4 Delta personnel in the airport to assist us but none of them could really help. I actually felt bad for them as they were taking a lot of grief from some very frustrated people. I connected with Delta at one of their service phones and was not really given any options and asked for a refund on my tickets so I could try to find alternate transport for my family of 6. I was told I would get $60 per ticket due to us completing the first leg of the trip (Orlando to Detroit). That was the morning of 7/22. It is 8/9/23 now and after a lot of follow up between Delta and the booking company, I am finally getting confirmation of the refund. However, I am only being refunded $32.14 per ticket, not $60. Since Delta could not fulfill their obligation to get my family home, we had to rent a vehicle, drive 6 hours home after spending 7 hours in the airport. I had to return that vehicle the following morning, to Detroit, so another 6 hours on the road. Since there are no one way rentals out of Detroit. I then had to wait approximately 5 hours in the airport to fly back to Buffalo. I was at least able to get my family home ... the new plane ticket cost me about $500 and the rental was around $250 and instead of getting home early Saturday morning, I spent the entire weekend traveling and did not get complete the trip until Sunday night. I am getting a refund of approximately $180 from Delta. I will never intentionally fly into Detroit airport and if I can help it, I will never fly Delta again. This has been a horrible experience overall.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Detroit to Buffalo', 'Date Flown': 'July 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Leslie Mather
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Making economy class seats and bathrooms so small should be against the law. I am 5 ft 5" and 170 lbs. It is absolutely uncomfortable, claustrophobic and humiliating to be crammed into such small spaces. I have never been in such a small bathroom. It was impossible to avoid touching the sink, toilet and other surfaces just standing in the bathroom. My shirt got wet from the sink and I don't want to think about what other substances might have contacted my clothing. Its just gross. This experience makes me rethink any kind of airline travel for any reason. It is a terrible experience. On the return flight, my video screen didn't work. I mentioned it to the flight attendant. She had it reset but it didn't help.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York JFK to Denver', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: S Hashida
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Unapologetic staff and horrible customer service. Does not accommodate to our problems that they started. They clearly do not know what they are doing. Delays on top of delays, on top of delays, that lead to cancellation. Absolutely unacceptable. Doesn’t even tell you why they are getting delayed.

author: IJ Jechovci
reviewBody: Not Verified | Everything was going fine, but our joyful emotions quickly came to a stop when looking out of the window of the plane at JFK Airport and seeing ONLY our luggage being removed from the plane. After arriving to Europe and trying to use the "Delta Fly" app to track our luggage the only info we got is that our luggage is in Amsterdam. The day after we tried to track our luggage again only to get told that we need to call Delta Support. We called Delta Support and asked them where our luggage is. We were informed that our luggage will come to Europe on 6th of August and that when the luggage is being transported by a different company it won't show on the app which is completely outrageous when they can at least put the flight number of the plane of which the luggage is being transported by. Plus there is no info being sent by email, text or any other form. By the time I'm writing this review it's 7th of August 9:30 PM and our luggage is nowhere to be found.

author: Jan Foster
reviewBody: Not Verified | First Class! What a joke! Priority boarding First Class first, but then they start boarding economy right on top of FC passengers so you don't have time to get your personal items and carry on in the overhead without economy trampling and falling over you. And FORGET FC service as soon as you sit down. 4 hour flight. Delta advertises hot meal on their web page. NOT! Chicken croissant sandwich and bag chips (only had 7 sandwiches out of 16 FC passengers) BOX LUNCH or quinoa and roast veggies BOX LUNCH or fruit and cheese BOX LUNCH. Seat arm BROKEN! Delta you have LOST YOUR WAY. You were paid BILLIONS by the government (OUR TAX MONEY) to stay afloat. YOU FORGOT customer service. DON'T FLY DELTA AT ALL.

author: Andrea Martinez
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Delta is a company that, according to the best in the world, but they are not, they have just made a mess that does not give any solution to the passengers. The flight from Atlanta to Quito should have left at 3:53 p.m. and arrived in Quito Ecuador at 8:00 p.m. .  They were kept there without any solution until 10:43 pm without giving them any solution and the problem is that my dad has a surgery scheduled on Monday and they are going to make the surgery wasted, they don't think about the passenger's life, they are just money, money, but for Charging is great but to help a passenger with a health problem they do nothing, they are the worst company and they have not even had the decency to solve this problem.  Delta es una compañia que segun la mejor del mundo pero no lo son acaban de hacer una embarrada que no dan ninguna solucion a los pasajeros el vuelo Atlanta to Quito tenia que haber salido a las 3:53 pm y llegar a Quito Ecuador 8:00pm. Los tuvieron ahi sin ninguna solucion hasta las 10:43 pm sin darles ninguna solucion y el problema es que mi papa tiene una cirujia programada el dia Lunes y ellos van hacer perder la cirujia no piensan en la vida del pasajero son solo plata plata pero para cobrar son buenisimos pero para ayudar a un pasajeron con un problema de salud no hacen nada son la peor compañia y ni si quiera han tenido la desencia de solucionar este problema.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Quito', 'Date Flown': 'August 2023', 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jenny Morin
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I booked my son J's ticket and used our 100 e-credit, and the agent booked it for Portland, Oregon instead of Portland, Maine! The original price of the ticket was $276. So I called back, asked to talk to a manager to see if we could fix it or transfer the e credit back to my name. Then the agent came back on the phone and told me the manager fixed it and would give us the flight to Maine for the same Price! Now, I had looked up Delta prices and they were about 1200 from Medford to Maine, and I got his flight for $276. Wow. They really made my day. Excellent customer service!

header: "Delta always has a problem, so upset"
author: Latoya Hooper
reviewBody: Not Verified |  My husband and i had to run through the airport in Atlanta because our flight from LAX ran late. Once we got in our seats the plane was ready to leave i knew there would be a problem with our bags! If we were rushed I knew they didnt have time to load our bags. We are at Harrisburg airport just getting a text "sorry your bags are in atlanta" You're not sorry Delta, see what happens when you rush! Then the lady telling me did they put reg tags on our bags to identify them to be put on the next flight? Well I didnt take your new employee training class to write notes for that! I feel Delta always has a problem, so upset

author: Jay Jacosalem
reviewBody: Not Verified |   Flight to SLC uneventful, was a good flight, just Beverages and Sun Chips. Flight to HNL was delayed for the second leg due to maintenance issues. Was promptly notified about the delay via the Delta app. For the second flight it was beverages and Sun Chips again! For a 6 hour flight! I get a warm meal for a 4 hour flight with ANA, warm sandwich with Cathay for a 2 hour flight. Good thing we bought a sandwich. Service was good and staff were nice, but please can you do better with the meal service.

author: A Mueller
reviewBody: Not Verified |  If you wish to sleep on the floor in the terminal - by all means - fly Delta. Not only did they have this happen to us on July 20th on our trip to San Diego - due to staff shortage (left hundreds if not thousands of customers stranded in Atlanta) at midnight - with no hotels, no food, and a failed attempt two days later to buy us off with a $35 e Voucher. Delayed, delayed and then cancelled the flight and then even cancelled their alternative flight - spent whole night on floor in Atlanta terminal chasing flights. Thanks Delta. Then on our return trip - they did it again - they due to staff shortages - delayed flights and caused missed connections. Delta alternative was sleep in terminal again - midnight arrival to fly out next day at 9am. Unacceptable - so we got stuck renting a car in Atlanta at midnight to drive the remaining leg of our trip 3 hours. Deltas response - no reimbursement because we didn't accept their next morning flight. Laughable customer service. Speaking of which - try contacting their customer service - its a joke. It's all automated and they only talk by CHAT. Spend a good hour there - and then be told - sorry we cant see case numbers - you have to call. So you call the numbers - and guess what - they are disconnected saying you have to go to the website and use the Chat. Idiotic. Delta is a joke. They are overbooking flights and not reducing flights to look better for shareholders when their flights do not have staff. Then when the poor ticket holders get to locations - Delta delays their flights or cancels them (they already have the ticket holder $$) and then Delta tries to figure it out last minute. Grow up Delta, if you are short on staff, stop booking or offering flights you can't staff and then sticking it to the ticket holders and when it goes south (which it does) don't try and buy us off with pennies on the dollar e-vouchers. Worst experience ever.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'San Diego to Augusta via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'July 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Austin Taylor
reviewBody: Not Verified |  I'm not a seasoned traveler so do not have a lot of experience. I was traveling about 5000 miles so was a bit worried there would be delays. I had two layovers, but thankfully all went well from NC all the way to HI. Thank you Delta job well done!

author: L Kearia
reviewBody: Not Verified | My experience with Delta has been beyond unacceptable the lack of customer service is quite disturbing considering the high recognition they received on top of being apart of the program for two years now. On July 30,2023 my domestic travel plans went from a 5hr travel day to 15 HOURS due to a minimum of a 585 min delay on my first flight which was never notified until a hour before boarding. Then, I was automatically rebooked for the next flight which followed by hours later being delayed again yet this time no notification until I arrive at the airport to print out my boarding pass. Yesterday, I had to travel three times to the airport just to make it home. With every flight rebooked being delayed I had no choice but to completely travel to Detroit just to make it make to GSO. I was never offered comfort at the gate nor on the flight for the inconvenience. Not one voucher or appropriate compensation was offered. Imagine being given the run-around by agents at the gate and customer care just to find out the following day none of the 7 phone calls to customer care on my travel day were EVER documented. Delta you should be ashamed that you cannot live up to the loyalty and funds your consumer provides you. Being offered only $75 dollars worth in SkyMiles or $175 gift card is insane when you have spent well over $400 combined. After I specifically informed the ATL supervisor today that yesterday a representative offered $250, she told me verbatim the because it was not documented she cannot accommodate me. Yet, with no hesitations the supervisor tells me if decline her today she will have to document this. Honestly is this how you all treat your consumers? Its truly disheartening the only solution this airline has for me is to fill out a complaint comment and wait and wait when I have waited more than enough on July 30,2023. It is clear to me that the airline does NOT CARE and has me reconsidering everything associated with this airline!

author: Christina Balkis
reviewBody: Not Verified |  We are very frustrated with Delta and how everything was handled as a Reserve AX delta card holder and Platinum card holder and Gold medallion what ever they claim to title you which means nothing by the way. We have been using a good $10-20k a month on our card, we pay $550 a year and have never had an upgrade or been treated like a status they claim, no VIP, no Standby upgrades, It’s all a load of hype with no outcomes and only empty hopes and promises. When you call, everyone just passes you on to someone else with no solutions! The accommodations were lacking and unorganized. Waiting in line for 2 hours at an airport after flights were delayed so long we missed our connecting flight, then 4 hours at baggage to wait for missed plane luggage! To finally get our luggage that was damaged, I had no medication for way to long. By 1am we could not find any place to accept the food voucher, there was no shuttle to go to a hotel Delta gave us 30 mins away by the time we finally got a hotel, my bags were damaged and we were promised to be compensated to make up for these troubles and they are not offering anything close to fair. After one hour on the phone, 3 agents, multiple answers, no help, we were passed to the lowest customer service Delta rep I have ever spoke with! This did the final for me, so inexperienced yo handle any situations for a stressed out and upset customer who has been through the loop holes to try to get reimbursed and her attitude was just nasty and rude.  Delta is horrible and don’t listen to the customer, they also are not accommodating to people who have been through a tough time during their DELTA flight issues and especially the after the flight issues. I am not a happy Delta member. We are rethinking our choices, rethinking our membership and which card/company I we should look into because of the whole process of this last month with Delta and how they have been handling our situation is the worst experience I have ever had, ruining our family experience that is so hard to have and put together with our demanding schedules these days of precious time and a waste of my sanity and yearly money.

author: Cristiana Colaneri
reviewBody: Not Verified |  Worst experience ever! New York - Miami! Premium seat was not working, TV screen was not working, Cabin Crew - they should change their job. If you don’t like what you are doing, go for something else! I’m sure Delta doesn’t push you to do this job and this is so disrespectful for the company and for the passengers to act like this.

author: C Dawson
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified |  Purchased "comfort +" upgrade, was charged for two seats but then told upgrades weren't available on my flight so I didn't get anything that was advertised with the upgrade. Attendant also skipped over my son when handing out snacks and I had to push the call button and then physically wave down an attendant to get him something. The car seat buckle I have to attach my son's car seat to a rolling dolly looks exactly like a seatbelt extender and went missing while on flight. My best guess is someone grabbed it off the seat next to me or off the floor and too it thinking it was an extender. We were the last people on the plane (mom + toddler) and I was nearly in tears because now I had a loose car seat and toddler to manage through an airport. There was a pile of seat belt extenders on a seat but I was told those were theirs and sorry but someone must've taken mine. They told me to go to the Delta help desk so I did. Trying to hold back my tears as I'm struggling to manage, I asked the help desk for help and they called a manager on me and treated me like a criminal or something. Another couple at the help desk mouthed "sorry" to me and were wide eyed at the way I was being treated. I've never ever had such a horrible experience flying. Get your customer service together, delta!

author: J Jones
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Great seat! Lots of legroom, dedicated overhead space for carry-ons, and a great crew. We had linens, silver cutlery, menus, and glassware for our meals. Meals were from coach but were still delicious. Great service from the crew who regularly topped off our glasses without our having to ask. It's great to see flight attendants enjoying their jobs even though flights are packed and people can be cranky. Not this flight. Everyone seemed happy and I even heard people saying that, "not all airlines are this nice" from fellow travelers. I really enjoyed the movies and shows onboard, as well as the snack bar set up in the middle galley near the bathrooms. Delta has a very consistent service from ground crew to flight attendants. Kudos.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-400', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Nice', 'Date Flown': 'July 2023', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: J Jones
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Delta One suites were phenomenal. Extremely comfortable with nice purple mood lighting throughout the cabin. The sliding doors were a nice touch as well as the partition in the middle two seats. Plane seemed nice and new. Crew was awesome! Purser introduced herself to each passenger by name and took meal orders. Crew took their time to deliver service with the utmost professionalism. Flight attendant on the other side pleasantly addressed me and offered more wine and bread. She even offered me an extra bowl of soup which was delicious. Delta is a cut above compared to America and United. I've always had rushed and impersonal service with them, but Delta put them to shame.

author: Cristina Ferran
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | Extremely disappointed with Delta. I can count on one hand how many reviews I have written in my life and none have been bad, however this situation was extremely upsetting. My flight was cancelled due to airline issues. I was offered a lousy $100 voucher even though I missed a day of my trip, having to cancel and re book car services as I was traveling out of the country. After 6 weeks someone finally called me to talk about the ticket I sent in as a concern and wanting to speak to someone where a super visor did absolutely nothing and didn’t seem concerned at all. I notified her about a couple I spoke to at the airport that was given a $500 voucher each as well as seat upgrades and she told me numerous times that wouldn’t happen as Delta does not give more than $100 voucher. Well I guess they lied and the email they showed me with their vouchers was a lie too. Extremely disappointed with the customer service. Will stick to American Airlines where they actually take care of their customers when issues like this happen.

header: "80% of time the flight was delayed"
author: Arun Patil
reviewBody: ✅ Trip Verified | I was big fan of Delta. Looks Delta has loses it credibility of in time flights. In the past 2 months I flew 6 to 8 times. In this route through Delta 80% of time the flight was delayed. Every time standard answer - saying maintenance issues, engineers are looking into it. I think they should change their name from Delta to Delayta. Thinking to change the airlines
