Why in the world would I want my three young children to sit separately from me next to people I don't know. When I booked for one adult and three children it should be clear that they will need to sit by their parent. My gosh! One son is slated about 20 rows ahead of the remaining three of us.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'MCO to PVD', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: C Rodriguez
reviewBody: Atlanta to Newark. I usuallly do not have any complaints about Delta. However, our flight from ATL to EWR was delayed due to weather. Fine. Then we had to wait for the flight attendants to arrive before we could even board. So instead of boarding at 9:41pm we had to wait even longer before we could even board. It is ridiculous that we were unaware of when we would arrive to our destination. Many people had children and it's insane that we will be arriving past midnight. The most unorganized flight I've been on. I won't be going to Delta anytime soon.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'ATL to EWR', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: M Fisher
reviewBody: We have flown Delta on numerous occasions as we have a house and business in US. Our honest opinion is that in general we use Delta because we prefer to fly from our local airport, and this is a service supplied in conjunction with Air France and KLM via Paris / Amsterdam. Overall, the service is poor. We have found cabin staff mostly friendly and helpful, though not always. Food is usually ok but I am afraid that on numerous flights pre booked months in advance, my family are seated in different parts of the plane, most unacceptable particularly dissappointing when you have booked a family holiday months in advance. When challenging them about this we get nowhere. The last flight we checked in online and received a telephone call to say all was ok but when we were checking our luggage in on the return journey we were told at check in 'oh this flight goes tomorrow evening'! Now after much arguing and apologies we were put on a Lufthansa flight to Frankfurt but 35 hours door to door from US to UK is totally unacceptable. This experience on numerous occasions has made us reconsider. The flight experience is far too much hassle for a family and I have to say I am relieved we do not have to endure this ever again. I have complained to the airline on a number of occasions but as yet I have received no response. In my opinion Delta are a letdown to the whole ethos of customer service and care in the US and I will certainly not contemplate using their services again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Newcastle to Orlando', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: K Higashide
reviewBody: Tokyo Narita to Singapore, and the Narita airport experience is very nice. Ground staff friendly and helpful. While waiting for boarding Delta has an area for economy class passengers in Narita Airport. I've found it very relaxing and comfortable because they do have a reclining chair which where you could take a nap (but just be mindful of your boarding time). Boarding was smooth, and onboard the flight attendants are very nice, especially the Japanese crews. The only regret on my experience is that the IFE is poor - they have limited movies to watch. Also, the blankets aren't really comfortable. But the meals are okay, and waiting for the baggage was quick on arrival.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 777', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'NRT to SIN', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Sandy Sutton
reviewBody: My daughter and I checked in online and were set to use our phones as our boarding passes. My daughter, for some reason didn't receive her text message. As we were discussing this, the curbside baggage check attendant, overheard us and told us not to worry, he's got us covered. Once he took our bags, he produced both of our boarding passes printed out. Since my phone died shortly after that, it really came in handy! Thank you so much for your outgoing, random act of thoughtful kindness! The Wifi was another issue - I paid for it, but never was able to get on.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'PHX to FNT via MSP', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Michael Liebmann
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines from Atlanta to Jacksonville. Flights in and outbound same day, DL 1258 and 1616. Both were MD-90's. The flights were fast. In the first case, I landed earlier than the scheduled landing time. On return, while we had to wait about 20 minutes to take off (for whatever reason), we still landed early. The only downside on the outbound flight was that the flight was so quick that beverage service couldn't be completed. Both flights were completely filled. However, by getting to the airport early for the return flight, I was able to get moved from a center seat to a window seat further up in coach class. The flight attendants were very polite and efficient.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'MD-90', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'ATL to JAX', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: B Klein
reviewBody: Honolulu to Salt Lake City via Seattle. Delta changed my flight at the last minute and put my wife towards the back of the plane with me and my two children under 4 years old near the front. We called and asked if they could put us together so we could help each other keep the kids calm, since we had bought tickets with four seats right next to each other. They were very rude and basically said deal with it. Delta Air Lines have horrible customer service and could care less about anyone on the plane since everyone had to deal with my kids crying for their mother or their father when we switched seats.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'HNL to SLC via SEA', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Chastity Grimes
reviewBody: Tuesday morning I departed from HOU to travel home (STL) for a family emergency. I understand delays due to weather but my flight from STL to ATL did not depart on time. The flight staff did not inform us of any difficulties therefore I do not feel my time was being valued. I arrive in ATL later than scheduled and the airline did not feel the need to give them notice that I was on the flight and that I had a connecting flight and unfortunately missed my connection flight home. Due to this, I was unable to make it to work Wednesday night and accumulated another days' expenses from on site parking, Delta only felt the need to give me a limited $50 gift card.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Houston', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Marc Einstmann
reviewBody: New York JFK to Amsterdam with Delta Air Lines. A medical emergency forced me to return to Hamburg earlier than booked. Delta was very supportive and changed my flight at no extra charge and without asking any unnecessary questions. Their service on the ground and in the air was excellent. Wheelchair assist worked well. Thank you Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'JFK to AMS', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: W Grant
reviewBody: Every airline has its bad days, but I have been very happy with the service on Delta Air Lines. I recently made an error in my booking and the agent on the phone fixed it immediately. Then it turns out the agent had double-booked me on the flight so I called again. I am still waiting for the refund to my credit card but thanks to their helpful and smart service reps, I feel fairly confident they will figure it out. Traveling is so stressful these days that good customer service on airlines means more to me than almost anything else besides safety.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Toronto to New York', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: R Evans
reviewBody: Orlando to LOndon Heathrow via Atlanta. We have flown Delta before with no problems, and have rated them highly. However this time the flight from MCO was cancelled whilst we were waiting to board ("aircraft is broke"), and we were informed replacement was being sent from ATL, which wouldn't land at MCO until after LHR flight had departed. Mad panic with a full Boeing 757 passenger list trying to contact Delta customer services using the 6 available telephones. Eventually got through, and was offered flight from ATL to Paris, with a connection to LHR. Had to point out to the operator this would take-off whilst we were en-route to ATL. Eventually got offered flight to Philadelphia, to connect to a London flight the next evening. Asked if there was a way to contact England to advise our taxi company not to pick us up until following day. They said they had no international calling arrangements. Got to ATL about 10:45 at night, then spent about an hour trying to arrange overnight hotel (three quarter full flight, and 4 customer service clerks). Eventually given voucher for hotel, and told to wait at the hotel shuttle pick up point outside. Hotel shuttle didn't turn up, and wasn't listed on list of hotel contacts to allow us to contact it. Eventually driver from another hotel took pity on the 14 of us booked to that hotel, and took us there. The hotel also had no way of making international calls. Next morning we found voucher was for accommodation only - we had to pay for breakfast! Flight to Philly was ok-ish (a MD88 is not as good as a 757). London-bound plane was a half-empty 757. However, although Premium Economy was almost empty we were still only allowed in Economy unless we were willing to pay for upgrade. The only time previously we have had a rearranged flight, also because of broken aircraft, was with BA who automatically upgraded us. Was also surprised that , if we wanted to watch any of the films on offer, we would have to pay by credit card. Never had this before on a transatlantic flight - even Delta ones. However cannot fault the onboard flight crew or service. The seats, however were uncomfortable, and 9 hours is a long time to sit in an uncomfortable seat. When we got back to LHR, no checked baggage. They were delivered to our home later that day on 2 separate deliveries, because one had arrived on a later Delta flight from JFK, the other had arrived on an earlier Virgin flight, also from JFK! So, in addition to us having an extra wasted day, Delta have caused us to be out of pocket for meals we wouldn't have had to pay for, and a taxi that went to LHR to meet us. The in-flight experience is ok. It is the customer service side that needs attention. I would still use them, but never use them for a connecting service again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'MCO to LHR via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: V Merritt
reviewBody: Our Delta Air Lines flights from Columbia to Seattle were close to flawless. All arrived ahead of schedule, so twice we had to wait about 15 minutes for a gate to become available. We traveled with just carry-on and were able to take our bags on-board even on full flights. We especially appreciated the overhead compartment valet service in Atlanta, our only experience. The Atlanta flight crew was also the most upbeat and friendly, but being fellow Southerners, perhaps that was the most familiar. Beverage service was often on our long flights. The only negative was a bit of crowding with an oversized passenger on a three seat row, but that couldn't be helped.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'CAE to SEA', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Mary Sylvia
reviewBody: I have not flown Delta in several years. Only because I find better prices on other airlines. I recently had the opportunity to fly Delta. I missed my connecting flight, but when I landed there was someone there to help me get another flight 30 minutes later. Their information was correct and informative. The desk person even checked to see if the original planes door had been locked. She then worked to get the next flight. The employees on and off the plane were so nice, polite and as helpful as you could ever want. They spoke with genuine politeness.  They can cut your stress and truley make your trip relaxed and enjoyable. Thank you Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Ft Lauderdale to St.Louis', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Michael Lonergan
reviewBody: New York JFK to London Heathrow with Delta. Time to put the old thing out to pasture. Seriously, Delta - get with it. We pay these extremely high prices and Delta Air Lines are still putting regional planes on international routes. Shame. Service, food and staff was all fine. This seat was the 1x2x1 configuration. I was in Seat 5A. I am 6'4" and I can't fit when the bed is flat. I find the enclosed foot area very bothersome. The bathrooms are shared with economy class. It was small, and midway through the flight was filthy. I'd say if you were flying this route, make sure to stay away from the Boeing 767-400 equipment.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-400ER', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'JFK to LHR', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Shanaka Gooneratne
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines from Los Angeles to New York JFK. Check in efficient. Bought a day pass and used the DL Skyteam Lounge at LAX Terminal 5. Simple but good selection of food. Drinks had to be paid for. Wifi good. Able to use clean showers. Boarding on time. Flight operated by Boeing 767-300ER with updated interior. Left on time. Friendly Cockpit crew and cabin crew good. Since red eye flight slept most of the way. Crew did 2 services during flight offering beverages for anyone awake. Good IFE. Arrived early. No issues at all. Again super flight.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-300ER', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'LAX to JFK', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: M Del Sasso
reviewBody: Never flying Delta again. My initial arrival time was supposed to be 9.54 pm, then plane had to turn around because of a mechanical problem. We got put on another flight around 11.15 pm, we made it to the runway, only to have to turn around and go back because the captain of the planes shift was almost over. Now having to wait until 2.30 am to catch another flight. This is ridiculous.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Jacksonville', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Krinsky
reviewBody: SLC to ATL, Airbus 320. All staff were very friendly and professional. Boarding was orderly. The snacks offered in EC were very good. The food for sale was surprisingly good. My wife and I selected items that were in a brown paper bag and included 2 roast beef sandwiches, a bag of chips and cookies. My only complaint was that there was no IFE system. This could be that the flight was only 3 hours. Basically, I do not see much difference between first class and EC on Delta. I would say that I see more smiling faces from employees on Delta than on their competitors.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Airbus 320', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'SLC to ATL', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: N Lianna
reviewBody: We booked on a Delta Air Lines buddy pass a few weeks before for a round trip. After arriving in Phoenix from Detroit we found out on the way home that the payment had been cancelled, and even though we were still listed online for the standby list, they refused to let us on. The airline attendants could not and would not explain how the pass was cancelled, why the payment was canceled, we tried logging in ourselves to rescheduled and the system wouldn't let us. The attendants were useless and we ended up borrowing a buddy pass from a complete stranger who felt bad for us. The airline system was unorganized, showing different information for us online and the airline attendants; the attendants knew nothing and did nothing to correct the situation, I was basically told to call customer service to reschedule my flight. They had even sent us a confirmation email that morning. What a joke! Totally not worth the cost when other airlines have pretty much the same rate with cheaper bag charges. I'm giving this airline a 1/10 because none of these other features matter if they can't even accurately communicate the status of your flight reservation.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'PHX to DTW', 'Date Flown': 'November 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Haney
reviewBody: I made a mistake booking to New York Friday with my family. Instead of 09.40am, I put it as pm on my phone when I booked it. I just caught and called Delta, they said it would be $700 change fee per person x 4 -the flight only cost me $1500 roundtrip for all four. Nice customer service, honest mistake and my whole family gets screwed over on a family vacation. I am a frequent flyer with Delta because of the hub in Detroit. I will do whatever I can not to fly them again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'DTW to JFK', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Shanaka Gooneratne
reviewBody: New York JFK to Saint Martin return with Delta Air Lines. Check in good. Boarding process well managed. Prompt offer of beverage by engaging crew. Flights left on time and arrived 30 minutes before schedule. Both planes had personal IFE. Return Boeing 757-200 was a newer plane with new Boeing interior and comfy seats. Outbound flight meals were nice, return was so so. Efficient crew and who enjoyed their job. Pleasant and good experience.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 757-200', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'JFK to SXM', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: S Maitra
reviewBody: Take off on time. Good leg space - paid £64 per seat to upgrade to Delta+ which is the premium economy section. The one negative is that if you are not a regular flyer with the carrier, online check in is a pain as the seat options are terrible and you have to pay extra to sit together. However, once on board, was impressed with the service and the timeliness. Aircraft looked better than any BA aircraft I have flown on recently. Very friendly FAs. Very bumpy flight across the pond but the crew kept serving water and juice through the flight. Lunch was good. Entertainment options are limited. I would not hesitate flying them again.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-600', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'LHR to JFK', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: J Kingston
reviewBody: San Francisco to New York with Delta Air Lines, and very impressed all the way around. On the ground the Delta club was quite comfortable with a vast array of breakfast items: juice, good selection of fruits, bread, pastries, hot and cold cereals, espresso machine. The new Delta One seat is very good (obviously made by the same supplier for the SWISS business class long haul seats). It is lie flat and seats have direct aisle access. Service on board attentive and friendly. Food a notch above. The usual fruit selection and omelet, but Delta added a smoke salmon plate. Flight on time. IFE decent. On the whole I liked the product.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'SFO to JFK', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: I Welsman
reviewBody: New York to London with Delta Air Lines. We started off with a very helpful member of staff who checked us in at the screens before we queued to drop our bags off. It all went downhill from there! A misery behind the desk couldn't engage in conversation or even make eye contact before telling us that our seats would be allocated at the desk. She also told us that as we had the same reservation, the seats would be together. Good news as we are newly weds. After waiting at the gate, 15 minutes before scheduled boarding, we had to change to another gate. Pilot/co-pilot announces to the passengers that there was an issue with a fuel pump with the previous plane. (Is that courteous or unnecessary)? Unnessecary for the less confident passengers waiting among us. Over an hour late boarding and we are told that our seats aren't together after all!! The joke of the matter is that when we board, I was sat in the centre of a married couple in an aisle of three seats! That is just total incompetence! Obviously I changed seats with them! Food was barely edible, the orange juice with breakfast was still frozen! Seat pocket was torn, the cabin was shabby and tired. Delayed by +2 hours. It's like this airline has just been thrown together on the cheap and the service and comfort and colour scheme (navy blue, red and bright pink?!) reflects this.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York to London', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Joseph Chrzescijanek
reviewBody: It started off as a short delay because the captain didn't show up, the cabin crew were very nice and interacted with the passengers whilst the delay was on. Once we got going, the crew was amazing, young, etc. The uniforms and cabin were very up to date and nice. We arrived only 5 minutes later than our initial arrival time. The cookies and complementary beverages were great.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeng 757-200', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Route': 'JFK to ATL', 'Date Flown': 'April 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Cassie Jones
reviewBody: Extremely disappointed with the flight attendants on this Delta Air Lines flight. Never in my life have I seen such laziness or disrespect. I recently had major spine surgery and have lifting restrictions so I asked for help with putting my bag in the overhead compartment. The flight attendant gave me a dirty look, told me no, said that "people like you" shouldn't be allowed to have a carryon if I couldn't lift it, and went back to her conversation with her co-worker!  I'm disabled, not stupid. I've never been treated so badly in my life. Overall, terrible experience.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Chicago to Detroit', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Gaspard Smith-Vaniz
reviewBody: My flight with Delta Air Lines from London to New York was good. Very nice flight attendants, nothing to say about the check in and airport experience as in transit. A nice IFE system, and food was ok. The only downside were the seats which were too small and not comfortable.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Heathrow to New York', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: KIana Foster
reviewBody: I was very disappointed with my Delta Air Lines flight from Honolulu to Salt Lake City. The male flight attendant that serviced my area in First Class was rude and impatient conversing with me. I couldn't hear him as he was asking me a question about what I wanted to eat. He had to ask me three times due to my hard-of-hearing. He rolled his eyes, then strred at me for my answer as he asked, “do you want meal?” The person next to me overhead light did not work. My light switch worked her light. The male flight attendant kept telling the lady next to me how to touch the screen because, "it's sensitive, just like me". This is all done without a smile. How Rude!.And no can tell me that's Hawaii humor.  Never during the flight did a flight attendant smile or have any gestures of kindness. One third of the way into the flight, my video screen didn't work. The flight tracker didn't work. I couldn't watch my video. When I told a female flight attendant she just said that she would, "be sure to tell them to write it up". No apology! So, I just stared at other peoples monitors without sound because I couldn't even read cause my light didn't work and my switch controlled the person sitting next to me! In defense of Delta. I had four other stops (back and forth) and they were all ok to good service.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-200', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'HNL to PHL via SLC', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Joe Haynes
reviewBody: After being stranded by Hainan Airlines, Delta stepped up and not only was able to get me on a flight at a competitive rate, but I was surprised their quality of service, seat room and meals as well as waiting area accommodations were all superior to what I've been putting up with for years. Absolutely no doubt both my wife and I will do all our travels to China with Delta from now on, but they will get our recommendation at every opportunity.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'PDX to PEK via SEA', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Michael Adams
reviewBody: Travelled Delta Air Lines premium comfort from LHR to Seattle then returned to UK from Honolulu via Seattle three weeks later. Pleasantly surprised to see that the Honolulu Seattle leg of this trip only cost about £200 or so than the round trip flights from London to Seattle even though it is a five hour journey - perhaps because it is an internal USA flight and not international. Anyway, the first leg when off without a hitch, seat comfortable, food fine entertainment good. The trip from Hawaii to Seattle was overnight, a little less comfortable (it was an economy seat) than the trans Atlantic and packed as an early flight had been cancelled some months earlier. Myself and others offered to have our hand held put in the hold and this worked fine as these bags were the first ones off in Seattle. Third leg was going fine 'til we started take off down the runway. Whereupon the plane slowed and returned to the gate. Apparently a generator had failed so we de-planed and waited 3 hours for a replacement. We were kept informed all the time and given snacks and beverages. Just as about a 100 pizza boxes arrived they announced we could re board and off we went. Unfortunate delay but these things happen and otherwise a routine flight back across the pond. No problems with Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'LHR to SEA', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Victoria Chester
reviewBody: Last minute flight so I paid $750 CAD for this roundtrip in premium economy. Flight to SFO was smooth - with connection in Seattle. Flight home was bad: I arrived SFO at 11:45 am for 2pm flight. I received a message from Delta that flight was delayed and to contact them. I left the gate, through security, to check-in desk and they advised that the new departure of 2:38 was still good for my connection. Back to the gate, where before boarding an offer was announced to provide a $400 voucher for anyone who would stay behind, which I did not select because I had plans. We boarded at approx 2:30. Approx 2:45 the captain announced we would be held at the gate. We took off at approx 3:10 - at this point I knew I would need to rush to catch connection, which was from different terminal in LAX. We landed LAX ∧ were held on the tarmac, I deplaned at approx 4:48 to catch departing flight to Calgary Canada on WestJet (codeshare) at 5:05. I obtained assistance through security and ran to the gate in my socks to find the flight gone. I called Delta - they said the next flight would be the next morning. I went back to the other terminal and to the help desk - where we spent over an hour looking at every connection I could find (Vegas, Salt Lake, Vancouver) but every flight had a connection too close to make it home - so I gave in and arranged for the morning flight on WestJet. I asked for Delta to provide me with a Hotel - the answer was no. Supervisor gave me a discount voucher. Next I went downstairs to get my luggage. I was told it was with WestJet and I could not get it because WestJet personnel were not there, but not to worry it would be on my flight tomorrow. I got upset and the very helpful team actually went over got my luggage.  Now it is 8:30pm, 3.5 hours after my flight landed. I entered the website for the hotel, as per directions on the coupon. Site was blank for LAX. I called the phone number on the voucher and was told there was no availability for LAX! I called my husband - who went on the internet to search Airport hotels - everything was showing as FULL or over $350 for a 2 star. Thinking this was only because of how late it was, I called several of these hotels and was told they were indeed booked. I was offered expensive hotels miles away - no shuttle. I needed to be at the airport 2.5 hours before my 8am International flight (because I did not have a boarding pass with the change, I was told to arrive extra early for the flight). So this was unacceptable - I went back up to the Delta help desk to tell them to get me a hotel. I was again told by the supervisor they will not help with a hotel. Agent even left to confirm the voucher was not valid and hotels were indeed booked. I saw they had a flight posted leaving LAX at 9:45pm to Oakland (same are as SFO). I asked to be put on that flight but they would not do it - saying that was 2 legs and I only had 1 leg of my flight left. I had to pay $305 ($400 CAD) for 1 way to OAK, as flight was leaving and decision had to be made. Terrible
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'SFO to YYC via LAX', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: P Yeung
reviewBody: Used Delta Air Lines for the first time, flying from London to New York JFK in October 2015 and I was pleasantly surprised. The flight was on time, boarding was smooth. The supply of food, snack and drinks was really good. The quality of the food was pretty good and they serve pretty big portions too. The plane was a Boeing 767, seats in the economy section are pretty much standard, but more comfortable than other airlines I have used. Entertainment wise, there was a good selection of films and TV series to choose from. Overall it was a very good flight (better than my return flight with Virgin Atlantic) and I would use them again.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'LHR to JFK', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: C Perez
reviewBody: I'm submitting this review because of what I thought was outstanding friendly and helpful ground and cabin staff during this trip from Los Angeles to Cincinnati via Dallas Fort Worth. This trip was remarkable for how polite, patient, and free-from-corporate-speak the ticket agent, gate agent, and cabin crew were to me - an experience I had not had with Delta in years past. My flights were punctual and the leg room was tight, but not unreasonable.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Embraer', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'LAX to CVG via DFW', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: H Gardner
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines from Seattle to Anchorage in exit row. Delta has an unusually cramped cabin, even in First Class, so I was relieved to get the exit row. On takeoff, a strip of plastic from the overhead bin compartment fell off and hit me and the guy behind me in the head repeatedly. It was light enough that it was an inconvenience rather than a cause for alarm or injury, but it does call maintenance into question. Then the cabin crew proceeded to serve six bottles of booze to the gentleman seated next to me, despite the fact that he was visibly intoxicated after the first four. Not sure how he'd assist with the emergency exit when he was drunk enough to begin making phone calls as soon as we could see the destination in the distance and yelling obscenities into his phone. Cabin crew ignored this just as they ignored the fact that they over served him beyond any reasonable margin of error. They'd sell him six bottles of tequila, but they only came through the cabin to provide half glasses of ice with a splash of soft drink on a three hour flight. This is on par with what I've come to expect from Delta Airlines. At least I wasn't in First Class this time, and had some leg room (Delta's First Class cabin is as tightly packed as their steerage class rows.)
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 737', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'SEA to ANC', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Michiel Buenk
reviewBody: Los Angeles to Las Vegas with Delta Air Lines. Punctual, comfortable and nice crew, and the flight fulfilled my expectations. The Boeing 717 is a nice and silent plane, especially if you fly first rows. No real catering was offered, but was else can you expect on a 45 minutes flight, just drinks and snacks service. The seats are comfortable, wide and with sufficient distance to the next row. Boarding process fluent and prompt take off. The SkyClub lounge in LAX is fantastic!
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 717', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'LAX to LAS', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: M Lawday
reviewBody: Las Vegas to Atlanta with Delta Air Lines. Uncomfortable seats, cramped beyond belief and incredibly rude staff throughout the flight. The check in staff were good. Won't be flying with them again given the choice.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Las Vegas to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Chris Holloway
reviewBody: After our flight was delayed from Maui to LAX, we missed our flight. When we landed, the gate was taken so then we missed the last flight of the night. We then had to stay the night in the airport with no accommodation offered. The customer service is absolutely horrible, staff is rude. I say make them sleep on an airport floor for a night, and then tell me they're sorry for the inconvenience. Every gate attendant I dealt with has been rude and not wanting to find flights for us, and acted as though I asked them to do something that was impossible. I would never recommend flying with Delta to my worst enemy. An announcement came over they were offering $500 vouchers for people to give up their seats, when we were offered nothing for them making us miss our flights. To put icing on the cake, they removed our checked bags and now have no idea where they are. Good luck if you fly Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'LAX to CMH', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R. Saintonge
reviewBody: On the 4 flights within a week - 1st flight was delayed 2 hrs, missing the connecting flight (technical issue, we were not on board) - 2nd flight went ok - 3rd flight was delayed 3.5 hrs, missing the connecting flight (infotainment system down, we were on board and the 34 deg C heat was too much for A/C). They sent us to a luxury hotel. 4th flight was delayed 1.5 hr (they just realized that the captain had too many hours). What kind of company is this? Will not fly again with them, given a choice.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'B737', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'YUL to SDQ via JFK', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: A Bastien
reviewBody: My spouse booked this flight six weeks prior to departure. She has platinum status on Delta, but was unable to obtain an economy comfort upgrade. She was also unable to purchase economy comfort seats (none available), so we ended up in economy. As with the flight from SLC to CDG, the seats in the return CDG to SEA flight were the worst I've experienced - cramped, inadequate padding, solid armrests, and hardly any recline. This was a day flight - I didn’t sleep well the night before, and was unable to take a nap. Seat discomfort made my flight experience miserable. My spouse and I forgot to bring our seat backs to the upright position before landing at SEA, and the FAs didn’t notice. That’s how minimal the recline is. Once again, food quality had deteriorated from my last transatlantic Delta flight in January 2014. I forgot to buy take on food at CDG. Delta offered a wide selection of movies, but the free headset's poor sound quality made it impossible to enjoy them. My 1-star rating for entertainment is based on the headset’s poor sound quality. The FAs were competent and courteous, my only positive comment for this flight.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'CDG to SMF via SEA', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: K Kelvin
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines from Boston to Indianapolis, and it was just an utter mess. There was no direction given and no updates given. I have been staring at a previous flight still on-boarding, meanwhile their flight already took off. I'm highly disappointed by the quality of service. Oh and our gate just changed - for the third time.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Boston to Indianapolis', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "not allowing flight to land at LGA "
author: Olivia Messer
reviewBody: Trying to fly home to see my family. After delaying constantly for 4 hours and refusing to let us get off the plane while they wait for us to be able to take off. The pilot proceeds to promise we will take off (I don't blame the pilot). The airline said that they would not be allowing my flight to land at LGA due to a lack of space at the airport. The pilot proceeded to ask if we could land in a different airport so that our whole weekends weren't ruined. The airline basically refused to do anything to help myself and several others in the same position. To say the least I am fuming, in tears, and very frustrated with Delta Airlines. Especially since when we were leaving the airplane they were required to play the audio tape "Thanking for choosing Delta".
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'GSO to LGA', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jean Pierce
reviewBody: Richmond to Atlanta. Beware that Delta Air Lines cheaper tickets do not allow you to sit with your flying partner. You have to pay more just to fly seated together. Rip off! I will not fly Delta again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Richmond to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: John Quinteros
reviewBody: First my Delta Air Lines flight got delayed but I was able to re-book it the night before. The guy who answered my call was not very understanding and frustrated me even more. Then the morning of my flight I got there 3 hours early (3:00 am) only to be told that the flight was delayed because the captain was missing. I missed my connecting flight which meant I had to be re routed and had to wait six hours in New York. I was supposed to get to DC at 10 AM and got there at 4:30 pm. Wasted my day at the airport. Coming back, my flight was again delayed and I once again missed my connecting flight. I had to book to another flight. It was a direct flight but basically had to wait 6.5 hours at the airport for it to take off. Then my gate for the new flight got changed twice. Then my 12:22 flight got delayed again to 2:00pm or so. I was supposed to be in Montreal at noon and instead arrived at around 3:10 or so. The one positive was that the direct flight was extremely fast and made it to Montréal in an hour and 10 minutes. My carry on met the specifications but I was told to leave it on the side of the entrance of the plane because it did not fit in the overhead cabinet? So why do you give specs that do not work? That would be ok except that one of the zippers in my luggage got ripped off and there was a tear on the side of the luggage. Way to take care of my stuff guys. I admit that the staff were very nice and they tried to be understanding. I received a 50$ voucher to use at a later date but will I really use this airline again? Do I want to take a chance? How many delays can a human being take in one trip? They also gave me a 15$ voucher to eat at the airport because I had to wait so long. I understand stuff happens. I understand that sometimes things are out of people's controls. But my experience at Delta was a complete waste of time and either they are extremely incompetent or I am extremely unlucky as a traveller.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Montreal to Washington DC', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: H Brown
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines from London Heathrow to New York JFK. The seats in economy are a little cramped. My friend and I are 5ft 10 and 6f t3 and we felt squashed especially when the person in front reclined their chair. However, that was the only negative. The IFE had a good range of movies, and the food was satisfactory. The staff were very friendly and helpful. All in all, a good experience. Although, I will book exit row seats the next time. As long as you get to your destination safely, consider it a good flight.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'LHR to JFK', 'Date Flown': 'November 2014', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: M Neave
reviewBody: London Heathrow to Tampa via Atlanta return with Delta Air Lines. Only the return flight was delayed 45 minutes but captain passed through the cabin to apologise about the delay. Food was ok usual standard airline fare but choices available, beer and wine was free on the international flights. AVOD on transatlantic flights with a good choice of movies and tv shows, bit disappointed in the audio selection though and this could be improved. Flight attendants passed through the cabin regularly on drink runs offering water or orange juice. This is my fourth time flying Delta Air Lines and will continue to fly with them if their prices remain competitive,
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767 / Boeing 757', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'LHR to TPA via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: P Gona
reviewBody: Flew by Delta after a really long time. The aircraft used between SEA and Atlanta looked very new with video monitors for every seat and the mood lighting was very refreshing. The crew also greeted everyone pleasantly with a smile. All in all a much improved experience.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'SEA to TPA via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Mark Lehman
reviewBody: Flights on time, attendants very courteous and helpful. In Columbus I explained to the Delta clerk that I was scheduled for knee replacement surgery and could I get a wheelchair in Atlanta to make my connecting flight. When I arrived I was met by a very friendly lady who zipped me thru the airport to my connecting flight. I would not have made it without her. I received the same service on the way back home. All luggage on time as well.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'MD-88', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Columbus to New Orleans via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Philip Alphonse
reviewBody: Security wait times in Atlanta were 1 hour (October 3). Priority lines were empty and instead of expediting passengers with tight times, everyone was left to work through the full line. Missed flight by 1 minute, and rather than rebook me on next flight they sent me to other side of airport to get on standby. More bad service (no ability to tell me number on standby). I took another train to new flight only to find I was #4 on a full flight. Next available would be three hours later. I left and went to Southwest and bought next flight out which left 20 minutes after the standby flight. Delta service is horrific all the way through starting with gate agents, security staff (not TSA but delta gate staff - one of whom argued with me for 5 minutes on the difference between priority boarding and first. Had they been clearer maybe I would have made flight). Legroom is non existant. People not helpful. Last last last last time I ever fly this awful airline.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Atlanta to Chicago', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Patty Voje
reviewBody: This was hands down the worst travel experience in my life. Apparently the Delta Air Lines flight out of Florence was cancelled to due wind. Delta (and their partner KLM) had my flight bussed to the Pisa airport, (with no explanation, the pilot on the next flight explained). There we were told that we'd be dropped off at our plane that was "waiting" and no worries about our connecting flights in Amsterdam. There was no plane waiting in Pisa. We were dropped off with no direction in the Pisa airport parking lot, we had to go back through security and stand in lines trying to figure out which flight we were suppose to take. By the time we made it to Amsterdam the connecting flights were long gone. The KLM/Delta service people, were rude and unhelpful. They would tell us to get in a specific line, where'd we'd wait for over an hour, then they tell us to go to a different part of the airport and get in a different line. The connecting flights that were missed for some reason could not be rebooked at the airport and we were told we had to call Delta ourselves and reschedule. To which, after two attempts at 1.5 hours each spent on hold I was finally able to rebook my flight at an international calling rate of $2 an hour, so I spent over $400 just to rebook the flight. That doesn't include the rest of the costs I incurred at my two days at the airport. And of course they lost my luggage. And of course they don't care. I just keep getting transferred over to different "customer service lines" where I have to wait on hold and then repeat everything. So I still don't know where my luggage is and I have a new customer service number that I need to call tomorrow. I hate Delta and KLM and I will try to avoid these airlines if at all possible in the future.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Florence to Minneapolis', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Wayne Bellert
reviewBody: This is by far the worst service and flying experience and I will never fly Delta Air Lines again. The baggage clerks are rude. When I made my flight reservation I said I need an aisle or window seat and the phone clerk said there is plenty of seats. Come to find when I check in it won't let me change my seats and no one can seem to help me. On top of all that I had to pay 235$ for my two bags. My advice to anyone thinking about booking with Delta is not to - Southwest are cheaper and all around more comfortable and easier to fly.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Boston to Sacramento', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "last time I fly Delta Air Lines"
author: Michael Tippett
reviewBody: We were held up in Nashville for an hour and we were forced to miss our connecting Delta Air Lines flight to Phoenix. On board the flight attendant assured us that the company would put us upon a hotel for the night. They didn't and they would pay for it either. First and last time I fly Delta Air Lines.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Nashville to Phoenix', 'Date Flown': 'October 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: N Van Der Heyden
reviewBody: I have flown Delta thinking that they were the best. Until my flight from LAX to SLC was rerouted to Grand Junction where we sat on the tarmac for 3 hours. I know they cannot help weather, which is not what upsets me. It is that once I finally landed in SLC my next flight to Billings had just taken off.  Again, I know not something they can help. At this point everything for the next 24 hours was booked, there wasn't even a hotel they could get me in for the night. Again, not something that they can control.  So I rented a car and drove through the night on my own accord and expense. The complaint is that when I went to get the ticket refunded I called customer service before even leaving the airport while the flight to Billings was in the air and they insisted that I needed to wait until I completed my flight back to Honolulu before anything could be done. So 2 weeks later, I get back and make a call. Somehow it says that I flew the flight. Every person I called said that they couldn't do anything and gave me another number to call or sent me to the airport. It took me another 2 weeks of calling everyday to find someone who had any idea and knowledge on what to do. I have people telling me to go to the airport and others saying there was no need to go to the airport and they were sorry I was sent there. Well the person who knew what they were talking about, sent me back to the airport and told me who to talk to. I had to get a letter from the airport stating that I didn't fly on that flight. Now, almost a month after getting that paper and 2 months after not getting on that flight, I finally get an email saying it is up for review, but I need a letter from my bank stating that it is okay to give a cash refund. I am so sick and tired of the terrible customer service and the lack of care that 99% of their workers showed. Being that I live in Hawaii, I am 6 hours behind their time, I have had to get up early on my days off just to make sure that I can get through to speak with anyone. I even had a lady say to stay up and call when they open. Oh yes, I am going to stay up till 2am my time to only be frustrated to now end so that I can sleep for 2 more hours and get up to watch children. That sounds like such a grand idea.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'HNL to Billings via LAX / SLC', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Kathleen Wilkins
reviewBody: I visited my daughter in June and the Delta Air Lines crew were very helpful and professional. I had recently had unexpected surgery earlier in the week and was having so much pain, I called and asked if I could have my flight moved up so I could go home earlier. After I gave them the information to prove my situation they were incredibly kind, and helped me move up the date. I again recently called them because I had purchased tickets for some family members and these had to be changed, and again were kind and refunded my tickets. They went above and beyond and I am very grateful for their kindness.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Salt Lake City to Omaha', 'Date Flown': 'June 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: T Hoskins
reviewBody: After booking return flights from London to New York with Virgin Atlantic, I was informed that the outward leg of our journey was a Delta Air Lines codeshare flight. I had heard bad things about Delta but my flight with them was extremely pleasant. Food service was extremely prompt, despite sitting near the back of the plane, and the attendants were helpful. Large bottles of water were handed out regularly. As a nurse I was glad to see that they had taken their passenger's health and hydration to heart. It was a much better experience than the Virgin Atlantic flight on the return journey, where I was hungry and thirsty for much of the flight, and the entertainment system crashed multiple times!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'London to New York', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Jennifer van Keuren
reviewBody: We spent $3,000 on these Delta Air Lines tickets and every flight has been very delayed. One of the delayed flights coming home made us miss our connecting flight and the service person told us it was not their fault (air traffic fault), and told us there was nothing they could do. We finally get booked for another flight 24 hours later after not having our luggage and having to buy a hotel, food, clothes, miss work to now find out they have a broken plane. We have been trying to get home now for almost 3 days. We travel all the time and have never experienced such a terrible travel experience and will never give this airline a penny every again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Denver to Zurich', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Daniel Chambers
reviewBody: We got tickets for this flight a day before departure via American Airlines, because we missed their flight and they put us on Delta. This flight to ATL was horrible, because of our seats. We got seats at the very last row next to the engines. These seats are horrible and extremely noisy. Although the flight was 1,5 hour, we were still deaf an hour after landing.  There was no inflight service by the cabin crew due to the weather conditions. I've heard this flying on multiple flights by DL. Although flight-safety is priority one, in my opinion there was no trouble with the weather to not deliver cabin service.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'MD88', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'MIA to ATL', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Daniel Chambers
reviewBody: We went up the Delta Air Lines gate agent and asked for an upgrade or the confirmation we had good seats, as we had missed a lot of sleep due to bad aircraft seats. The DL staff tried to help us out, and we ended up with a middle row (3 seats) for the two of us, which was excellent for us to get some rest on this 8 hour flight home. Boeing 767-400ER with a spacious cabin, comfortable seats, good looking interior and mostly friendly cabin crew. I didn't like the food served. From a quality standpoint it was good, but it just didn't taste good (pasta and chicken).
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-400ER', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'ATL to AMS', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: R Maccuswell
reviewBody: Philadelphia to Salt Lake City on a new Delta Air Lines A320 in Premium Economy. Seat was comfortable, plenty of leg room. Boarding not an issue. Full flight but only backpack so no big deal. Snack fine, Delta cookies, candy and drinks. FA's polite. Return was Boeing 757 from SLC to Detroit and A320 from Detroit to Philly. Again 320 was fine, the 757 was older, had not been upgraded so was pretty cramped. Service fine on all flights.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A320 / Boeing 757', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'Philadelphia to Salt Lake City', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Ryan Anderson
reviewBody: We were notified 2 hours before our boarding time that our Delta Air Lines flight was cancelled and that we had been rebooked on a flight 5 hours later. After calling a Delta representative for an explanation, she informed us that we had to talk to a "Delta representative" which required a 30 minute wait in the airport at their "special services" line. This representative told us there was nothing she could do. As a result we missed a show we had spent $200 on. After waiting 7 hours in the airport we boarded our new flight and proceeded to sit at the terminal in a 90 degree hot, full plane, for 30 minutes as they worked on repairs to the plane. They attempted to connect exterior air conditioning to the plane but that unit was also not working. After 30 minutes they told us to grab our luggage and deplane. Currently still waiting at the gate 30 minutes after we were supposed to land in Portland. Never flying Delta again!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Seattle to Portland', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

header: "Last time I will ever book with Delta"
author: Hannah Medinger
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines royally screwed my entire trip. So first time to go to Vegas and I was so excited. My friend is a platinum member with Delta so we booked our flights with Delta. Our flight was supposed to leave at 3pm and we stayed at the airport until 10pm because there was an every hour delay, finally left and came back in the morning. So one day of our trip which I was supposed to be enjoying in Vegas was lost. We come back the next morning and Delta says that we already got on the plane? We were standing right in front of the lady so we have to wait another 2 hours to get that fixed. Finally got on a plane - get to Vegas late in the day - only to find our luggage lost. So a whole day and half of our trip dealing with plane issues and then only to come to Vegas with no clothes, shoes, or anything.  Last time I will ever book a flight with Delta.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'San Antonio to Las Vegas', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Dana J West
reviewBody: I sat at GGT for 8 hrs because Delta Air Lines had a mechanical issue. No food, no proper toilet facilities, no proper seating, rude agents and zero communication. Delta provided a $15 credit per person for a dive bar across the street that ran out of food and it was the only place to purchase food. When we complained upon arrival at Atlanta 11 hours later, we were given a 7500 miles for two people.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Georgetown to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Marilyn Michalski
reviewBody: On my Delta Air Lines flight to Philadelphia from Detroit, the flight attendants were excellent - attentive to passenger needs, upbeat and proactive. Their in-flight review of safety procedures contained a bit of humor, which we enjoyed. During the flight I accidentally pushed the "call button" - but I was helped to find the reading light in the dark and there was no criticism. A pleasant experience, after I had been humbled by TSA employees, who really do know how to make flying unpleasant. I cannot recall the names of these flight attendants, but I was on flight DL1749 on Sept. 19, 2015. Thanks!
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'DTW to PHL', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "never again will I book a Delta flight"
author: Jason D Monk
reviewBody: Arrived at airport at 3.50 am to find out the flight was "delayed" until 4pm later that day, because the plane did not come in the night before. No notification just let us get up and drive to the airport at 3:50am. After some time on the phone we managed to get a milk run to Salt Lake city taking three different flights to get there and only arriving 2 hours later than originally anticipated. Not so bad considering we spent 17 hours traveling from Halifax to Salt Lake. Return flight, they get us to Mey York on time but the connector home is delayed again another three hours. No compensation. Nothing. Lots of I am sorry but this company doesn't value customers time consistently. Claiming weather is the problem in Washington when we are leaving NYC for Halifax and the weather is fine in both spots. I don't understand what Washington rain has to do with it. Very frustrated. My last flight with Delta was the same, lost a days vacation at Walt Disney for a family of five because of mechanical failure and flight cancellation. They provided us 100 dollar travel vouchers each to fly Delta within 1 year that we never got to take advantage of and they expired. Never again will I book a Delta flight.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Halifax to Salt Lake City', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Jaret Rapp
reviewBody: An overall pleasant experience. I upgraded to Delta Comfort+ on the first leg of the journey and chose seats right behind first class bulkhead. There was more than ample leg room. The Comfort+ seats also recline a little further as well, and include priority boarding and free drinks. At ANC airport, there were several other airlines with lines that seemed to go on forever, I think one of them was American. There was no line for Delta and the check in agents were friendly. Flight left on time, landed in ATL on time, and our connecting fight to Miami in a different terminal also was on time. While the MD-80 on the second leg was clean, and seemed to have been refurbished, I do not enjoy flying on those older planes as the cabin pressure is horrible. All bags arrived. Overall again, a pleasant experience. Its nice that Delta serves snacks in economy as well.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-200 / MD80', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'ANC to MIA via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Liz Simmons
reviewBody: Purchased Delta Air Lines first class tickets from Portland to DC via Salt Lake, leaving at 1:39 pm. At 11:00 am Delta delayed flight so that we would be missing the connection. Their email said they would re-schedule us; the re-schedule was then supposed to be on the red eye, arriving the following day! When we went to ask if there wasn't space on an earlier flight (they had several in the afternoon, going to DC), we were told no - every seat taken. As we sat waiting in the lounge, another passenger overheard our situation and told us she had just been upgraded to first class on one of these flights and there were open seats on them. When we inquired again, the Delta rep admitted that there were in fact first class seats available on those other afternoon flights, but our first class tickets could not be transferred to these seats and they are not allowed to switch us to those seats - different code (?) I feel sorry for the employee who had to explain this embarrassing rip off to us. So after making our original itinerary impossible, Delta's "code" policy would not allow us to take available seats on the other afternoon flights, forced us to sit in the Portland airport for 12 hours and then take a red eye flight overnight and arrive 24 hours after our original check in. Nice going Delta. The statement on Delta's rescheduling itinerary form "we're dedicated to getting you to your destination as soon as possible" is not true.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Portland to Washington DC', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Clyde Wagner
reviewBody: My son and I recently flew Delta Air Lines out of Harrisburg to Atlanta, then on to Denver. This was our 3rd annual trip, previously we flew another airline, this year it was Delta. All the staff were courteous and extremely friendly and helpful. It was refreshing and I would recommend Delta and it will be our airline of choice. All of our flights arrived ahead of time.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Denver to Harrisburg via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: C Johnson
reviewBody: Afternoon flight on Delta Air Lines from Reagan National to Minneapolis. Initial departure was delayed for a half hour (I did not ask the reason). This was offset by the pleasant service I received gateside. I had a complicated route to take, and I asked to check my carry on (and lo and behold, it arrived at my final destination at the same time I did!). The flight was generally uneventful, flight attendants were courteous, the seats were comfortable. I found the A320 to be a very comfortable plane for economy class, and despite my proximity to premium economy, I didn't see them get excessively pampered. Overall, an  enjoyable trip. The plane was clean (if a bit rattly on touchdown), and I was overall comfortable.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A320', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'DCA to GFK via MSP', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Peter Pomeranze
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines from Honolulu to Los Angeles on Boeing 767-300, and as this aircraft originated in Japan we were treated to an internationally configured aircraft which provided a comfortable and wonderful flight. The crew, especially the lead, were wonderful and efficient. Food and entertainment were also very good. A positive experience.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-300', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Honolulu to Los Angeles', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: D Jacobs
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines flight from Panama to Atlanta left on time. No welcome greeting when boarding the plane as the stewardess preferred chatting with the pilots in the cockpit. The crew showed a clear lack of interest and were constantly chatting in the galley about their working conditions. They did not bother to close the separation curtain between the cabins during the flight so passengers from the main cabin were eventually queuing up for the business class toilet (why paying business fare?) Breakfast was excellent. The crew on the flight to Brussels was very friendly, very professional. Food was excellent. In spite of the old 767 plane, the business class cabin offers decent comfort, although the seats/beds are a bit cramped indeed. IFE is up to standard.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 737-800 / 767-300 ER', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Panama to Brussels via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "Purser took such great care of us
author: Niki Ball
reviewBody: We flew Delta Air Lines to New York from Manchester in August, and had a wonderful flight where we couldn't fault anything. The seats were comfortable, the inflight entertainment had everything you could want, food was great and the staff were excellent. The Purser on this flight took such great care of us.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Manchester to New York', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Teresa Cho
reviewBody: I have never been particularly impressed by any US airline but this Delta Air Lines trip to fly Seattle to Moscow via Paris takes the cake in terms of incompetence and lack of accountability. The flight was SEA-CDG-SVO and was initially meant to depart at 1:00pm. First delay was 4 hours for mechanical issues. This meant a rebooking of my connecting flight, no problem. Around 5:00pm, still no plane in sight. Around 6pm, announcement that plane was here and being prepped but needed to be fueled for the trip and the crew is about to be timed out so once the plane is ready, you better be ready to board. No problem. After more than 5 hours and only a couple of slices of cold pizza as compensation, we were ready to get out of there. Once boarded another announcement, some passengers did not board (they were the smart ones), so their bags have to be removed. One hour later, another announcement, as anticipated, crew is about to time out, solution is that we fly to MKE and change crew there (assured that there will be fresh crew in MKE - right). But then there is too much fuel on the plane, as it was meant to be a transatlantic flight. So have to remove some fuel in order to fly to MKE. An hour later, why have we not moved and why has air conditioning on the plane been turned off? They can’t figure out how to remove the excess fuel and turned off air conditioning to facilitate the removal but forgot to turn it back on! So around 9:00pm, rumors start circulating amongst the crew and those standing at the open door and gangway that the flight might be cancelled. At this point, that almost sounds like a blessing. By the time the announcement is made at 9:30pm that the flight is being cancelled, many of those in the know have already left the plane. So a mad rush to get off the plane and get rebooked and situated for the night. At time of rebooking they assure us that the same flight will be OK to go the next day at noon. Put you up at a hotel and here is a $15 meal voucher. Since its 10:00pm already, not a lot open at the airport to get a meal at. But weary and blurry-eyed, we are thankful for anything. Next day, refreshed for a night’s sleep and hopeful to finally get out of SEA, arrive at the airport again, go through the same drill, get through security, great, flight is still on time, go get coffee and walk to gate. Fellow passenger stops me mid-way to gate and tells me don’t bother, the flight has been cancelled again! Go to customer service and try to get rebooked.  Get to customer service and line is a mile long and not moving. Opt to jump on the phone and try to get a flight. Lady on the phone rebooks me on a flight SEA-MSP-AMS-SVO. That’s one more leg than I’d like but heck, get me out of SEA! It is now 11:26am, the flight to MSP is scheduled to depart at 11:30am from a gate that I have to take an airport train to get to.
