Booking agent assures me that the departure time is actually 11:50am so I have time. Finally get rebooked, rush to gate. Get there at 11:32am. Gate has closed!  Gate agent firmly states that flight was scheduled for 11:30, I am late and doors are closed. At this point, I am near tears. How do I get out of this airport?? My one piece of luck, the gate agent actually relents and reopens gate to let me on.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A330', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'SEA to SVO via CDG', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Alwaleed Althani
reviewBody: Returning home after a long holiday in the US, flying Delta Air Lines, Orlando to Amsterdam via Detroit. Departure from Orlando was delayed due to airport closure for lightning, the aircraft was an old Boeing 757-200 and age was clearly showing. There was no meal service even in first class, but the service was good, the Delta Airlines ground staff receiving the flight at Detroit were not interested in helping us with the connecting flight to Amsterdam - until one official at a different gate helped out. Detroit to Amsterdam flight was a newly refitted Boeing 767-400 with nice business class beds but the monitor screen was small and could not compare with competing airlines. I selected the vegetarian option on the food which was a cannelloni with goat cheese on a bed of spinach, a very bland and uncooked dish, the bottom half of the pasta was dry and hard  there was a sprinkle of marinara sauce - not even enough to taste let alone to moisturize the pasta. Breakfast was a cereal which was OK. IFE selection was better than average on the international sector. Both sectors had a very good WIFI connection.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 757-200 / 767-400', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Orlando to Amsterdam via DTW', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Eric Spada
reviewBody: Minneapolis–Saint Paul to Seoul Incheon, and Delta Air Lines staff and service has continued to improve over the last year. Ground staff and flight crew were all friendly and attentive. Inflight entertainment options are among the best and I like that you can access it before you are airborne and after you land and are taxiing. Seats are not comfortable especially on a transpacific flight but the added legroom of Economy Comfort is worthwhile.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'MSP to ICN', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: J Lemon
reviewBody: Overall, we were pleasantly surprised by Delta's first class service from Lafayette to Montego Bay via Atlanta. Our LFT-ATL flight was operated with a Boeing 717 that appeared to be new inside, but was in fact a refurbished aircraft. The flight attendant greeted us warmly and professionally. There were pillows, blankets and bottled water at every seat in first class. On time departure and arrival. It would have been nice to have been served a hot breakfast snack on this 6:00am departure; however, only small snacks were offered. We made a quick 40 minute connection at ATL with no problem. Our ATL-MBJ flight was operated with an older Boeing 757-200 that had some age on it but was still in good condition with regard to first class cabin. Once again, we were greeted professionally and pillows, blankets, water at every first class seat. We were also greeted with a glass of sparkling wine. The breakfast burrito was pretty good as was fresh fruit served with breakfast. Beverages were kept topped up on a regular basis. Arrived just a few minutes late and our bags were among the first off the plane.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 717 / Boeing 757', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Lafayette to Montego Bay via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

header: "Basic Economy fare allows no choice of seat"
author: Annette Davis
reviewBody: I am a long time Delta Air Lines flyer but the new Basic Economy fare allows no choice of seat. They say you can choose at check-in but there is no option to do so when you check-in online. Flew Washington DC to Atlanta, I ended up at the back of the plane for a flight which I had purchased 3 months in advance. Also, you can't use the e-pass which makes getting your boarding pass a lot more difficult.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Washington DC to Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Patrick J Minoughan
reviewBody: Delta Air Lines flight from Raleigh–Durham to Albuquerque via Atlanta was delayed 1hr 25min waiting for crew to arrive on another flight. Then came the aircraft change. I purchased a First Class ticket and was seated in seat 4B before the change. After  change I was seated in Economy Comfort seat 16C. When the flight finally left RDU seats 5B/5C were empty, yet having paid for First Class I was left in Economy Comfort seat 16C. Arrived in ATL and discovered my flight to ABQ was still there, the reason, waiting for flight crew from my flight from RDU to ATL. Rode First class ATL-ABQ, however, my 2 bags didn't ride at all. One stayed in ATL and the other took a flight to SLC. The 2 bags did arrive at 1 PM the next day. Not a happy passenger. Biggest problem with Delta was nobody cared or wanted to hear about my problem. I think I am finished with Delta.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 757-200', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Premium Economy', 'Route': 'RDU to ABQ via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: J Ludewig
reviewBody: It was good value for the money that I spent for this Delta Air Lines flight from Frankfurt to New York JFK. The new Business Elite Seats are good, the IFE seems to have some updates and run smoother than last time. You may complain that the lie-flat seat has a real narrow room for your feet, but value for money was good. I would have paid €200 more for Singapore Airlines on the same route, but I was too late. Delta is always a good option if you get a Z or J fare.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'Frankfurt to New York JFK', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Alek Perovic
reviewBody: There have been a lot of negative comments of Delta Air Lines business Elite seats and I initially thought of them as being overly critical, until I had a first hand experience on my recent flight from JFK to Moscow. The seats are narrow, but so are many other airlines. What I liked was the configuration with single seats in a zigzag pattern on either side of the plane giving privacy to single travelers. Not much storage space, though. It's the tunnel like part of the pod where one's legs go in when the seat is in full flat position. The space is so confined that it's impossible to keep the feet straight up, forcing a person to lie on one's back only, unable to bend knees, requiring a contortionist skills to attempt sleeping on the side. The feeling is actually of being forced into a very narrow coffin. I honestly could never imagine being so uncomfortable and claustrophobic on a plane. I wonder if anyone at Delta actually tested the seats before installing them, certainly would fire those responsible for the decision! It ruined an otherwise highly pleasant flight, with professional and attentive crew, good and tasty food and extensive entertainment choices.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'New York JFK to Moscow', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Daniel Mitchell
reviewBody: Flew Delta Air Lines from San Francisco to Montreal via Minneapolis/St Paul. I gave this trip 6/10 because the first flight was terrible, but the second was great. On the first flight, everything went wrong. My seat didn't recline, the flight attendants frequently ignored me, my window was stuck, there was no entertainment system whatsoever, and the flight arrived late at Minneapolis, which left me no time to get lunch. The second flight was better. The seats were spacious, the flight attendants were friendly, and best of all, my seat reclined. The only bad part is that we arrived late, yet again, but that's kind of a Delta signature move. I recommend this airline because it's a great low cost carrier for international travel, and it has never let us down before.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A320 and Canadiar 200', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'San Francisco to Montreal via Minneapolis/St Paul', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Edoardo Cappa
reviewBody: The connection was not managed by Delta but by its subsidiary Endeavor Air. The airplane was new and clean. I was skeptical about this company as it was the first time I flow it, but I have to admit it was very good. I will rate very low the ground service, thinking more about Delta than to Endeavor Air. Our original flight in the evening was cancelled and Delta did not provide any support to find an Hotel and to get at least a discounted fare.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'CRJ900', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York to New Orleans', 'Date Flown': 'April 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: M Fisher
reviewBody: We have flown Delta Air Lines a number of times for the past four years mainly due to the availability of carriers on the dates we require. We will not be booking with them again as things are getting worse. We flew from Amsterdam to Orlando via Minneapolis and again were seated separately as a family, although we booked last year. Online check in did not allow seat allocation as system not available. Staff friendly, food good all considered. On enquiring why we were seated separately we were told because we booked online via a travel agent. I have travelled with many major airlines and have never had this problem. Coming back we checked in online. All okay, phone call automated saying flight was delayed 30 mins, no problem but at check in we were told that our flight was for the next day? So we went to customer services who apologised, and after 5 hours got on a flight with a different carrier via Germany to home taking 35 hours later! I have to say this is the last straw, our flight from Australia to home last year was shorter. We will not be flying with Delta again. Very dissappointed.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Amsterdam to Orlando', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Andrea Onesti
reviewBody: Inside the Delta aircraft the cabin has been renewed, each seat has TV screen with a large selection of films (I mean films in Italian ). The seat is comfortable and it is reclining. Cabin crew is very helpful and kind, but the food is not so good. Aircraft is quiet and they give you a pair of earplugs and an eye shade. I was satisfied by Delta Air Lines.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'A330-300', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Miami to Milan via JFK', 'Date Flown': 'September 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Emma Butler
reviewBody: Excellent service with Delta Air Lines. Plane food normally isn't enjoyable but thoroughly enjoyed on this flight. Staff were friendly and wished me a happy birthday while aboard. Entertainment variety was fantastic, and I would fly Delta again. Much better than Virgin Atlantic, plenty of leg space and very clean too.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Heathrow to New York', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 5, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 5, 'Inflight Entertainment': 5, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Chelsey Marie
reviewBody: This flight with Delta Air Lines was the worst service I have received. The plane was filthy. There was trash all over the place. The flight attendant was rude. When she started to hand out beverages I asked if I could have a can of Coke and she told me that because of other incompetent flight attendants, she didn't have enough drinks and would only give me a cup. We arrived 20 minutes later than scheduled, which left us 15 minutes to catch our connecting flight out of Detroit to DFW. The pilot never let us know our gate. We were told to look at the monitor when we got off the plane. My 60 year old mother and I had to run 46 gates in 15 minutes, only to arrive at the wrong gate because it had been listed incorrectly. When we arrived at the correct gate with 7 minutes to spare, they had already closed the plane doors and were preparing to take-off. I had to make a huge scene in order for them to re-open the plane doors and let us on the flight. They finally did once I brought up that we were not late and that they were leaving early. After nearly 10 hours of horrible service, we finally arrived in New York. I will never fly Delta Air Lines again.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'DFW to LGA', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 1, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Hans Asscheman
reviewBody: Biggest problem is the transit in Atlanta. What a hell. More than 1 hour in line for passport control. Running to catch the connecting flight. Delta Air Lines staff seem uninterested, not very unfriendly. In-flight entertainment of very low quality and the touch screen hardly worked.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 747, A310', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Amsterdam to Guatemala', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: L Bayliss
reviewBody: I wasn't impressed with Delta when we flew from Seattle to London Heathrow via Minneapolis. No over the head earphones so my husband who uses a hearing aid and only has hearing in one ear could not use the entertainment system at all. The entertainment systems were very small and some touch screens didn't work very well. Mine kept blinking on and off every two seconds which made watching a film difficult. The plane was freezing cold to the point where both me and my husband were physically shivering and it meant we could not sleep on the 9 hour journey at all. We alerted staff of our discomfort several times but they ignored us and the temperature stayed the same. On the shorter flights (3 hours Seattle to Minneappolis) there are entertainment systems but you have to pay $2 for headsets to use them. We tried to purchase a snackbox on board, but they wouldn't accept cash and would only accept card, which would have meant our bank charging us fees. Despite having only one hour changeover to check in for our next flight and go through security at Seattle, we got on the flight, but the airline managed to fail to send our bags, meaning we got them 26 hours after we should on arriving home. I have experienced much better service on other economy services on other airlines.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Seattle to London via MSP', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Iain Bagwell
reviewBody: BHM-ATL was okay, short (25 mins) but had welcome drink and time for one in the air. Fairly tight connection in ATL, so I was last to board first class cabin. I could see all other passengers had welcome drinks, but no-one offered me one. When I asked I was told I was too late!  Things got worse from there. When asked what I wanted to eat the choice was steak or lasagne. I asked what came with the steak and was asked what I meant. I said I meant what comes with the steak? Not a difficult question I thought. So the FA goes back to the galley (I could see it all happen from my seat), opens a foil tray and comes back to my seat with one word - carrots! Talk about taking care of the customers. Eventually when my food arrived, sauce had been spilled all over and somehow under the tray. Not sure if this was intentional or not, but needless to say I didn't eat it! I've seen this kind of behavior before when FA's seem to vent on a customer for unknown reasons - I guess I drew the short straw on this flight. Generally I find Delta an pretty good airline, but this was not their best moment.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'MD88 / Boeing 767-300', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'BHM to SFO via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 1, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 3, 'Ground Service': 4, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 3, 'Value For Money': 3, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Rory Ayres
reviewBody: All in all, a very good flight. Yes, the aircraft is old but has been nicely retrofitted by Delta to include modern IFE (with a decent selection included), and fairly comfortable, if firm, seats (use the complimentary pillow as a backrest if you need extra comfort). I had a window seat in the 2-3-2 layout, so much less cramped than other widebody aircraft. The crew were friendly and welcoming, and delivered a full service throughout the flight. Also, great value considering it was booked just two months before. Would definitely fly Delta again.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 767-300', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'AMS to JFK', 'Date Flown': 'June 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 4, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Brian E Smith
reviewBody: I'm usually very generous with my flight reviews of Delta. I'm a Gold elite and they are the airline of choice to and from the US for me. I think my loyalty has hit a wall. The good: the flight attendants are professional and the entertainment is pretty good as is the schedule options to and from the US from Japan. The bad: old planes, hard seats in business, small AVOD screens, dirty toilets, captains constantly using toilets in business class so passengers are blocked, mediocre food. On top of this, baggage snafu in ATL caused my travel partner and I to miss our connection on the way to RDU and they would not put us on the next available flight until I threw a fit. That's customer service in the US. You have to behave badly to be treated well. I'm considering the hot Japanese carriers on my next trip where I know the food and seats are superior. By the way, my ticket from NRT to ATL was an award ticket. I cannot imagine anyone paying over $5,000 for such an inferior product.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 777-200, MD-90, and Boeing 757', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'NRT to RDU via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 4, 'Food & Beverages': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 4, 'Ground Service': 2, 'Value For Money': 4, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Steven Goldstein
reviewBody: Its been 12 years since I've flown Delta. It will be another 12 before I even consider it again. Delta was horrible 12 years ago and has only gotten worse. Seats were filthy. We were told we had to check our carry on's because there was no room in the overhead compartments. When we boarded we saw that every compartment on both sides of the aisle behind, above and in front of our seats were totally empty. We waited 35 minutes to get our luggage. I unfortunately lost my cell phone at the gate and although I filed a report have been unable to get any information regarding my property. Humans are unavailable to speak to. Damn me if I get another Delta flight.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'JFK to Salt Lake', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Thomas Mcgrath
reviewBody: Just arrived after having the worst flight I have ever been on. Delta should lose the seat outside the toilets so you don't have to have inconsiderate people trying to push you over to the next seat with their behinds. This would also make it easier for food service trolleys to get by with out taking out your shoulder.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'Minneapolis to San Francisco', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 2, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 2, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Linda J Whitehead
reviewBody: Our flight to Barbados from BOS went well with the exception of the dreadful egg wrap on the BOS-ATL leg. We were able to use the Delta lounge before departing BOS since we were in business class. On the return BGI-BOS via ATL flight, ATL Delta Lounge personnel informed us that "flights to Barbados are not considered international." Although our ATL to BOS leg was delayed over two hours (until an 11.15 pm departure), we could not use the Lounge unless we paid a $29 fee per person which we declined. Overall, our expense of flying Business or First Class to the Caribbean was not justified by the service, the food, or other amenities in the air or in the airport. Others should be aware that just because you need a passport to get into your destination, it's not Delta's definition of "international."
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Couple Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Business Class', 'Route': 'BGI to BOS via ATL', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: R Sanyal
reviewBody: Both outbound and inbound flights, in the evening/night, were more or less on schedule. What was surprising was on these 6 hours' long flights there was no food service, not even the food-for-sale, advertised on a card in the seat pocket. Yes, a packet of peanuts or pretzels were handed out. Furthermore, there was only one drinks service during the long flight. Catering really could be improved on this long, international flight. The plane was old with a minimalist entertainment system; there was a TV monitor hanging at intervals in the cabin and a movie was played. Free headsets were distributed. The crew distributed Canada immigration forms on board but did not have enough for all. I chose these flights for being non-stop but in retrospect, might have enjoyed the journey with a stop-over or flown a different carrier (e.g., Cathay Pacific) instead.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 737', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Business', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'JFK to YVR', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 2, 'Food & Beverages': 1, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 3, 'Value For Money': 2, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Sean Cashman
reviewBody: Delta is a standard airline, flight quality is average, but there customer service is so poor. I have been a Delta SkyMiles member for years and have had a few problems here and there but nothing serious until today. I tried to switch my connecting flight to New Orleans to a direct flight where there are 10 open economy seats. I was told that there were only first class seats and after showing the people at the Delta kiosk that they were wrong they got on the phone and then told me it was too late to switch even though the flight I would like to switch to does not board for two hours. The whole process took about 30 minutes and the staff was not the least bit sincere. I won't arrive into New Orleans until midnight, even though there are 10 empty seats on a flight that lands at 9.30. Terrible customer service, and genuinely poor business practices.
stats: {'Type Of Traveller': 'Solo Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'Economy Class', 'Route': 'New York to New Orleans', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 3, 'Cabin Staff Service': 3, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Inflight Entertainment': 1, 'Ground Service': 1, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 1, 'Value For Money': 1, 'Recommended': 'no'}

author: Alwaleed Althani
reviewBody: We took an afternoon flight and arrived close to midnight, though both planes were older 757-200 and did not have any personal entertainment system but you could see that the aircraft's were well maintained, the leather seats were all in good working condition and showed no age, though the food selection did not entertain vegans but the drink selection was very wide. The cabin staff were all helpful and the Internet was a huge plus. One of the nice things is we forgot one piece of cabin luggage on our first flight and we told the cabin staff of the second flight and they told operations and they transferred the piece to us so we where surorised to see it on the belt with our checked baggage.
stats: {'Aircraft': 'Boeing 757-200 both legs', 'Type Of Traveller': 'Family Leisure', 'Seat Type': 'First Class', 'Route': 'Las Vegas to Orlando via Atlanta', 'Date Flown': 'August 2015', 'Seat Comfort': 4, 'Cabin Staff Service': 5, 'Food & Beverages': 3, 'Ground Service': 5, 'Wifi & Connectivity': 4, 'Value For Money': 5, 'Recommended': 'yes'}

author: Meghann Haney
reviewBody: Delta, as a whole, was very inconsiderate of the 'paying' customers. Measly snacks, hard seats, cold cabin, and when it comes to connecting flights - forget it. We were connecting to another Delta plane, which was the last to the east coast for the night and they refused to hold the flight despite the arriving flight from Denver being delayed. The "help" they gave us was useless and to say their customer service was inconsiderate would be an understatement

author: D Kilin
reviewBody: Flight was delayed, the seats are very uncomfortable to sleep in as the headrest does not stay in place. Staff acted irritated when I asked them about this. The extra legroom seats feel very narrow, and I'm 160 lbs and 5'11". The plane was freezing the entire flight, and the entertainment system was not working for the first 2 hours of the flight. An awful experience for $850.
